betterquesting.name: §d§3§2§1§lYour first night
betterquesting.desc:
Your first task will be to find food, and a shelter for the night. The nights will be cruel, as this pack has hardcore darkness. It probably would be a good idea to collect some food now...

§lNote: You don't need to keep this book, you can use tilde to open quests without the book.
§5§5§o§o§n§m§m§n§n§l§n§e§d§c§b§a§9§8§8§7§6§5§4§r
We also maintain a wiki at §e§a§6§4https://gtnh.miraheze.org/wiki/Main_Page §rbe sure to check it out.

betterquesting.name: §1§lWhere is the flint?
betterquesting.desc: As you might have noticed, while collecting gravel, no flint dropped for you. Well, there is a... recipe for that. Look up flint in NEI and craft some!

betterquesting.name: §1§lSticks 'n Stones
betterquesting.desc: This book has a built-in reading light, lucky you! Most probably you will read this text while you are waiting for the night to be over. Once it is, go out and collect some gravel and wood. Keep in mind that you need food, so look for Pam's Harvestcraft gardens. (And save some of the vegetables for seeds!)

betterquesting.name: §1§lStorage for days
betterquesting.desc: Now that you've unlocked 3x3 crafting, it's about time to make some storage for your goods. Take some of your wood, and craft a chest. You will need 4 wood, 4 planks and 1 flint.

betterquesting.name: §1§lMain Quests and Secondary Quests
betterquesting.desc:
Now that you have made it this far notice the two new quests. See how these two quests look different? The quest with a crown is a main quest and is linked to other main quests by a thick line. You must complete the main quests to unlock the next tier. The other quest is an optional quest, and is not needed to unlock new tiers. However, optional quests often introduce you to useful items or processes.

Not all main quests have a connecting line to guide you through your adventure because of book size. If there is not an obvious linked main quest at any point, try completing some of the other main quests available to you to progress.

betterquesting.name: §1§lTools
betterquesting.desc: Now that you've got a shelter, crafting table, and a place to store your items, you should make some tools. (Unless you'd like to continue punching trees with your bare hand...)

betterquesting.name: §1§lYou reap...
betterquesting.desc:
You won't always get food rewards from this book, so it might be a good idea to take care of that problem. As you've created a hoe already, go and find some water nearby and make a field.  With this modpack you can only make farmland within range of water. Let's trade some sticks for a carrot, so you can start your own farm.

To get other wheat, use a hoe on grass away from water. You'll get Witchery seeds too, save those for later. Start planting a cotton field, it's a key early game resource.

betterquesting.name: §1§l...what you sow
betterquesting.desc: If you, by chance, did read the previous quest and planted the carrot I gave you, then you're fine. Meanwhile, you should turn some more fruits and vegetables into seeds, and increase the size of your farm to get a steady supply of food.

betterquesting.name: §1§lGet that stone
betterquesting.desc: Look at you, with your shiny flint pickaxe! Time to mine some cobblestone. Yay! (And maybe you can improve this dirt-hut too...)

betterquesting.name: §1§lFire, fire, Grandpa!
betterquesting.desc: Time to burn some stuff, isn't it? You can't make charcoal in it, but you sure will find some usage for it soon(tm).

betterquesting.name: §1§lRest in pieces
betterquesting.desc: It's GLOPPing time! Go kill some pigs to gather meat. (And yes, they will drop cooked porkchops. Now isn't that useful...)

betterquesting.name: §1§lSharpness: Over... 5...
betterquesting.desc:
It's about time to craft something more useful: A sword!

Now that you have a sword, you will get credit for monster kills in the Kill all the things tab. Watch out, monsters in this world will chew you up and spit you out!

betterquesting.name: §1§lFluffy and red
betterquesting.desc: Epic quest: Kill some sheep! (And try to get some wool, for a bed, obviously...)

betterquesting.name: §1§lSO...TIRED...MUST...SLEEP...
betterquesting.desc: Sleepy time, and the end of Tier 0. Congratulations, you've built your first hideout, and you should have a steady supply of food by now. See you again in tier 1!

betterquesting.name: §3§5§lWhat is that...?
betterquesting.desc:
You've seen a lot of trees, but there are a few that look really special. You are sure that these trees are much more than just wood to build your home with or used to get charcoal.
The best place to find them is in a Magical Forest, but if you can't find them there you can try a Garden or Cherry Wood Grove.
If you have trouble finding them, you can build a special compass in LV to help you locate the biomes.

betterquesting.name: §2§lReady, set, go!
betterquesting.desc: You probably should have a home by now. A steady supply of food is a fundamental requirement at all times. Take this journal to keep track of the things you've eaten. You will have to travel far in this tier, better be prepared!

betterquesting.name: §4§3§lBetter Tank... Iron Tank
betterquesting.desc:
Storing more than 16 buckets of fluid in one tank? Sure! Just make an iron tank or upgrade the Buildcraft tank.
Diamond tanks carry up to 64 buckets and obsidian ones are blast proof.

betterquesting.name: §2§lSand: The Gathering
betterquesting.desc: In a strange vision you saw a big structure which would allow you to make charcoal. Finally some torches! According to your calculations, you will need a lot of sand for that.

betterquesting.name: §2§lBasic processing
betterquesting.desc: Most things are unavailable at the moment, so let's begin with something simple. Take some of your cobblestone and smelt it into regular stone. Since this modpack is evil, you'll need to use wood for that. How much fun is that?!

betterquesting.name: §1§2§lMaceration v0.1 Alpha
betterquesting.desc: This fancy little device works (almost...) like a macerator. Some people say it's even better, since it does not require power, yay! You only need to craft one for this quest, but you probably should make some more if you can...

betterquesting.name: §2§lGravel: The Gathering
betterquesting.desc: Your tools will eventually lose durability. You think it would be a good idea to collect more gravel in order to provide yourself with flint for more tools. Try searching near water.

betterquesting.name: §2§lClay: The Gathering
betterquesting.desc: While bored, you thought that it might be a good idea to take up pottery. You should go and find some clay, the riverbanks should have some.

betterquesting.name: §2§lFinite water!?
betterquesting.desc:
Finite water is a problem, that's for sure. Last night, you had an idea. If you can drink cacti, you should also be able make water out of 8 cacti and use that for most recipes that require water. How cool is that? So what about another trade? 10 wood for... 3 cacti so you can setup a farm. Deal?

To automate the farm, place a string next to the cactus and a sand on top of the string. Now when the cactus grows, it will automatically break!  You can stack this horizontally and vertically to make a very efficient cactus farm.  Use water to redirect the cactus to a convenient pickup location or to above a hopper.

First player to make a base running off of only cactus water gets a cape!

betterquesting.name: §2§lSomething to carry liquids
betterquesting.desc:
You tried to move water with your bare hands, which didn't work at all. Luckily, you remember how to make a bucket out of clay dust.

Put it in a mortar to get small clay dust which can be crafted to clay dust.

betterquesting.name: §1§2§lGetting (char)coal
betterquesting.desc: It's time to get yourself some charcoal. For that, we're going to build a coke oven. Good that you just collected a lot of resources! (What a coincidence...)

betterquesting.name: §2§lAnother brick in the wall
betterquesting.desc: Your vision becomes more clear, you'll need bricks for your first multiblock structure. You think that 104 bricks should be enough. However, the bricks you'll need are somewhat special. Make sure to craft the correct ones!

betterquesting.name: §2§lForming press v0.1
betterquesting.desc: As you may have noticed, you cannot turn clay into bricks directly. Well, to be fair, it wasn't a good recipe anyway. You'll probably end up with something bread-shaped. So in order to make bricks, you need a form. Get yourself a knife and a blank pattern, and cut a brick sized piece out. It's as easy as that.

betterquesting.name: Finally, some power
betterquesting.desc: Now that you have a coke oven, you can start producing charcoal. The more, the better. Don't worry about the creosote oil; I have another deal for you...

betterquesting.name: §2§lCopper sky, Iron curtain
betterquesting.desc: With your newly acquired fuel source, you are now ready to process more advanced materials than stone or clay; Iron or copper, for example. Just in case you don't know, they spawn in rather large veins. Use the following quests to locate the most important veins.

betterquesting.name: §2§lAnother fuel source
betterquesting.desc: Lignite and regular coal are the fuel sources you'll definitely need. The latter can be turned into coal coke, which is a superior fuel source to smelt your first large batch of ore.

betterquesting.name: §2§lCopper
betterquesting.desc: Copper ingots can be created by smelting copper, chalcopyrite, or malachite ore.

betterquesting.name: §2§lTin
betterquesting.desc:
Tin ingots can be created by smelting Tin, Cassiterite, or Cassiterite Sand ore. Tin and Cassiterite ores are only found at high altitudes, but Cassiterite Sand ore is plentiful near the surface.

§5§4Tip: If you get lucky and find a high altitude Tin/Cassiterite vein, save one of the Cassiterite ore to find your Mica vein later on using the ore finder wand.

betterquesting.name: §2§lBook parts
betterquesting.desc: After you found a way to move water around, you had another brilliant idea: Paper! Paper is no longer made with sugarcane, you will now need wood pulp. You will need a lot of wood to craft wood pulp, so better grab your axe and go chop some trees.

betterquesting.name: §2§lTinker-time
betterquesting.desc: While using your flint tools is fun in terms of killing pigs and cows, they are not very good, and can't be repaired. You discovered how to craft tools that could be repaired and upgraded, but for that you definitely need a more advanced crafting technique.

betterquesting.name: §2§lAluminini...um...?
betterquesting.desc:
However it is spelled, you will need it. You can find it in chunks of gravel on the surface.

Use as little as possible and save the rest for when you get a macerator in Steam age.

betterquesting.name: §2§lMaking bronze
betterquesting.desc: Now that you've found copper and tin, you should make yourself some bronze. Use your macer... mortar to grind up some copper and tin ingots, and mix them together!

betterquesting.name: §2§lImportant tools
betterquesting.desc:
In order to craft even basic machines, you'll need new tools. Most of them can be replaced by machines later. For now, you should become familiar with each of their recipes, as you will need a lot of these tools, starting today.

Your new tools can also be used to make Railcraft water tanks, a very useful multiblock considering the finite water feature.

You want to make the non-electric versions of the screwdriver and wrench.

betterquesting.name: §2§lGetting iron
betterquesting.desc:
Iron can be found in multiple veins. 
Magnetite veins (y 30-180), 
chalcopyrite veins (y 5-60), 
and limonite veins (y 10-40) all contain iron ore.

betterquesting.name: §2§lMaking better tools
betterquesting.desc:
With aluminium and copper, you can create a pretty durable material "Aluminum Brass", which can be used to cast better tools. These can be used to mine some more advanced ores.

But first you need a smeltery. See the Multiblock Goals chapter in this book, or find smeltery blocks in a village nearby.

betterquesting.name: §2§lBetter storage
betterquesting.desc: While standard chests are good for your basic items and goods, they are not ideal for storing a large amount of ore. You should build yourself some barrels in order to keep things organized.

betterquesting.name: §2§lYou shall proceed
betterquesting.desc: As you've gathered and crafted all materials and tools you need for your basic steam machinery, you may now proceed to the next tier. Keep in mind that you'll need mountains of resources in order to craft even the simplest things, so you probably should stock up on all ores in this tier. But that's up to you.

betterquesting.name: §2§lDon't burn your fingers!
betterquesting.desc:
You have decided it's time to make some tasty pizza, but your fingers got burned badly. Reading an ancient cookbook you discovered a pair of magical items that would allow you to carry anything hot, even lava in a bucket.

§6§5The gloves have to be placed in the Baubles ring slots of Thaumcraft.

§rFor the protection effect, the hot item has to be in your active slot. I wonder if there is some way to carry more than a few buckets at a time?

betterquesting.name: §2§r§2§lCow Tipper
betterquesting.desc: Before you had to kill some pigs and sheep to complete quests. Now it's time to kill some cows and hopefully get some leather. If you are lucky and get a cow trophy you may never need to kill another cow in the future.

betterquesting.name: Cotton, cotton and more cotton
betterquesting.desc: You find out that cotton is very useful, it can be used to make string, wool, and some other useful items too. Make a small cotton plantation to get tons of it.

betterquesting.name: §3§lWelcome to Tier 1
betterquesting.desc:
Welcome, and well done so far! This tier is all about your first machines, getting more stuff from your ores and making bronze ingots in a more efficient manner.

For water, check out the Water Siding Tank multiblock in the Multiblock goals tab.

To connect up your boilers, be sure to provide water from the bottom.  Wooden pipes are fine for this.  Make sure you never run out of water - adding water to a hot boiler will cause it to explode!

Steam will come out from the sides.  Remember, steam is hot!  It will destroy wooden pipes. And it can burn you if you walk on bronze pipes full of steam.  Cover them with wooden planks or paper.

betterquesting.name: §6§lMultiblock tanks... Railcraft tanks
betterquesting.desc:
576 buckets of fluid, that should be enough to store all the creosote you have accumulated thus far. If that isn't enough you can make this tank bigger. The smallest tanks are 3x4x3 while the biggest are 9x8x9.

Hint: Fluid will auto-output (without any pumps) if you place a valve on the bottom side of the tank. You can color the tank with Buildcraft paintbrushes and the GT spray can.

Use only Buckets to move fluids because cells get destroyed.

betterquesting.name: §3§lMore advanced alloys
betterquesting.desc:
Your smeltery does a great job mixing metals into alloys, but it's not very efficient, and limited in its complexity. You need something new, so why not put your steam to some use? 

It might also come in handy when processing raw rubber. You should keep an eye on recipes to see when machines offer better options to make items...

§4NOTE: Like all steam machines, the output port doubles as a steam outlet when recipes complete. It must not be blocked. Also, steam is hot, remember? Change the output sideby whacking with a wrench. The 3x3 grid will show you which side the output will move to when you whack it.

betterquesting.name: §3§lUpgrade: High speed alloys
betterquesting.desc: Like most machines, there is a more advanced version of the alloy smelter. Keep in mind that this machine uses a lot of steam, so you better get some more boilers first. (This quest is optional)

betterquesting.name: §3§lA very important alloy
betterquesting.desc: The most important alloy (until you reach a higher tier) is undoubtedly red alloy. Fortunately, you have an alloy smelter, so grab some redstone and combine it with copper to get yourself a handful of that.

betterquesting.name: §3§lThe hell is that?
betterquesting.desc: In order to get more machines, you'll need pistons. But not those amateurish ones, you need special ones, and I shall guide you in the making of them.

betterquesting.name: §3§lMacerator v1.0!
betterquesting.desc:
Finally you are able to make a device that will replace your mortar. However, the "no-durability" feature of this device comes with a cost: You need 2 diamonds for the grinding heads.

The macerator will double your ore output. Put ores through it instead of smelting directly.

NOTE: Remember, don't block the output port and don't stand behind it.

betterquesting.name: §3§lExtracting stuff
betterquesting.desc: As you'll need rubber later to make cables from wires, you should get yourself a steam extractor. You can also use this machine to get more dyes from flowers, or process different fruits into juice.

betterquesting.name: §3§4§3§lA clear view
betterquesting.desc:
Are you still living in your dirt hut/cobble hovel? How about letting in some sunlight? Grind up some sand and flint and craft some glass dust. Put it in your smeltery and pour it into a casting basin to make clear glass.

§4Hint: In order to use it for recipes, you have to chisel it.

betterquesting.name: §3§lHammer time v2
betterquesting.desc: Using 6 ingots to craft a hammer seems pretty wasteful, as this tool has durability. How nice would it be to have a machine that does the same but without having durability and using three ingots to make two plates? Guess what, there is one! And you should totally get one.

betterquesting.name: §4§3§lCompressing stuff
betterquesting.desc: This rather simple device does a very important job: compression. It's main function is to press 9 ingots into a block, but it's also useful for a variety of recipes, for example making firm tofu.

betterquesting.name: §4§3§lUpgrade: A better compressor
betterquesting.desc: An updated version of the steam compressor. Uses more steam, but is almost twice as fast. (This quest is optional)

betterquesting.name: §3§lUpgrade: Forge hammer
betterquesting.desc: An updated version of the steam forge hammer. Uses more steam, but is almost twice as fast. (This quest is optional)

betterquesting.name: §3§lUpgrade: Extractor
betterquesting.desc: An updated version of the steam extractor. Uses more steam, but is almost twice as fast. You probably want to craft this, as the extractor does also extract your nerves... (This quest is optional)

betterquesting.name: §3§lUpgrade: Better macerator
betterquesting.desc: An updated version of the steam macerator. Uses more steam, but is almost twice as fast. (This quest is optional)

betterquesting.name: §3§lSteam alternatives
betterquesting.desc: There is more than one way to get steam for your machines. This completely optional quest shows you some alternative methods for producing steam.

betterquesting.name: §3§lUpgrade: Coal boiler
betterquesting.desc: This is basically just an upgrade to your current coal boiler, however it produces more than twice as much steam. Something you should consider building if you're planning to get some of the upgraded machines.

betterquesting.name: §3§lAnother use for Java, I mean Lava
betterquesting.desc: With a more durable steel casing, you can use lava to make steam.

betterquesting.name: §3§lThe power of the sun
betterquesting.desc:
The sun has quite a bit of power, so why not use it to produce steam? 

Fill it with water on the bottom side to produce steam. Unlike the other boilers, this only outputs steam on the output port side.

§4Hint: The solar boiler calcifies and becomes less efficient over time.

betterquesting.name: §3§lUsing steam to cook things
betterquesting.desc: A rather slow process, but it's more efficient than using a regular furnace.

betterquesting.name: §3§lUpgrade: Better furnace
betterquesting.desc: An updated version of the steam furnace. Uses more steam, but is almost twice as fast. (This quest is optional)

betterquesting.name: §3§lBlastoff!
betterquesting.desc: It's about time to make some steel. Look in the Multiblock Goals quest tab and build a Bricked Blast Furnace. Return here when you made at least 8 steel ingots.

betterquesting.name: §3§lTime for some logic
betterquesting.desc: Good news! You are now able to advance to the next tier! Bad news: You still have to craft a lot of things before you can begin. Fear not mortal, I shall guide you!

betterquesting.name: §4§3§lWired, weird?!
betterquesting.desc: One of the very basic materials which you should memorize how to craft are wires and cables. Basically you just cut a plate into a wire with your wire cutter. Not very efficient, but there will be a better way later.

betterquesting.name: §3§lYour first electronic circuit
betterquesting.desc: Steam machines are quite stupid, they just do one thing over and over again. As you advance into the electrical age, you've decided that you want the machines to have more features, like automatic output in order to create some automation. For that, you need electronic circuits.

betterquesting.name: §3§lWire-Wrap
betterquesting.desc: Placing wires without insulation seems to be a bad idea. Now that you have an extractor to extract raw rubber out of sticky resin and an alloy smelter to further process it using sulphur, you should work on getting some insulating rubber sheets.

betterquesting.name: §3§lSteam-a-licious!
betterquesting.desc: You almost made it. One last crafting step is required in order to advance to Tier 2. Keep going!

betterquesting.name: §3§lBasic crafting: Motors
betterquesting.desc: Motors are little devices that can turn electrical power into rotational energy. Very useful for all kind of machines, and not that difficult to craft. The pattern is always the same, only the materials change with tiers. For now you can use redstone to magnetize your iron rod. Later on you will build an Electromagnetic Polarizer.

betterquesting.name: §3§lBasic crafting: Rotors
betterquesting.desc: Rotors are also crafted using an identical pattern with different materials. A bit annoying to craft at the moment, but you don't need a lot of them anyway.

betterquesting.name: §3§lBasic crafting: Casings
betterquesting.desc: All machines need a hull to keep their private parts together. Good news is: They are crafted in the same way for every tier, only the materials change.

betterquesting.name: §6§6§a§9§8§7§6§5§4§3§2§1§0§3§f§k§f§l§6§lYou are not prepared!!!
betterquesting.desc:
It's time for something really big: A smeltery! There's a lot to craft, so better gather some resources...

The aluminium oreberries can be planted on cropsticks, and macerated to get small quantites of aluminium for molds if you cannot find aluminium gravel.

Note: The book says a 3x3 base, but you can make a smeltery with a smaller base.  Taller/wider smelteries can do more items at one time, conserving fuel.

betterquesting.name: §6§lThe water dilemma
betterquesting.desc:
Finite water is a problem. But fear not, there are solutions! I shall guide you to a steady supply of water. The Railcraft water siding tanks provides enough water to last the early game.

The humidity of a biome is very important and will increase the base fill rate.

If it is raining, the tank will fill much quicker.

At least one block of the water siding tank must see sky for the maximum output.

The best part is that you don't need a pump to extract water.  Tanks and pipes placed next to it will be autofilled by the water siding tank.

betterquesting.name: §6§lTime to get some steel
betterquesting.desc:
You need steel? Uhh... fine. Let's get busy...

Hint: The bricked blast furnace can share walls with other ones, just like most GT multi blocks. How will this affect the air quality though...

If you are short on Stone Dust, you can get more by macerating cobblestone.

betterquesting.name: §r§6§l§5§l§o§l§r§6§lEBF-Time
betterquesting.desc:
In order to get alumin(i)um ingots, you need an electric blast furnace. It's another very important step towards victory, so let's get started.

Getting the heating coils might be a little tricky...

§4(You need 2 LV hatches with 4A of 32V total, or 3 LV hatches with MOOOORE power if the multiblock is not fully repaired)

§rA few recipes produce CO2/SO2 as fluid. You can put an output fluid hatch to the top layer of the EBF to collect it otherwise it gets auto voided. It depends on the muffler hatch how much fluid you can recover. Max muffler recovers = 78 percent.

Moron always says - Make Muffler Moint Mup.  Or point up, anyways.

If you want a really fancy EBF, you can add more input fluid hatches and store different fluids in each one.

§4If the pollution gets really bad, check in GT++ Multiblocks for a pollution scrubber.

betterquesting.name: §6§lUpgrade #1: More heat - Kanthal Coils
betterquesting.desc: Better materials need higher temperatures. You can just exchange the old coils with the new ones. Kanthal coils let you reach 2700 K. You can even reuse the old coils in other machines, how fancy is that!

betterquesting.name: §6§lUpgrade #2: Higher tier - Nichrome Coils
betterquesting.desc: To reach the 3600k heat capacity of your EBF, so you can process high-tier materials like tungsten, you need nichrome heating coils.

betterquesting.name: §6§lCompress all the things
betterquesting.desc:
Martin's (DreamMasterXXL) favourite machine. Compress ALL the things! With explosives, of course. Boom today!

Note: You might want to put this far from your living quarters, the pollution can get high really fast.

betterquesting.name: §6§lAt the end of...
betterquesting.desc:
...the universe everything freezes eventually. But waiting for the heat death of the universe might take too long. Therefore we present you the vacuum freezer. It should be good enough to cool your hot stuff. You will need a minimum of 16 frost proof machine casings, the rest depends on your setup.

You will need to make EV circuits in a cleanroom to build this machine.

betterquesting.name: §7§6§lAn unexpected Bonus
betterquesting.desc: Because we're nice developers, we decided to add a little bonus if you happen to compress charcoal. Not only does it allow you to process more than 16 steel at a time (not in the bricked blast furnace), it also yields 10 times the burn time of a piece of charcoal. So one charcoal for free. This bonus only occurs on the first compression step. (But for fanciness, you should definitely get a quintuple one!)

betterquesting.name: §6§lHigh speed charcoal
betterquesting.desc: Sure, those coke ovens are nice, but they aren't even remotely fast enough to keep up with a large steam boiler. Luckily, there is an upgrade available! The creosote oil will not be produced, but the process will speed up dramatically. Who needs that nasty yellowish flammable stuff anyway...

betterquesting.name: §3§lWhere I can put all the liquids?
betterquesting.desc:
With your brand new alloy smelter you are able to combine two materials. What happens if you mix some obsidian dust and thickened glass? Obsidian glass, great. Your first tank that you can make would be a Buildcraft tank. This tank can carry up 16 buckets of a single fluid. It's possible to upgrade those tanks so they can hold up to 64 buckets.
You can also stack the tanks to increase capacity.

betterquesting.name: Smelt all the things stack wise...
betterquesting.desc:
...with this great invention! Uses power to smelt up to 2 stacks of items at once! Can't go any faster! 

Hint: Parallel smelting depends on coils, consult your local doctor before use.

betterquesting.name: §6§lUpgrade #3: Upgrade tier 4 - Tungstensteel Coils
betterquesting.desc: To process more advanced materials like enderium, enriched naquadah or niobium-titanium you need more than 3600K. Time to upgrade your EBF... again.

betterquesting.name: §6§lSteel multiblock tanks
betterquesting.desc:
Do you want to have tanks that can hold double the amount of the iron ones? Go ahead and make a steel tank. All sizes allowed from 3x4x3 to 9x8x9 blocks (X and Z must be the same, and odd). Just like the iron tanks, the Buildcraft paintbrush and GT spray can colorize tanks for identification. Get started on that tank farm full of lube!

Hint: Fluid will auto-output (without any pumps) if you place a valve on the bottom side of the tank - valves cannot be on an edge!

Only use buckets or large fluid cells because 1000L GT cells get destroyed.

betterquesting.name: §5§r§5§lWelcome to Tier 2
betterquesting.desc: Why, hello there! Seems you've made it into the electrical age. Don't be so quick to throw away your steam machines, you'll probably want to use them until you reach tier 3.

betterquesting.name: §6§lMV Steam Turbine
betterquesting.desc: If you decide to use steam in MV tier then it's time to build a steam turbine.

betterquesting.name: §5§lDamn you, wire cutter!
betterquesting.desc: Enough is enough. No more wasting gazillions of ingots just for a couple of wires. Now that you have power, you should go for a wiremill!

betterquesting.name: §5§lYou're gonna hate this #1
betterquesting.desc:
The first item you'll need a lot of. If you want to pull items out of chests or barrels you'll need one. 

Hint: Goes pretty well with item pipes or GT machines, adjust with a screwdriver.

betterquesting.name: §5§lYou're gonna hate this #4
betterquesting.desc:
The fourth item you'll need a lot of, and is also a pain to craft. Arguably the most painful item ever. 

§4Hint: Works like a conveyor but can work with selected item slots, adjust with a screwdriver.

betterquesting.name: §5§lYou're gonna hate this #2
betterquesting.desc:
The second item you'll need a lot. When you want to get fluid out of tanks you'll need one. 

Hint: Attach to fluid pipes or GT machines. Adjust the direction and redstone behavior with a screwdriver. Place it on the side facing the tank or machine.  When looking at a pipe or machine, you can use the grid to place it on a side already touching another thing. You can use the grid with a screwdriver to adjust a cover on that side as well.

When a GT pipe or machine has any cover, including a pump cover, wrenching the machine back into an item keeps the cover on that machine.  The cover stays with the machine in the same N S E W direction when it is placed down again. This way you can arrange pump and conveyor covers on a machine outside a tight spot and place it there. To remove covers, use the crowbar.

It can also be further upgraded into a fluid regulator that allows precise control of fluid transfer speed.

betterquesting.name: §5§lElectric macerator
betterquesting.desc: It is highly recommended to get one of these, as the efficiency in terms of coal/steam used to macerate something is a lot better when using EU.

betterquesting.name: §5§lYou're gonna hate this #3
betterquesting.desc: A piston, but more .. "electrical". The third item you are going to craft a lot of in the future.

betterquesting.name: §5§lSaving redstone
betterquesting.desc: Tired of using 4 redstone for one magnetic iron rod? Well, good news for you! The polarizer doesn't need redstone, just a little bit of power. You don't need to attach this machine to a permanent power source, it runs fine on battery power.

betterquesting.name: §5§lAvengers, assemble!
betterquesting.desc:
An absolute must have for fans of the movie. Oh, and to make all the things, of course.

§4Hint: You can use the battery slot and other extra slot in the GUI to store unused configuration circuits.

betterquesting.name: §5§lNo more filing
betterquesting.desc: Why waste a full ingot to make a rod by using a tool which loses durability and takes even MORE ingots? With this little device, all your rod-needs shall be fulfilled (for now).

betterquesting.name: Bzzz... Whoom... (Defunct do not complete)
betterquesting.desc:
Making some flawless crystals requires a precision laser engraver.
At MV level the precision laser engraver becomes more important.

betterquesting.name: §5§lPress all the things
betterquesting.desc:
With the basic forming press you can make different food items, glass arrows and some Project Red components. 

At MV/HV stage you can make rotors, various AE components and make copies of your molds and extruder shapes.

betterquesting.name: §5§lMjolnir!!! (electric forge hammer)
betterquesting.desc: Not really required, but it is a lot faster than the steam one and it can be automated. If you feel like ore washing is too slow, use this hammer. There are no recipes that require anything more than steam level to hammer something.

betterquesting.name: §5§lCutting things apart
betterquesting.desc:
An absolutely mandatory machine to have. It will cut rods into bolts, plates into casings, logs into planks, and all of that will be done with the highest possible efficiency. Totally worth it! 

§4Hint: Just add water. Later on lubricant will help it run faster.

betterquesting.name: §5§lGet ready for Tier 3
betterquesting.desc:
In order to proceed forward, you need to get aluminium. A lot of it. But for now, eight is enough to unlock this quest. Probably the best source for aluminium is clay or hardened clay from canyons, however you need an MV machine for that. So you need to find an alternative until you have enough dusts for your initial setup. Check back in your Tier 0.5 quests for hints.
Once you have the dusts, you will need to do the EBF quest in Multiblock Goals to turn the dusts into ingots.
Also check the Armor and Jetpacks tab for new unlocks.

betterquesting.name: §5§lYour magic progression
betterquesting.desc: Now that you are able to produce aluminium, you may dig into magic. If you haven't unlocked basic thaumaturgy, try to find a silverwood and a greatwood sapling.

betterquesting.name: §5§lThe missing one
betterquesting.desc: It was once said... <basdxz> But ffs, add a plate bender to the LV tier book ...and then it popped into existence.

betterquesting.name: Your first automation
betterquesting.desc: Well, probably not the first, but definitely something big! You will need a cart assembler first.

betterquesting.name: Cart modules: Power Coal
betterquesting.desc: Your cart needs power, obviously. A cart can be powered via coal, solar, or lava. But for now you have to use a simple coal engine.

betterquesting.name: Automated (un-)loading
betterquesting.desc: You can fill and empty your cart manually, but it's a lot more convenient to automate item transfer, isn't it?

betterquesting.name: Cart modules: Farming
betterquesting.desc: Unfortunately, the basic farmer can't farm anything besides wheat, carrots and potatoes. It's not expensive at all, and probably the cheapest solution to give your automated food production a nice boost.

betterquesting.name: Cart modules: Storage
betterquesting.desc: A basic cart can't hold any items, so you need to attach special chests to it.

betterquesting.name: A simple cart
betterquesting.desc: In order to create or customize your cart you need a hull to attach your desired upgrades to. The wooden one can be used for really simple applications, but to farm wheat or wood, you need at least an iron one.

betterquesting.name: Cart modules: Wood cutter
betterquesting.desc: The basic wood cutter will break after a while, but you never have to replace it. It can easily be repaired with diamonds.

betterquesting.name: §5§lBasic transport pipe
betterquesting.desc: These pipes are rather simple and won't do anything on their own. But in combination with transfer nodes, you'll soon find out how great they are. Also, given the correct upgrades, they even surpass most other transfer systems.

betterquesting.name: §5§lBasic transport: Items
betterquesting.desc: In order to transfer items, you need so called "nodes". There are some for pushing items into a pipe system, and later you'll have access to nodes that are able to pull items from attached inventories.

betterquesting.name: §5§lBasic transport: Fluids
betterquesting.desc: Just like item nodes, liquid nodes transfer... liquids. But probably the best thing: They can all utilize the same transfer pipe!

betterquesting.name: §5§lAlloy smelter
betterquesting.desc: Upgrade your steam alloy smelter to an LV one.

betterquesting.name: §5§lGotta catch 'em all
betterquesting.desc: Sure, you can use wheat/potatoes/carrots to make animals follow you back to your base, but that can be tedious. A golden lasso is a proper solution for animal transportation.

betterquesting.name: §5§lBasic monster protection
betterquesting.desc: Spawning monsters in or near your base can be annoying. Especially if you happen to get infernal creepers. Luckily, there is a good way to prevent them from spawning at all.

betterquesting.name: §3§lA quite different storage
betterquesting.desc:
Regular chests can fill up rather quickly if you happen to collect mob drops like swords and/or armor. By using a cabinet, you can store up to 270 items of the same type.  Also, it doesn't need a dolly - you can break it normally and it will retain contents. 
Perfect for storing ic2 crops, Forestry saplings, or bees!

betterquesting.name: §5§lProtect your base; Tier 1
betterquesting.desc: One needs proper protection for ones home. So why not get some turrets for safety? At the moment, 2 Turrets are available: "Potato" and "disposable item". I assume you can guess what they do and how they work...

betterquesting.name: §5§lPassive defence
betterquesting.desc: A more "passive" approach to base defence are walls and fences. But seriously, where is the fun in that?

betterquesting.name: §4§5§lTurret base
betterquesting.desc: Turrets must be placed on top of a turret base. Only the player who initially placed the base can access and configure the turret. So don't worry about people taking your ammunition.

betterquesting.name: §5§lWho needs that dirt anyway
betterquesting.desc: You probably have a ton of items floating around in your base. So why not use them to kill your enemies?

betterquesting.name: §5§lDon't play with your food!
betterquesting.desc: Use it to kill zombies instead. Does only a little damage, but hey, who cares?

betterquesting.name: §5§lUpgrading intensifies
betterquesting.desc: Your turrets probably need more space to hold more ammunition, so why not get an upgrade for that?

betterquesting.name: §6§lElectrolysing all the things
betterquesting.desc: Collected a lot of dusts since you started with macerating, washing and centrifuging ores? Until now you couldn't separate them. It's time to get all the pure and valuable materials out of them.

betterquesting.name: Project red beginning
betterquesting.desc:
Welcome to Project Red!

This quest will teach you the basics of Projectred and show you how to set up a Ghetto AE system.

The Ghetto AE system will be really useful for sorting all of your first items

First of all there are different types of pipes: 

Item Transport pipes are the most basic pipes, classified as Null-logic. They don't do anything besides connect other pipes together.
Item Transport pipes only have the ability to take items that enter it and pass them along to another connected pipe. They will NOT connect to inventories at all. In a junction where there is more than 1 possible direction, item payloads will travel in a randomly selected direction.
 
Routed pipes are the most advanced. These pipes 'communicate' with one-another to form pipe networks, in order to allow for incredibly complicated demand driven systems, with absolutely no redstone circuitry required.
 
Pressurized pipes are pipes that use a pressure based routing system where the payload travels to the closest inventory that can accept it. Finding the closest inventory is influenced by both distance and Pressure Resistance Pipes (which, to the path finder, are 1000 blocks long), but the actual path that items take is only influenced by distance.

However, in order to control the logic of the routed pipes you will need special circuit chips.

betterquesting.name: §6§lIO, IO, it's off to EnderIO we go
betterquesting.desc: You've probably used EnderIO before. It's quite useful for a lot of things. But a lot of stuff has changed here, so let's start from scratch.

betterquesting.name: §6§lMachine chassis
betterquesting.desc: All EnderIO machines still require the basic chassis, and it's almost the same recipe as before; Except that you need plates instead of ingots. But that shouldn't be a problem at all...

betterquesting.name: §6§lPortable tanks
betterquesting.desc:
Until now, you had to use buildcraft tanks to carry liquids around. Which can be a pain to do. These little tanks from EnderIO are able to push and pull liquids by themselves, as they have a built-in pump which is powered by some magic energy source. How convenient.

§4Just be careful, because it will eat water cells instead of returning them.

Pressurized tanks are twice as large.

betterquesting.name: §6§lSimple RF power: Solid
betterquesting.desc:
By simply burning coal as fuel, this machine produces RF power. Enough for a basic machine setup. This machine will also accept compressed and multiple-compressed blocks.  Want to burn for 250+ days? Also, with double or octadic capacitors the output will increase and efficiency will improve. GT wiring can convert EU to RF, but EnderIO machines can be left safely out in the rain. 

Might be useful for Genetics machines since they consume excessive power when attached to GT wiring - Forestry and EnderIO machines work fine.

betterquesting.name: §6§lSimple RF power: Liquids
betterquesting.desc: This generator requires both water as coolant, and a burnable liquid as fuel. The amount of power it produces depends on the type of liquid used.

betterquesting.name: §9§lThe power of enderman
betterquesting.desc: Elevators are nice, but they are limited to vertical teleportation, and their range is also somewhat limited. Travel anchors do not have that limitation. You can teleport from one anchor to any other within range. You can name them and even set them as private. They have a 2s cooldown.

betterquesting.name: §6§lConduits
betterquesting.desc: Probably the most awesome way to transport just anything in multiple different ways. Get some conduits of each type. Higher tiers of each exist.

betterquesting.name: §6§lYet another wrench
betterquesting.desc: The Yeta Wrench is more than just a regular wrench. While holding it, you are able to switch between conduit types, eventually allowing you to remove one specific conduit type from a bundle of many. Ctrl-Mousewheel will switch modes, also Shift-Leftclick allows you to open the configuration interface even if you don't have access to that side of the conduit.

betterquesting.name: §6§lImproving conduits
betterquesting.desc: Conduits on their own are pretty awesome, but you can do better. By using filters and speed upgrades, you gain even more control over what they do and how fast they work.

betterquesting.name: §6§lMaking things pretty
betterquesting.desc: While conduits on their own are already awesome, you can also hide them if you want. There are 2 types of facades, basic and hardened. While basic ones are simple and easy, the reinforced ones are able to withstand explosions and mining with tools. You have to use your Yeta Wrench to remove it.

betterquesting.name: §5§6§lCome to the dark side...
betterquesting.desc: ...we have cookies.

betterquesting.name: Luke, I'm your father
betterquesting.desc: With that dark steel you got, you may now craft yourself a new set of armor. While pretty basic at first, it can be upgraded later to unlock powerful features.

betterquesting.name: §6§lDark steel tools
betterquesting.desc:
There are also tools made of dark steel. Each of them can receive upgrades. Hold shift to get the tooltip which will explain what you need in order to upgrade them.

These tools can also be enchanted like vanilla tools.

The Ender will increase wither skull and ender pearl drops. It can be upgraded to teleport the player.

Dark shears can be empowered, and then will shear a large area, including leaves. Handy for clearing away that giant redwood! Maybe you will find other uses for it.

The axe, once empowered, can be recharged wirelessly while in farming station.

The pick? Well, it can mine cobalt I guess if you haven't gotten a tool capable of that yet. You could keep it around to use for base decorations if your normal pick is too fast, I supose.

betterquesting.name: §9§lVibrant Crystals
betterquesting.desc: Vibrant capacitor banks also need this magical crystal. Armor and tools can be upgraded too.

betterquesting.name: §6§lBrewing liquids
betterquesting.desc: This machine is not only capable of brewing more powerful burnable liquids, it can also be used to brew nutrient distillation, which might have further usage soon(tm).

betterquesting.name: §6§lSmelting all-joy
betterquesting.desc: This combination smelter allows you to produce fused quartz and quite clear glass of all variants.

betterquesting.name: §9§lAutomated crafting
betterquesting.desc:
You know, yet another automated crafting solution...
The left grid sets the recipe.  The center box on the left will show the output. The right item grid is where you place resources. The output products will show up on the right center box.
This machine supports automation.
You can upgrade the machine with a Double-Layer or Octadic capacitor to increase power usage and speed.

betterquesting.name: §6§lOre processing kind of...
betterquesting.desc:
The endless ware between macerators and SAG mills rages on eternal, so why does it matter which one you choose?

HV Macerators are still required for the final byproducts on many ore chains, but a SAG mill still shines through with
upgraded grinding heads! SAG mills are perfect machine for getting the most from your ores without using bees and crops.
You can get bonus outputs with tungsten grinding heads, but that doesn't mean you can dupe materials (like ingots) with it.

Plus for many of them you'll get the final output directly without any need for further processing.  Handy for processing Redstone to get Chrome!

It's great for lead, copper, tin, silver, nickel, redstone, ruby, lapis, certus quartz, and malachite ores. Other ores will give you better outputs as well if you use a good enough head.

Even coal, charcoal,bones, wheat, ender pearls, and charcoal non-ores will give bonus outputs.

betterquesting.name: §9§lTorture device
betterquesting.desc: When the subjects don't want to cooperate.

betterquesting.name: §9§lRocket fuel
betterquesting.desc: Rocket fuel are used in the future for galacticraft rockets. It does generate a lot of Power in the rocket Engine. Use your electrolyser to make some. Will generate 30720000 eu per cell.

betterquesting.name: §6§lTasty...
betterquesting.desc: Yeah, that is... Well.. You are sure it will have an usage for something... some day... eventually... maybe...

betterquesting.name: §6§lFirewater
betterquesting.desc: Not exactly what you think it is. Better to not consume that liquid. When used in the Combustion Generator, it will produce 80 RF/t.

betterquesting.name: §6§lHootch
betterquesting.desc: The lowest tier of renewable, burnable fluid. Generates 60 RF/t, but can be automated for "green" infinite power.

betterquesting.name: §6§lAutomated mob-farming
betterquesting.desc: Of course... zombies love that... disgusting liquid. While using a small amount per hit, he will attack everything that is within his range. That also includes players, so be careful. Rumors are there might be a weapon that will never break when used in this "machine"...

betterquesting.name: §6§lAnd it will never break
betterquesting.desc: By using an etheric sword, your killer joe will run.. forever. Proper enchantments are a requirement for it to be efficient, but that shouldn't be a problem.

betterquesting.name: §6§lSimple item transfer
betterquesting.desc: Translocators can only transfer items over a distance of 1 block. But they're quite cheap, and a good solution to build compact machine setups. They include a free simple item filter which can be enabled on the input or output side.  And they support multiple inputs and outputs! Glowstone will make it transfer faster - try investigating other upgrades.

betterquesting.name: §6§lSimple fluid transfer
betterquesting.desc: Just like the item translocators, the fluid ones transfer... fluids. Same restrictions apply, 1 block distance. These can also be upgraded.

betterquesting.name: §6§lHarder, stronger, faster
betterquesting.desc: No, actually not faster. But more durable than tier 1.

betterquesting.name: §6§lProtect your base: Tier 2
betterquesting.desc: Slightly better protection. Now with a real gun. No more wasting food.

betterquesting.name: §6§lTier 2 turret base
betterquesting.desc: Nothing to see here. Proceed...

betterquesting.name: §6§lSometimes, a bullet will do
betterquesting.desc: They hit hard. You have been warned.

betterquesting.name: §6§lBurn them. Burn them all!
betterquesting.desc: Hmmm, crispy bacon. What would happen if you enable neutral mobs as targeting...?

betterquesting.name: §9§lTier 4§7
betterquesting.desc: Your first hull as usual...

betterquesting.name: Paying the highest price
betterquesting.desc:
When regular magic just isn't enough, you need something... stronger. Which is paid with blood. Your blood, and maybe others.

In tier 1 you only need to place the blood altar. Plan for the configuration to grow in size

betterquesting.name: §9§lDimensional goal: Moon
betterquesting.desc:
HV is the age where you should focus on reaching the Moon, as soon as possible. You will need titanium in large quantities. 

§4Hint: more info will be found in the Space Race quest tab.

betterquesting.name: §9§lI see everything
betterquesting.desc: The inventory panel is an alternative to your (hopefully?) existing project red storage system. Just like project red, you have to connect every chest/barrel with an item conduit. In addition to that, you also have to install a "remote awareness" upgrade into every conduit side you want the panel to see.

betterquesting.name: Portable battery...
betterquesting.desc: Not exactly a "battery", more a portable access point for your life points, aka blood.

betterquesting.name: §9§lSoul eater
betterquesting.desc: Wouldn't it be great to actually make use of the intelligence or abilities a certain creature has? For example: enderman teleportation or brain capacity of a zombie for simple logic? (He doesn't use it anyway...) With this machine, you are able to bind a captured soul to an item, which can then be used in machines to improve their functionality.

betterquesting.name: §9§lA new alloy Soularium
betterquesting.desc: There are some... "Darker" uses for machines. Stuff that might be considered "magic". Anyway, for that you need a new alloy: Soularium.

betterquesting.name: §9§lExperience storage
betterquesting.desc: Dying is painful, isn't it? As your precious experience is lost. But fear not, there is a solution! By using an experience obelisk, you are now able to store all your collected experience in a safe location.

betterquesting.name: §9§lA soul vessel
betterquesting.desc: For your new machine, you need something to actually capture souls from monsters. The soul vials are reusable vessels. Just right-click any living entity to steal its soul.

betterquesting.name: §9§lThe creation of life
betterquesting.desc: By utilizing large amounts of energy, you're able to re-activate those broken spawners you may have found in the past. If you haven't, you should get one of them now.

betterquesting.name: §9§lSpecific enchantments
betterquesting.desc: Enchanting books is, just as it is for items, random. And that is annoying if you need a specific enchantment on your tool or armor. Now there is a way to actually select enchantments, for a price, obviously.

betterquesting.name: §9§lAlmost like steel
betterquesting.desc: Next-gen protection against nasty zombies, creepers and other "stuff".

betterquesting.name: §9§lProtect your base: Tier 3
betterquesting.desc: Now we're talking: Grenades! The next in big badda boom hardware.

betterquesting.name: §9§lTier 3 base
betterquesting.desc: More storage, more power, and a lot more slots for possible upgrades.

betterquesting.name: §9§lThis is relatively useful
betterquesting.desc: For... some things... maybe... At least it is fun to watch.

betterquesting.name: §9§lFire in the hole
betterquesting.desc: Ah, there is nothing like an explosion and the certainty that your enemies have been blasted into tiny pieces.

betterquesting.name: §a§lTier 5
betterquesting.desc:
The main goal here is to get a tier 2 rocket, and reach Mars. You also might want to rethink your power setup, as more and more machines will be upgraded. This quest set will teach you about a couple of options you have regarding power production.

Multiblock goals includes quests for the large gas turbine, large combustion engine, and multiblock ore drill.

betterquesting.name: *Poke*
betterquesting.desc: Time to get some blood. You will have to start with your own...

betterquesting.name: It's storage time!
betterquesting.desc: Now that you've reached the High Voltage age, you might consider starting to work on your applied energistics system. It might be small, and it might be tricky to power it at first, but it's really worth the effort. You should start by getting all 4 different inscriber patterns.

betterquesting.name: Find them all
betterquesting.desc:
There are a lot of asteroids on the surface, but there are more underground. In order to find those, you need a compass. The compass will only tell you the chunk has an asteroid in it, with your ancient ore finder wand, you can get a better idea where in the chunk the meteor is hiding.

For more details on AE2, check out https://tinyurl.com/GTNH-AE2

betterquesting.name: 16k Item Storage Cell
betterquesting.desc: Middle tier storage cell, which can contain 16,384 bytes of storage. 16,384 bytes of storage can hold 2,032 stacks of a single item, or 1,040 stacks, while holding 63 different items. The 16k storage cell uses 128 bytes of data to store a single type. When placed inside a drive or chest will consume 1.5 ae/t. Must be in an ME Drive or ME chest to be usable. You can remove the 16k ME storage component by fully emptying the storage cell, and sneak clicking it in your hand.

betterquesting.name: Fluix crystals
betterquesting.desc: Not "flux"! Even if the color is the same. You need to add redstone and netherquartz to a charged certus crystal.

betterquesting.name: Applied crafting
betterquesting.desc: Crafting can be a pain. So why not automate it?

betterquesting.name: Getting your first circuits
betterquesting.desc: Making the circuits is quite different from what you're used to, so it's advised to check NEI for the new recipes. Get 8 of each circuit for now.

betterquesting.name: Cables
betterquesting.desc:
To have access to your applied energistics network from your entire base, you'll need cables. A lot of them. For now, the basic ones will do, but eventually, you'll end up using dense cables and p2p channels. Glass and Covered cables are functionally identical, just different in looks. Each can carry 8 channels.  Quartz fibers don't carry channels but can carry energy. This is useful for providing power from your main network to independant subnetworks.

You can also color your cables - cables with different colors will not connect, so those can be used to expand network capacity by running parallel cables. Only fluix colored cables connect to all other colors. Later it will probably be more efficient to use P2P channels to jam a bunch of channels into 1.

Anchors are like covers, keeping things from connecting when you don't want them to.

betterquesting.name: Terminals everywhere
betterquesting.desc:
The ME Terminal is a HID which gives you access to an ME network's networked storage.

It has the ability to sort and search, as well as filter by using a view cell. It requires a channel to function.

Can be upgraded into an ME crafting terminal.

The ME crafting terminal is the upgraded version of the ME terminal which has an integrated crafting grid with access to an ME network's networked storage.

Like the ME terminal it also requires a channel to function.

Gives remote access to all interface pattern slots on your network separated by which type of machine they are on. It will show the type of machine in the terminal, however you can name the ME interface in the inscriber or an anvil to alter the name displayed in the ME interface terminal.

Combined with the fact that you can toggle if the interface shows up at all this gets you control over your interface terminal's display.

betterquesting.name: §a§lDimensional goal: Mars
betterquesting.desc: Mars has many new ores you need to find like tungsten, uranium and plutonium.

betterquesting.name: §a§k§l§r§a§lDimensional goal: Phobos
betterquesting.desc: A smaller goal, as the main goal is Mars. But you'll find different ores on this moon also.

betterquesting.name: §a§lDimensional goal: Deimos
betterquesting.desc: A smaller goal, as the main goal is Mars. But you'll find different ores on this moon also.

betterquesting.name: §a§lHEV Mark III protective system
betterquesting.desc:
Some things are dirty, and some things are even dangerous. You'll play with nasty stuff here, so better prepare yourself for the worst.

Some items will give you a Radiation debuff without protection. How fast you get it depends on the item. Some items will give you enormous amounts of time with it, which will kill you because there is no way to get rid of it. 

Other items will give you a general sickness with many debuffs, but not Radiation. That can be removed the normal ways, Milk, Terrawart, Aqua bees, etc.

betterquesting.name: §a§lAppropriate power
betterquesting.desc:
Whether you used magic, steam, oil or biogas for power until now, you will run into problems as you advance to higher tiers. So you need to upgrade your power grid, at least for your blast furnaces. So let's start with something more powerful: A nuclear reactor!

§4Hint:
The multiplier is set to 10x in this pack. That means your nuclear reactor is 10 times more efficient.

For some ideas on nuke setups, check out https://tinyurl.com/GTNH-Nukes

betterquesting.name: §a§lTier 2 fuel: Uranium
betterquesting.desc: Just "regular" uranium fuel, nothing special about it.

betterquesting.name: §a§lTier 3 fuel: MOX
betterquesting.desc: Highly radioactive, the most powerful fuel rod you can get. Burns twice as fast as uranium, but produces massive amounts of power. Rumors are, that peaks up to 11k EU/t are possible...

betterquesting.name: §a§lTier 1 fuel: Thorium
betterquesting.desc:
The weakest of all rods, but very easy to produce, very easy to keep cool and runs twice as long as uranium. A perfect "fission and forget" power source.

Hint:
After they are used up you can recycle them to get Lutetium which is used for make americium in the fusion reactor.
Americium is needed for top tier materials later, so start stockpiling now. Plus, you get power!

betterquesting.name: §a§lMonitoring your reactor
betterquesting.desc:
It's important to monitor your reactor (Or just fancy to have a big screen somewhere...). So now that you've gained knowledge about the available fuel rods, you can start to build yourself a power plant. Here is something to help you out.

Use the sensor kit on the block you want to monitor, then put the sensor card in the display panel.  Next select which lines of information you want to display.

betterquesting.name: §a§lIncreasing the capacity
betterquesting.desc: To unleash the full potential of your reactor, you have to attach six reactor chambers to it.

betterquesting.name: §a§lMove the heat
betterquesting.desc: Reactors heat up, well the rods do, so you need to "move the heat away" to somewhere else. You should get one of each, and try to figure out what each individual heat exchanger does, in order to figure out a good setup.

betterquesting.name: §a§lVenting heat
betterquesting.desc: You can't just move the heat around, eventually you need to get rid of it. Just like the exchangers, there are different types of vents, each of them has a certain usage you'll need to find out.

betterquesting.name: Double the fun
betterquesting.desc: Need even more power? Why not combine rods? Produces twice the amount of power (and heat, obviously) but only uses up one slot.

betterquesting.name: §a§lQuit exhaling dusts
betterquesting.desc: The QED is used for stuff like the ender quarry (yay!) and advanced mob-protection.

betterquesting.name: §a§lAdvanced mob-protection
betterquesting.desc:
Like the chandelier, the magnum torch prevents monsters from spawning. However, its range is quite big, so a single one might be enough for your entire base.

§4Don't forget, monsters can still follow you home!

betterquesting.name: §c§lAutomated mining
betterquesting.desc:
The QED enables you to assemble the most convenient device for mining: The ender quarry.

As 0lafe says, "This small black box is life-changing" and "Sympathy for the amount of dense obsidian plates you need."

Guess you better get compressing!

§4NOTE: It's best to place your quarry and markers on orevein boundaries. This way you start getting ores right away, especially from planets and the deep dark dimension.

betterquesting.name: §c§lAccelerating things
betterquesting.desc: If an ender quarry won't satisfy your needs for MOOORE. A speed upgrade is required.

betterquesting.name: Bundled AE channels
betterquesting.desc:
P2P tunnels. You will need a lot of them! These are fancy fluid/item pipes that will transport fluids or items from one "point" to "another".  Items transportered will not show up on crafting terminals etc, they just use the network as transport.

They can also pack up to 32 channels into 1 bundle and transport those to the destination p2p bus.  Each P2P tunnel requires 1 free channel. The network carrying the P2P must be separate from the network with the channels. These P2P connections cannot be nested, but one transport cable can carry multiple P2P connections.

A nice online guide can be found at https://tinyurl.com/GTNH-AE2 under P2P tunnels.

betterquesting.name: Load and unload the rocket
betterquesting.desc: What use has an automated rocket, if you can't load and unload it with automation?

betterquesting.name: Cargo rocket: For the fun
betterquesting.desc: No need to fly to distant planets on your own, just to grab ores.

betterquesting.name: §a§lTurning A into B with C
betterquesting.desc: Molecular transforming at its finest! The most important recipe here is sunnarium.

betterquesting.name: §a§lTurret base tier 4
betterquesting.desc: Even more range, power and upgrade slots.

betterquesting.name: §a§lProtect your base: Tier 4
betterquesting.desc: The small parts for the powerful turrets.

betterquesting.name: §a§lMake love, not war
betterquesting.desc: For those who don't want to kill things. Just teleport them away, however this takes a large amount of power.

betterquesting.name: §a§lWhy grenades...
betterquesting.desc: ...when you can use rockets? Yes, rockets! They search and destroy, and go off with a huge boom.

betterquesting.name: §a§lTier 4 fence and walls
betterquesting.desc: Another upgrade for your walls. One more to go!

betterquesting.name: §a§lPulverize the Moon
betterquesting.desc: Literally. You can grind the rock of most planets, to get a chance for higher tier metal dusts. Does consume quite a bit of power, but can really help you out.

betterquesting.name: §1§b§l§1§2§3§4§5§4§6§7§8§9§a§b§c§d§e§c§b§lTier 6
betterquesting.desc:
IV-Level. You will need tungstensteel for machines. Suggested planets and moons to visit: Mars, Phobos, Deimos. 

Make sure to get a set of Tungstensteel coils for your EBF.

You should've learned "how to gregtech" by now, if not go clean up the machine craters in your base...

GT++ multiblock processing machines unlock at this tier.  Make sure you have an Alloy Blast Smelter from EV tier ready to go.

betterquesting.name: §b§lThis is the end.... ?
betterquesting.desc: Basically the "end" of the conventional tiered game play. However! This is just the start of your journey, as you'll have access to even more powerful and awesome stuff. You have proven yourself worthy, and mastered the challenges up to this Tier. Congratulations!

betterquesting.name: §b§lOn your way to Asteriods and other Tier 3 DIMs
betterquesting.desc: The next tier is defined as "Asteroids-Dimension" and "8192 EU/t machines". The machines now reached their full potential, and some asteroids may contain precious ores to improve your power generation.

betterquesting.name: §b§l"Clean" energy..?
betterquesting.desc:
Finally, a reliable and powerful source of energy for your base. And why waste your time with a 2k generator? Go for a 8k one! 

§4Hint: It's probably a good idea to wear your hazmat suit before claiming your reward...

betterquesting.name: §b§lFinal choice: Personal Dimension
betterquesting.desc: Tired of mobs in your base? Want to build somewhere... different? Probably in a personal dimension? Then this is your chance. But choose wisely; You can only pick one option.

betterquesting.name: §b§lFinal choice: Loot
betterquesting.desc: Don't need a personal dimension, eh? Well, then you'll probably be happy with some extra loot. Choose wisely; You can only pick one.

betterquesting.name: §b§lAlmost unbreakable
betterquesting.desc: Probably not required any more, but you made so many walls. So why not to get the best ones?

betterquesting.name: §b§lProtect your base: Tier 5
betterquesting.desc: Tough materials, for tough weapons. Railguns, and lasers, and... stuff. I assume you want a lot of those soon.

betterquesting.name: §b§lTurret base Tier 5
betterquesting.desc: The last one, I promise. Used for the most powerful turrets available. You wonder if they might help you take out some more... "Dangerous" enemies?

betterquesting.name: §b§lPewPew!
betterquesting.desc: Requires no ammo, but still does a ton of damage. All you need to do is feed it power, a lot of power.

betterquesting.name: §b§lRailguns, what else
betterquesting.desc: Massive power, and a wonderful sound when they fire. I recommend to use upgrades to increase range and damage.

betterquesting.name: Strange things
betterquesting.desc: You came across those weird trees, they seem to be more than just plants. You felt something... different. There is something going on, but you are not sure what exactly yet. But you're sure you'll find out very soon(tm).

betterquesting.name: Searching for answers
betterquesting.desc:
Last night you had a dream. A dimension, so strange and different, exactly like the sapling you found. You decided to go there and look for answers.

First you need a portal crystal to open it up. And no, a diamond is not enough.

betterquesting.name: See the unseen
betterquesting.desc: Everything is made of 6 primal aspects. Those aspects can be combined to form compound aspects, but in the end, there are only 6. Like the infused shards you found. You noticed that those shards start to vibrate when you bring them next to something that is made of the respective aspect. Maybe you can create a device to actually "scan" items, and reveal their compounds? This could be very useful later on.

betterquesting.name: Tables to work on
betterquesting.desc: Indeed, the idea with the bookshelf did work. Now you need a nice table to do some research on, and probably something to infuse items with vis while crafting. Maybe you should try to smite a table with your wand.

betterquesting.name: Bloody water
betterquesting.desc: By sacrificing some blood to the water spirits, they'll grant you some of their precious element.

betterquesting.name: Infused stones
betterquesting.desc: This whole place here is filled with magic. No matter where you look at, it's just everywhere. You wonder what happens to regular stone if it's exposed to large amounts of magic for such a long time. Maybe it's time to go mining?

betterquesting.name: Your first wand
betterquesting.desc: You are sure that this place will give you all the answers you are looking for! To continue, you need something to handle the magic energy called "vis". Guess it's time to craft your first wand.

betterquesting.name: Tome of knowledge
betterquesting.desc: All the things you've discovered so far, you need to write them down. But you are lazy, and you have a wand, so why not try a magical way to "write down" your research? You wonder if you could enchant a book with your wand, so that it will keep track of your progress... You should try that on a bookshelf!

betterquesting.name: Improving your wand
betterquesting.desc: Your wand does a great job in storing and releasing vis as you please. However, those iron caps are... Weak. If you don't pay enough attention to it, it might hurt the node. Maybe you should try to improve it with caps made out of a more valuable material. Like.. gold, perhaps?

betterquesting.name: Getting shards
betterquesting.desc: Now that you found all six primal types of infused stone, you need to break those up in order to get the shards. The easiest way to do that, is to throw these stones in your Forge Hammer. Later when you have a Sifter, you can sift purified ores for more shards. An autoclave can turn shard dust into a shard. Maybe there is a magical way to do the same thing?

betterquesting.name: A "greater" wand
betterquesting.desc: While doing all your research and mining of these infused stones, you had an idea how to actually use the wood of a Greatwood tree to make a new wand. Actually, it turned out to be pretty simple, but you lacked one important thing back then: vis!. The vis makes sure the wood doesn't lose it's magical conductivity while forming the rod.

betterquesting.name: Better screws
betterquesting.desc: Unfortunately, your aluminium screws don't work with the greatwood rod. Somehow, the wood seems to repel the material. Luckily, you already have a blast furnace, so you can get a better material than aluminium.

betterquesting.name: A more powerful "scale"
betterquesting.desc: The naga scales are weak, they can only hold a very limited amount of vis. You need a better, more powerful component to store vis in your wand. You've heard rumors about an evil wizard in the Twilight Forest. Maybe he has... something... that can be used?

betterquesting.name: "Stores 50 vis" wand
betterquesting.desc:
Now combine your new wand, and be more powerful than before! You have a feeling, that this new wand will come in handy very soon(tm).
Make sure you use the NEI 'U' command on the gold caps to find the correct GT:NH recipe for the wand.

betterquesting.name: Fuuuuuu...(sion)!
betterquesting.desc: Your arcane table does a great job with infusing primal vis into items while crafting. However, you feel that there must be more. What if you could infuse items with all kinds of magic aspects? The possibilities are endless...

betterquesting.name: Yet another brick in the wall...
betterquesting.desc: A magical one this time. You are on your way to infusion, and you need 8 of those in total.

betterquesting.name: Essentia cooking
betterquesting.desc:
In order to get essentia, you need to dissolve items. Obviously, you only want to dissolve those items you don't really need, and only those with essentia you need to craft things.

Make sure you keep your furnace as empty as possible. If it fills up with essentia, it can cause a large TPS drop.

betterquesting.name: Not for soup
betterquesting.desc: At least not for edible soup, but for essentia slurry. Get yourself a Cauldron and give it a solid whack with your wand. Place the netherrack under the crucible and set it on fire with the flint and steel. Now you need to fill it with water (works with pipes too = auto refill)

betterquesting.name: Balanced shards sdrahs decnalaB
betterquesting.desc: By combining all six primal aspects in a crucible, you are able to make balanced shards. They can be ground up into "Salis Mundus", an absolutely crucial thing to have, trust me!

betterquesting.name: Crystal clusters
betterquesting.desc: You, as a Thaumaturge, like shiny things. And what could be more shiny than a cluster made of those shards? You totally should get one of each.

betterquesting.name: The choice: Ignis
betterquesting.desc: In exchange for 6 clusters, I will give you this node. May it serve you well. Oh, don't place it too close to another node, or it might start to drain vis...

Lore: Second hand. But who cares?
display.Name: Used Auranode

betterquesting.name: The choice...
betterquesting.desc: By now, you should've collected a few (or a lot) of locations for aura nodes to get vis from. You  might also have noticed, that you probably are low on a certain aspect, like ordo or ignis. Well, good news. In exchange for some crystal clusters, I will give you one of my old nodes. They are all pale, but they will help you out. You may only choose one, so think twice before you make your decision.

betterquesting.name: The choice: Terra
betterquesting.desc: In exchange for 6 clusters, I will give you this node. May it serve you well. Oh, don't place it too close to another node, or it might start to drain vis...

Lore: Second hand. But who cares?
display.Name: Used Auranode

betterquesting.name: The choice: Perditio
betterquesting.desc: In exchange for 6 clusters, I will give you this node. May it serve you well. Oh, don't place it too close to another node, or it might start to drain vis...

Lore: Second hand. But who cares?
display.Name: Used Auranode

betterquesting.name: The choice: Ordo
betterquesting.desc: In exchange for 6 clusters, I will give you this node. May it serve you well. Oh, don't place it too close to another node, or it might start to drain vis...

Lore: Second hand. But who cares?
display.Name: Used Auranode

betterquesting.name: The choice: Aqua
betterquesting.desc: In exchange for 6 clusters, I will give you this node. May it serve you well. Oh, don't place it too close to another node, or it might start to drain vis...

Lore: Second hand. But who cares?
display.Name: Used Auranode

betterquesting.name: The choice: Aer
betterquesting.desc: In exchange for 6 clusters, I will give you this node. May it serve you well. Oh, don't place it too close to another node, or it might start to drain vis...

Lore: Second hand. But who cares?
display.Name: Used Auranode

betterquesting.name: Not just for decoration
betterquesting.desc: Sure, they look pretty, but they serve a much more important purpose: Channeling vast amounts of vis and essentia. This might be useful soon(tm).

betterquesting.name: This is the end...
betterquesting.desc: ...of your apprenticeship. You have mastered all 6 primal aspects, you mastered the weak and strong infusion of essentia and vis, and you've already made your adept wand. But be warned, young one. The further you progress, the more darkness, and evil will tempt you to follow the forbidden ways of magic. I have seen things... weather changing, random teleportation, or even a Wither tearing its way into our universe right next to someone. Be careful, my friend...

betterquesting.name: Turning liquids into essentia
betterquesting.desc: What a simple idea. So many people wasted tons of buckets just to get aqua from water, or sano from milk. Why didn't they just dissolve the liquid itself? Stupid ones...

betterquesting.name: Essentia filtering
betterquesting.desc: This nifty little device will filter out essentia. Once it has received a single unit of any type, it will only accept this type until it is completely empty. How convenient. You can place more than one on top of an alchemical furnace.

betterquesting.name: An alternative to torches
betterquesting.desc: And lava! It's an excellent magical heat source.

betterquesting.name: Not coal
betterquesting.desc: Way better. To be fair, it's a waste to use coal itself, but it also works with charcoal and lignite dust. And it speeds up the dissolving of items in an alchemical furnace.

betterquesting.name: Save the squids, we must
betterquesting.desc:
A very convenient way to make PETA activists happy and get ink at the same time. 

Hint: The essentia in those roses might be useful...

betterquesting.name: Infinite... lava?
betterquesting.desc: Well, it does need some ignis centi-vis, but hey, it's free.

betterquesting.name: Infinite water!
betterquesting.desc: The struggle is over. You finally discovered a way to get infinite amounts of water.

betterquesting.name: Adept thaumaturgy
betterquesting.desc: I have mastered the basics. Master warned me about forbidden magic, but it sounds so promising. I think a bit of forbidden stuff can't hurt...

betterquesting.name: An awesome magic conductor
betterquesting.desc: These tears, WOW! I've never felt something so strong. Could it be? Could I use those to actually finalize my Silverwood wand?

betterquesting.name: An even better conductor?
betterquesting.desc: More... I want MOOORE! There must be something even stronger than the hydra. Something older, more ancient.

betterquesting.name: It doesn't work
betterquesting.desc: I tried to combine the lich bones I had with this new wand rod. The result: A pile of ashes. It crumbled to dust within seconds. I need a better conductor. The hydra in the Twilight Forest has the ability to regrow an entire head! Her blood must contain a large amount of magic. I guess I need a bit of that for my next wand.

Lore: It crumbled to dust within seconds...
display.Name: Lich Bone

betterquesting.name: Obsidian rod
betterquesting.desc: By using obsidian and some earth clusters, I'm able to create a magical infused rod, that will slowly recharge its own terra vis.

betterquesting.name: Creating a better wand
betterquesting.desc: This greatwood wand is nice, but it can only store 50 vis. Not enough to move nodes. My tries to use silverwood failed, but I've come across other mundane materials that I could use to make a new wand core.

betterquesting.name: More durable screws
betterquesting.desc: Those stainless steel screws don't work on these rods. Due to the huge amounts of vis those wands can carry, the screws somehow "melt" away. I need a more durable material. I guess I will try titanium next.

Lore: It.. melted..?!
display.Name: Stainless Steel screw

betterquesting.name: Quartz rod
betterquesting.desc: By using nether quartz and some order clusters, I'm able to create a magical infused rod, that will slowly recharge its own ordo vis.

betterquesting.name: Reed rod
betterquesting.desc: By using sugar cane and some air clusters, I'm able to create a magical infused rod, that will slowly recharge its own aer vis.

betterquesting.name: Blazing rod
betterquesting.desc: By using a blaze rod and some fire clusters, I'm able to create a magical infused rod, that will slowly recharge its own ignis vis.

betterquesting.name: Icy rod
betterquesting.desc: By using hardened ice and some water clusters, I'm able to create a magical infused rod, that will slowly recharge its own aqua vis.

betterquesting.name: Bone rod
betterquesting.desc: Forbidden? Pah. I don't care about headaches. By using bone and entropy clusters, I'm able to create an infused rod, that will slowly recharge its own perditio vis.

betterquesting.name: Best wand caps ever
betterquesting.desc: Of course! Thaumium! What could conduct vis better than... a magical metal?

betterquesting.name: She let go
