The low pressure boiler tank is the easiest way to store steam. The firebox needs this tank on top to produce steam. The bigger the boiler the slower it heats up, but it will produce more steam when heated up.

Extract steam by attaching a pipe to the boiler tank.

betterquesting.name: §6§lRailcraft steam power
betterquesting.desc:
As an alternative way to make steam you can use the railcraft boilers. They require at least one firebox.
More than one size is possible: (1x1 mentioned above) 2x2 and 3x3. 

Provide water and coal to the firebox. Make sure you don't run out of water or...BOOM.

Each boiler needs 1, 2 or 3 layers of tanks on top, equal to the size (1x1x1, 2x2x2, or 3x3x3).

betterquesting.name: §6§lLiquid fuelled firebox
betterquesting.desc:
Cresosote oil into steam! After you make your first steel you are able to craft a liquid fueled firebox.
Diesel, ethanol, creosote and biodiesel all work well here.

betterquesting.name: §6§lHigh pressure boiler tank
betterquesting.desc:
After you make steel you are able to craft a high pressure boiler tank. The upgraded version increases the temperature and produces more steam than the low pressure version. It will take longer to warm up, so make sure to keep it well fed!

Extract steam by attaching a pipe to the boiler tank.

betterquesting.name: §3§lBookshelves...? Ah forestry... Multiblock farms!
betterquesting.desc:
The bookshelf can only be made with wood planks, which are made in a compressor. Perhaps someone thinks this is a bit crazy...

§4This will unlock the Forestry Worktable, a great tool for keeping your crafting from driving you insane.

betterquesting.name: Forestry Basic > Advanced
betterquesting.desc: Three basic foresters lootbags give a better one = Advanced Foresters Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Forestry Advanced > Expert
betterquesting.desc: Three advanced foresters lootbags give a better one = Expert Foresters Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Space Invaders Moon > Space Invaders Mars
betterquesting.desc: Three space invaders Moon lootbags give a better one = Space Invaders Mars Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Space Invaders Mars > Space Invaders Asteroids
betterquesting.desc: Three space invaders Mars lootbags give a better one = Space Invaders Asteroids Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Novice > Adept
betterquesting.desc: Three novice lootbags give a better one = Adept Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Adept > Master
betterquesting.desc: Three adept lootbags give a better one = Master Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Master > Grandmaster
betterquesting.desc: Three master lootbags give a better one = Grandmaster Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Grandmaster > Grandmaster Unique
betterquesting.desc: Sixteen grandmaster lootbags give a better one = Grandmaster Unique Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: BM Novice > BM Adept
betterquesting.desc: Three BM novice lootbags give a better one = BM Adept Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: BM Adept > BM Master
betterquesting.desc: Three BM adept lootbags give a better one = BM Master Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Bee Basic > Advanced
betterquesting.desc: Three basic bee lootbags give a better one = Advanced Bee Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Bee Advanced > Expert
betterquesting.desc: Three advanced bee lootbags give a better one = Expert Bee Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Working table 2.0
betterquesting.desc:
A manual crafting table which remembers the last nine used recipes. Left click one of the recipes shown in the right-hand side to automatically fill in the crafting grid. Right-click to lock a memorized recipe and prevent a newer recipe from bumping it off.

Resources need to go into the internal inventory. The crafting matrix is only a visual representation.

The Forestry worktable is super-useful, and can reduce the tedium of many common jobs because you can click-drag across a row of items, and it will use tools in its own inventory to continue crafting. Specifically:
Making torches with creosote - just drag-click all your buckets into the worktable
Making fresh water for Pam's - Same as above
Making fresh milk for Pam's - Same as above
Making clay bricks - a wooden form is automatically reused
Making concrete - not tested, but would probably make this easier too.

betterquesting.name: Forestry core block
betterquesting.desc: This sturdy casing is the basis for almost all machines in Forestry, essentially being the forestry equivalent of a machine casing.

betterquesting.name: The carpenter
betterquesting.desc:
The carpenter is similar to an automatic crafting table. It has an item input slot and a storage slot for the recipes. Some recipes need an additional fluid like water, creosote, honey or molten redstone. With the carpenter you can make farmblocks, woven backpacks, bee and tree analysers and many more.

The carpenter needs power to work. You can use a GT cable or a battery box to connect to the machine or make some forestry, railcraft or buildcraft RF engines.

betterquesting.name: §5§lMolten redstone?
betterquesting.desc:
You heard that the carpenter needs some molten redstone for a few recipes. 
Converting redstone dust into a fluid requires a fluid extractor. Let's build one.

betterquesting.name: Thermionic fabricator
betterquesting.desc: The thermionic fabricator is used to craft electron tubes and stained glass. It requires redstone flux (RF) energy to run. It is your first machine made in the carpenter. Once warmed up, it needs to maintain a certain heat level to operate. The amount of power supplied will determine how much heat will be generated. If you do not supply enough power to maintain the current temperature it will slowly drop. It will continuously draw power, so disconnect it if you don't need it.

betterquesting.name: A Series of Tubes
betterquesting.desc:
Before you can craft your first farm block you need apatite tubes. Make some apatite rods first with a lathe, then use a forge hammer to join them into long apatite rods. You need golden bolts and a red alloy plate.
Put some glass or sand into your thermionic fabricator and make your first tubes.

betterquesting.name: Your first multiblock farm
betterquesting.desc:
The smallest farm you can build requires 36 farm blocks (3x4x3 - the largest is 5x4x5 or 100 farm blocks). For water input you need a valve, items go through the hatches, and to supply the farm with energy you need a gearbox. With the farm control block you can control which fields of your farm work by applying a redstone signal. Remember to put creosote in the carpenter when crafting the different farm blocks. If you need the farm to work faster, just add more gearboxes.
You can use Orchard mode to collect Pam foods and Natura products. You can even mix and match modes on the same farm - logging and collecting fruit from trees, for example.

betterquesting.name: Farm logic
betterquesting.desc: This chip is optional and more advanced. Farms can work without it. But if you want to configure your farm you will need one of them.

betterquesting.name: Change your farm circuit configuration
betterquesting.desc:
The (forestry) soldering iron is a tool used for attaching electron tubes to circuit boards in order to manipulate how an electrical engine works or to program multiblock farms. As well as upgrading the squeezer or centrifuge.
Once electron tubes have been attached to a circuit board they cannot be removed, only replaced. The circuit board is automatically crafted as soon as the basic recipe requirements are met, so it's best practice to first place your electron tubes and then add the circuit board.

The soldering iron can also be used to remove the circuit board from electrical engines, multiblock farms, squeezers and centrifuges by opening the machine's GUI and left clicking with the soldering iron on the circuit board slot.

betterquesting.name: Heating coils
betterquesting.desc: Your thermionic fabricator needs heating coils to function. So combine some magnetized (requires polariser) steel rods with some copper wire and make some.

betterquesting.name: Welcome to forestry
betterquesting.desc:
Want to make some automated farms or work with bee and tree breeding? Want the Forestry Worktable for easy recipe access? Then this is the right chapter for you.

Forestry farms in Orchard mode will even fertilize, water and harvest IC2 crops on cropsticks.

betterquesting.name: §5§lMagnetize your rods
betterquesting.desc:
Magnetic steel rods need a polariser to craft. Make a few for your coils.
Mv Motors need the Polariser so better build them soon.

betterquesting.name: Finding Apatite
betterquesting.desc: It's now time to search for some ores. Apatite is the most important material in Forestry. You can make fertilizer, farm blocks and many other things. The vein is found between Y level 40-60.

betterquesting.name: Multiblock farm: Hatch
betterquesting.desc:
Farm hatch (Item pipe connectivity)

You can supply and extract items from the farm by using farm hatches that are connected to pipe systems. 

Supplying items
The farm hatch is clever enough to know which item goes where. If an item isn't appropriate for the farm's configuration, the hatch will simply reject it.

Extracting items
Any item that is harvested by the Multifarm is automatically ejected by the farm hatches into inventories or pipes. Pipes can be used to extract from other sides.

betterquesting.name: Multiblock farm: Valve
betterquesting.desc:
Farm valve (Hydration)

Some farms require water for hydration purposes. Although you can do it manually by supplying it through liquid containers (such as cans), you can also automate the process by using farm valves.

By connecting fluid pipes into the farm valve and supplying water, you can automatically fill the farm's water tank.

betterquesting.name: Multiblock farm: Control block
betterquesting.desc:
Farm control

You can control which fields of your farm work by applying a redstone signal to the control block. You can either shut down the whole farm by applying a redstone signal from top or below or you can disable a specific side by applying a redstone signal on the matching side of the control block.

betterquesting.name: Multiblock farm: Gearbox
betterquesting.desc:
Farm gearbox (Power)
To power your farm and have it automatically harvest crops, you will need at least one farm gearbox.

Farm operations can be hastened with additional gearboxes.

Each farm gearbox requires power. You can use either RF or EU.

betterquesting.name: Enhanced farm logic
betterquesting.desc: This chip is optional and more advanced than the basic one. The farms can work without them. However, if you want to configure your farm you will need one of them.

betterquesting.name: Refined farm logic
betterquesting.desc: This chip is optional and more advanced than the enhanced one. The farms can work without them. If you want to configure your farm even more you will need one of them.

betterquesting.name: Intricate farm logic
betterquesting.desc:
This chip is optional and more advanced than the refined one. The farms will work without them, but if you want to configure your farm even more you will need one of them.

Hint: The circuit assembler recipe is cheaper than the carpenter.

betterquesting.name: §3§k§l§1§2§3§lUpgrade of the upgrade of the...
betterquesting.desc:
It's upgrade time. Unlock redstone and obsidian level for your different tools.

Remember, a fresh tool head starts at one level below.  So you'll need to use it enough to level it up before you can mine at the proper level. Go strip-mine a mountain or something.

betterquesting.name: §5§lTetrahedrite, stibnite and copper
betterquesting.desc:
Maybe you are wondering why you need tetrahedrite or stibnite. Well, antimony can be centrifuged out of it which is very useful for batteries in the LV Age.
The veins can be found between Y level 80-120.

betterquesting.name: §5§lAntimony
betterquesting.desc: The most efficient way to get antimony for batteries is to centrifuge stibnite dust, the second most efficient way is to use tetrahedrite dust.

betterquesting.name: §5§lThermal centrifuge
betterquesting.desc:
A machine to get different byproducts out of your crushed and purified ore dust. This machine becomes very useful when you have reactors and want to recycle your depleted fuel rods. It's usefull for tiny piles of Gallium out of Zinc or Sphalerite Ore for your Diodes needed in good circuits.
If you can't produce the 2A of LV power for this machine right now, wait until you get to MV and use transformers to power an LV version.

betterquesting.name: Hunger, no more
betterquesting.desc: The hunger is constantly following you, consuming you, never letting you rest. The world around you is full of nourishing fruits, vegetables and crafted meals. Use them to curb your insatiable hunger.

betterquesting.name: Building made easy
betterquesting.desc: Placing blocks by hand can be tedious. Wouldn't it be nice to be able to place blocks like "Another 9 here"? Well, good news. Get yourself some of the various building blocks, and I shall reward you with something nice.

betterquesting.name: Spatial distortions
betterquesting.desc: You detected a weird disturbance in the air around an enderman, I suggest you try to steal some of their pearls and research them.

betterquesting.name: Dimensional chest
betterquesting.desc: You've heard rumors, that the endermen had built laboratories in the End. To invent new machines and weapons in order to attack the Overworld. One of their inventions is a chest, which is somehow linked to all instances of itself. Go and try to find one of those.

betterquesting.name: §6§lRF Batteries
betterquesting.desc:
Basic Capacitors are RF batteries which can store the RF power you generate. You can put many blocks together to enlarge your total battery capacity - they will merge into one battery.

You can also change the mode of each face using your wire cutters instead of the GUI. One option is a nice display of input and output RF, but it has to be taller than it is wide.

These are great for interfacing with RF machines. GT wires will convert to RF, but they send a full amp packet no matter what. Enderio machines properly accept it, but others like Genetics do not and waste most of the packet.

betterquesting.name: Slay the Eyes!
betterquesting.desc: Find and kill Ender-Eyes, guarding the Defence Towers

betterquesting.name: Ender Guardians
betterquesting.desc: Well if you decided to grind then do it... Kill some of the guardians.

betterquesting.name: Slay the Dragon. (Again)
betterquesting.desc: If you're bored, you can resurrect the dragon. Or, you could find a chaos dragon, if you dare. Anyway, kill one of those, and you'll be well rewarded.

betterquesting.name: §2§3§5§lA lead about lead that leads to lead dust
betterquesting.desc: The next step of making batteries is to collect some lead. Lead and galena veins can be found in the Twilight Forest at y levels 5 - 45.

betterquesting.name: §5§lBattery alloy
betterquesting.desc:
Mixing antimony and lead in the alloy smelter will give you some battery alloy.
Combine it with some tin cable and voila there is your small battery hull.

betterquesting.name: Lead, galena and silver
betterquesting.desc: You can't find lead, galena or silver in the Overworld or the Nether. So it's time to explore the mysterious Twilight Forest a bit and find this vein at Y level 5 - 40.

betterquesting.name: §5§lSingle use battery: Mercury
betterquesting.desc:
Mercury and acid batteries are single-use batteries. They are crafted fully charged but cannot be re-charged. Once their stored energy is depleted, they can be placed in an extractor to be converted back into small battery hulls.

They can be placed in the battery slot of any standard LV gregtech machine, in that case they will be depleted before the machine's internal EU storage. They can also be used in LV battery buffers.

betterquesting.name: §5§lSingle use battery: Acid
betterquesting.desc:
Mercury and acid Batteries are single-use batteries. They are crafted fully charged but cannot be re-charged. Once their stored energy is depleted, they can be placed in an extractor to be converted back into small battery hulls.

They can be placed in the battery slot in any standard LV gregtech machine, in that case they will be depleted before the machine's internal EU storage. They can also be used in LV battery buffers.

betterquesting.name: §5§lReusable battery: Sodium
betterquesting.desc: Sodium, cadmium, and lithium batteries are rechargeable batteries. They are crafted without stored energy, but can be charged in any gregtech machine. If unneeded, they can be placed in an extractor and converted back into small battery hulls, but their contents are lost.

betterquesting.name: §5§lReusable battery: Cadmium
betterquesting.desc: Sodium, cadmium, and lithium batteries are rechargeable batteries. They are crafted without stored energy, but can be charged in any gregtech machine. If unneeded, they can be placed in an extractor and converted back into small battery hulls, but their contents are lost.

betterquesting.name: §5§lReusable battery: Lithium
betterquesting.desc: Sodium, cadmium, and lithium batteries are rechargeable batteries. They are crafted without stored energy, but can be charged in any gregtech machine. If unneeded, they can be placed in an extractor and converted back into small battery hulls, but their contents are lost.

betterquesting.name: §5§lMercury
betterquesting.desc: Mercury can be centrifuged out of redstone. If you find some cinnabar ore in the redstone vein you can use that too.

betterquesting.name: §5§lFluid canner
betterquesting.desc:
The fluid canner is a fundamental machine, since it is necessary to move fluids around, as well as for filling tin cells, glass bottles, buckets, and even batteries. Most cases you can use the small GT++ tanks instead.

Another interesting thing about the fluid canner is that it can be transformed into a raintank, by attaching a drain cover on its top (Any machine with a tank actually can be...).

betterquesting.name: §5§lSulfuric acid
betterquesting.desc: Combining sulfur trioxide and water in the chemical reactor will give you sulfuric acid for your single use acid batteries. If you have made some light or heavy fuel already maybe you have some spare hydrogen sulfide. If not, you can always make sulfuric acid with some sulfur and water in the chemical reactor.

betterquesting.name: §5§lBattery buffer
betterquesting.desc: Batteries can be placed directly in machines. To recharge a battery you need a battery buffer. Buffers can also power an energy network. They come in different sizes: 1, 4, 9 and 16 slots. They can draw 2A and output 1A per battery inserted - watch your wire amperage!

betterquesting.name: §5§lIC2 Battery
betterquesting.desc: Some recipes require IC2 batteries. Fill your small battery hull with some molten redstone and you will get your RE-Battery. Molten cells will hurt you, so be careful.

betterquesting.name: §6§5§lHow to get sodium
betterquesting.desc: A second source for sodium is glauconite ore or glauconite sand. This type of ore vein can be found at Y level 20-50.

betterquesting.name: §5§lHow to get sodium/lithium
betterquesting.desc:
Salt ore mixes can be found in the Overworld between Y level 50-70. Salt isn't only used to get sodium, it's an important ingredient in many pam's harvestcraft food recipes.

§4Hint: Lepidolite and spodumene are good sources of lithium for your batteries.

betterquesting.name: §5§lA big meteorite
betterquesting.desc:
The best way to get rare earth is to find an applied energistics 2 meteorite and grind the blocks into dust. Maybe you completed the quest in the steam age and stored your crushed skystone somewhere? That dust can now be centrifuged into various byproducts like cadmium, neodymium, caesium, lanthanum, and yttrium.

§4Hint: Redstone has rare earth as byproduct. Chalcopyrite (at HV level) and sphalherite (at LV level) have cadmium as byproduct.

betterquesting.name: §5§lBasic canner
betterquesting.desc: The canning machine is mainly used to fill tin cans with any kind of food (HV Tier), but it is useful for filling and emptying tin cells with other solid items than food, usually in the form of dust. It can also fill batteries with sulfur, mercury, cadmium, lithium or sodium.

betterquesting.name: §3§lPacking your tanks chests and barrels
betterquesting.desc:
Packing your chests and barrels without spilling all the things (buildcraft(tm))? 
No problem! Make a dolly and you can carry your full chests, barrels or storage drawers anywhere you want. But be warned, you will get a slowness debuff so hopefully you don't have to travel very far. Not portable buildcraft and iron tanks can moved so too without loosing fluids.

§4PS Later on you can fly or make a traveller's belt to get around the debuff.

betterquesting.name: §5§lPortable mob spawners..? Cool!
betterquesting.desc: Do you want to move the spawners around and build some cool mob farms? That will be no problem if you get the diamond dolly.

betterquesting.name: Grain bait
betterquesting.desc: Crafting some nice grain bait for your animal trap.

betterquesting.name: Fruit bait
betterquesting.desc: Crafting some tasty fruit bait for your animal trap.

betterquesting.name: Veggie bait
betterquesting.desc: Crafting some veggie bait for your animal trap.

betterquesting.name: Fish bait
betterquesting.desc: Crafting some fish bait for your fish trap.

betterquesting.name: Animal trapping
betterquesting.desc: Tired of hunting for cows, zombies or sheep? You can build a trap and hope some animal or monster drops will be caught by the netting inside.

betterquesting.name: A fisherman's friend
betterquesting.desc: Have you ever tried to catch a fish with your bare hands? It's time to craft a fishing rod and get some fish the easy way. Cast your fishing rod in some water and wait until the bobber dips below the surface. Then reel back in your line and hopefully you caught yourself something nice.

betterquesting.name: Fish trapping
betterquesting.desc: Fishing can be very boring. Why not to automate it with a fish trap?

betterquesting.name: Wheat time
betterquesting.desc: It's time to plant some wheat to make some bread or to prepare grain bait for your animal traps.

betterquesting.name: Floury flurry
betterquesting.desc:
The first step in making bread is to macerate your wheat into flour with a mortar or a macerator.

Flour can be used in many food recipes for different pam's harvestcraft foods.

betterquesting.name: First handmade bread
betterquesting.desc:
Baking your dough in a Furnace makes some tasty bread.
Your first bread!

betterquesting.name: Do'h!
betterquesting.desc:
Water and flour makes a dough or two...
Dough can be used in many different food recipes from pam's harvestcraft.

betterquesting.name: Tasty toast
betterquesting.desc: Smelt your bread again and you get some toast! Give's you more nutrition points, and unlocks more culinary potential!

betterquesting.name: §5§lSulfuric naphtha
betterquesting.desc: Another distillate you can make out of oil is sulfuric naphtha with a burn value of 40,000 EU per cell in the gas turbine.

betterquesting.name: §5§lLPG
betterquesting.desc: Centrifuging some Butane or Propane gives you LPG with a burn value of 320,000 EU, the same as naphtha. Also it is a way to get methane and eventually epichlorohydrin.

betterquesting.name: §5§lNaphtha
betterquesting.desc:
You can process sulfuric naphtha to fluid naphtha which has a burn value of 320,000 EU in the gas turbine.
Naphtha is also a base product for polyethylene and polycaprolactam - a great substitute for string.

betterquesting.name: §5§lSulfuric gas
betterquesting.desc: Another distillate for your gas turbine you can make out of oil is sulfuric gas with a burn value of 25,000 EU per cell.

betterquesting.name: §5§lRefinery gas
betterquesting.desc: Refine your gas in a chemical reactor with hydrogen gas to give it a better burn value of 160,000 EU, and maybe use it to make methane gas.

betterquesting.name: §5§lMethane
betterquesting.desc: Distilling some "refinery gases" gives you some methane gas. There are many more ways to get methane.

betterquesting.name: Glider wings
betterquesting.desc: If for some reason you want to be able to jump down a cliff without getting the message "Player X fell from a high place". A great idea would be to find a way to soften your landing first. The hang glider should do that just fine.

betterquesting.name: §5§lElectrotine battery
betterquesting.desc:
The electrotine battery is exclusively used in project red machines and the jetpack.
Electrotine is a mixture of redstone and electrum dust.

betterquesting.name: Electrotine jetpack
betterquesting.desc:
Your glider gets you to the ground safely but it does not have any method to get up. After you researched electrotine you discovered that it is powerful enough for your first jetpack.
A diamond chestplate surrounded with 4 electrotine batteries is powerful enough to bring you up in the air.

It does not have a hover mode so you better take your glider with you. 

Hint: This jetpack can't fly higher than Y level 128.

betterquesting.name: Refill your jetpack
betterquesting.desc:
GREAT.... you now have an empty jetpack.
You need 25 electrotine dust to completely fill it.
Let's craft an electrotine generator and a charging bench to use the power of electrotine. 
You will very quickly discover that, while it is fast and cheap, it's empty in the blink of an eye. Despite this, it is useful in combination with the hang glider to get into the air and to get away from hairy situations.

betterquesting.name: Coal steam jetpack
betterquesting.desc:
Your coal jetpack needs coal and water to produce steam. After a short warm-up period you can go and take it for a ride. Keep in mind you will need your glider to make a soft landing.

Put your jetpack on your back and hit Shift and the adventure backpacks action-key to start it.

Max flying height for these jetpacks is the Y level of 185.

Vertical velocity decreases linearly with height after overcoming optimal height - 135 for jetpack and 100 for copter.

betterquesting.name: Copter jetpack
betterquesting.desc:
The copter jetpack is the first jetpack with a hover mode. It is using all kind of different fuel types in buckets. 
Buckets of creosote, lava, oil, cetane, diesel,ethanol, and fuel will work.
Equip your jetpack and hit Shift and the adventure backpacks action-key. You can also switch between hover and normal mode.

Max flying height is limited to Y level 200. 

Vertical velocity decreases linearly with height after overcoming optimal height - 135 for jetpack and 100 for copter.

betterquesting.name: Electric jetpack
betterquesting.desc:
Your first electrical jetpack. You need to hit the IC2 mode-switch key to toggle between normal mode and hover mode while holding down the jump key. When descending, remember to shut off hover mode or else you'll drain your jetpack.

The only limitation is that you can't fly higher than Y level 185.

For charging on the go, you can craft a charging crystal from ic2 charging components. You have to take the backpack out of the armor slot and put it in your hotbar and activate the charger by sneak-clicking. There are better models than this one old one I don't need any more. Look in NEI.

Later on GT++ Charging Packs are belts that can charge everything in your inventory including armor. Check NEI for latest recipes.

Finally, the GT++ wireless charger will charge everything in your inventory, including the jetpack, from your base at long ranges. A quest is unlocked once you finish your nanosuit. Just remember when you are off world or in the Nether that your jetpack isn't charging!

betterquesting.name: Fueled jetpack
betterquesting.desc:
This jetpack uses IC2 biogas and can fly up to Y level 245.
You can switch between hover and normal mode using the IC2 mode-switch key.

Your jetpack can be (re-)fueled in the IC2 fluid canner with 30 buckets/cells worth of biogas.

betterquesting.name: Advanced electric jetpack
betterquesting.desc:
The advanced electric jetpack is an upgraded version of the electric jetpack.
While worn in the chest armor slot and charged with EU, it allows the player to fly. It provides no armor protection, but will charge tools being used in the same manner as the advanced lappack from its 3.000.000 EU internal storage.

The advanced electric jetpack is limited to a maximum flying height of Y level 256.

betterquesting.name: Advanced nano chestplate
betterquesting.desc: Combining the advanced electric jetpack and nanosuit yields you the advanced nano chestplate. Now you have the protection of the chestplate combined with the freedom of movement of the jetpack.

betterquesting.name: Gravi suit
betterquesting.desc: The gravi chestplate is the ultimate quantum armor combined with a high powered jetpack. It also has hidden features that you need to discover while wearing the whole quantum armor.

betterquesting.name: §1§2§lIron shields
betterquesting.desc: You have been using your hide shield long enough. After you make your first tools, grab a bit of iron ore and make a nice iron shield.

betterquesting.name: §2§lStone spear
betterquesting.desc:
Upgrade your wooden spear with a stone arrowhead and iron screws to a stone spear.
This spear has better durability than the wooden one.

betterquesting.name: §3§lIron spear
betterquesting.desc:
Upgrade your wooden spear with an iron arrowhead and two steel screws to an iron spear. 
The iron spear has better durability than the stone variant.

betterquesting.name: §6§lDiamond spear
betterquesting.desc:
At MV Tier you can upgrade your iron spear to a diamond one. Get a diamond arrowhead, two stainless steel screws and a wooden spear.
This spear has superior durability.

betterquesting.name: §6§lDiamond shield
betterquesting.desc: Your iron shield got very old. With a shield made from diamond plates you can maintain block for up to 5 seconds.

betterquesting.name: §5§lBow, arrows and quiver
betterquesting.desc:
Wow, your first handmade *ehm* machine made bow. You find out that you can put the bow in the mine and blade battlegears slots. Now it's time to make a quiver and maybe some arrows. 

To place arrows in the quiver, put the quiver and the stack of arrows in a crafting grid. Make sure the Gameplay key Special is deconflicted. By default it is Z.  When you have the bow selected, use Z to swap arrow slots in the quiver.

While it seems like these might be worthless, these arrows do have special uses.  You really want to share a cookies with friends, don't you?

Let's go hunt a bit.

betterquesting.name: §5§lBasic arc furnace
betterquesting.desc: The arc furnace is an alternative to smelting stuff back into components and making wrought iron. The recipes use oxygen and 3 amperes of power.

betterquesting.name: §5§lFaster steel production
betterquesting.desc: A faster alternative to steel production is to use the arc furnace and smelt the iron ingots into wrought iron ingots. Then macerate them to dust and smelt them very fast in the EBF to steel. (Some might even dare arc furnacing the dust itself...)

betterquesting.name: §5§lLV battery buffer 9 slots
betterquesting.desc:
Upgrade your battery buffer to hold 9 batteries which allows max 9 ampere output.
Useful for your EBF and the arc furnace.

betterquesting.name: Kitchenware
betterquesting.desc:
To cook some healthy food you need a few tools crafted first.
Saucepan, 
pot, 
rolling pin, 
mortar, 
mixing bowl, 
soft mallet, 
skillet, 
knife...

betterquesting.name: Row, row, row your boat
betterquesting.desc:
You live close to the water and don't have a boat?
You need wooden planks, slabs and a knife to craft one. (This is also quest id 666, be careful, something is going on.)

betterquesting.name: Trainspotting
betterquesting.desc:
The wooden tracks can be made without any machine. Functionally equivalent to normal rails, but with a lower maximum speed (for safety reasons).

Hint: You can use your wooden rails for Steve's carts farms.

betterquesting.name: Rubber boat
betterquesting.desc: The rubber dinghy requires only a few rubber plates. Like the vanilla wooden boat, it will break and dismantle whenever it hits a surface, however instead of returning sticks and planks, it will return a damaged rubber dinghy, which can be re-crafted with two pieces of rubber back into a useable rubber dinghy!

betterquesting.name: Inflatable boot
betterquesting.desc: I meant to say boat... The inflatable boat is the first boat that doesn't break on impact with a solid block.

betterquesting.name: Carbon fiber boat
betterquesting.desc:
Unlike all other boats, this amazing carbon fiber canoe is COMPLETELY INDESTRUCTIBLE!* This means that you can smash it into as many beaches, lily pads and alligators as you like, the carbon fiber canoe won't take a scratch!

Warning: We are not held responsible for any damage caused by riding the carbon fiber canoe into a lava lake or the Void.

*Therefore, warranty is NOT included.

betterquesting.name: Electric boat
betterquesting.desc: The electric boat works mostly like a vanilla boat, chugging through the water at a decent pace. It will hopefully drop itself once you crash, which is slightly nicer than the usual sticks. That's all well and good, but what if we utilize the electric engine? Wearing an energy storage device in your chestplate slot, like a batpack or energypack, will cause the boat to drain energy from it and propel you forward at supersonic speed! Doing this will consume about 100 EU per block traveled, so even a decent batpack won't last long!

betterquesting.name: Boat shape?
betterquesting.desc:
Really? Yes for the more advanced boats you need a new shape form.
You need to make an Extruder first to progress further.

betterquesting.name: §5§lLV extruder
betterquesting.desc: The extruder is not very useful in the LV age. But it will extrude your next tier of boat, make rubber sheets more efficiently, get you extra fluid cells, or make some Tinkers Construct tool parts.

betterquesting.name: Wooden rail variants
betterquesting.desc:
The wooden junction, wye and switch tracks need an assembling machine to craft. They allow you to join and switch to tracks going to different locations.

Nei not shows the right recipe on the first page. Switch a bit through the recipes to find the right one.

betterquesting.name: Switch lever
betterquesting.desc:
The switch lever is the manual version of the switch motor, requiring a player to operate it instead of a redstone signal. 
It is used in various signaling systems, mainly to change the way switch tracks and wye tracks work.

betterquesting.name: Crowbar
betterquesting.desc:
The crowbar comes in a Railcraft and a gregtech variant. It is used to manipulate machines from railcraft, remove plates and any other covers (pumps, conveyor belts, etc.) from gregtech pipes and machines as well as breaking certain objects faster, such as tracks. This tool is also used to access certain inventories from Railcraft.
Hold a crowbar and shift + right click to attach carts. Click the starting cart then continue to click to add more carts to the link. Carts will act slower the more connections are made.

The crowbar can be used as a weapon, though it costs twice as much durability on attack (just like any other non weapon tool...).

betterquesting.name: Minecart
betterquesting.desc:
After you craft your first cart the journey can begin...
Well, not really. You will need some kind of tracks first.

betterquesting.name: Fast Food > Slow Food
betterquesting.desc: Three fast food lootbags give a better one = Slow Food Lootbag. (Since when is slow food better?)

betterquesting.name: Slow Food > Haute Cuisine
betterquesting.desc: Three slow food lootbags give a better one = Haute Cuisine Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Haute Cuisine > Dessert
betterquesting.desc: Six haute cuisine lootbags give a better one = Dessert Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Transportation Class 3 > Transportation Class 2
betterquesting.desc: Three transportation class 3 lootbags give a better one = Transportation Class 2 Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Transportation Class 2 > Transportation Class 1
betterquesting.desc: Three transportation class 2 Lootbags give a better one = Transportation Class 1 Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Wet dirt armor?
betterquesting.desc: If you don't have any armor, "mud armor" is better than nothing. Mud can be found in some wet biomes.

betterquesting.name: Wooden armor
betterquesting.desc: If you can't find mud you can make very poor armor out of wood. Cutting down a few trees to make a set should do. You will need a soft mallet too, so save a few logs for that.

betterquesting.name: Armor 2.0
betterquesting.desc: Iron armor is much better than the leather armor. Especially when you have to go outside during the night.

betterquesting.name: Leather armor
betterquesting.desc:
Killing some cows will give you enough leather to craft a complete set of leather armor. 

Hint: You are able to dye this armor.

betterquesting.name: Bronze armor
betterquesting.desc: Bronze armor has the same abilities as iron armor. Same durability, same protection and same enchantment capability.

betterquesting.name: "Nice to have" armor
betterquesting.desc: The gold armor is a "nice to have" armor. The durability is very low but you look expensive when you wear it.

betterquesting.name: "Oh shiny" armor
betterquesting.desc: Diamond armor is the best armor in Vanilla Minecraft, but over here there are much better armors available.

betterquesting.name: Fancy armor
betterquesting.desc: Not really better but fancy. The chain mail armor is made out of steel rings.

betterquesting.name: Armor 2.5
betterquesting.desc: The steel armor has more durability than the iron/bronze or chainmail armor.

betterquesting.name: Composite vest
betterquesting.desc: Combining the strength of advanced alloy plates with the steel chestplate makes your vest very hard. Now you have double the durability and increased armor points by 1.5.

betterquesting.name: §2§lFallen from the sky
betterquesting.desc:
There are big meteors everywhere and you are wondering why you need to mine them now?
Skystone is a good source of rare earth metals in the LV age. 
Inside the meteor you can find a skystone chest containing some processor press plates. Save them for later, as they are really important. Plus the chest is nice, and can be placed underneath blocks and still opened.

Hint: If your all your surface meteors have been raided, put some skystone in your orefinder to find underground ones.  Often there is a second meteor right next to the one on the surface!

betterquesting.name: §3§lOne Anvil... Better make that two!
betterquesting.desc:
With your brand-new Compressor you are able to make some metal blocks for your new anvil. Better craft two anvils, one will be required for the forge hammer.

§4With the anvil you can repair, rename and enchant armor and tools.

betterquesting.name: §6§o§1§2§3§r§r§r§r§r§r§3§4§r§o§7§7§8§9§9§5§3§1§0§r§o§m§k§c§e§l§r§1§1§r§6§lAutomation tier 1
betterquesting.desc:
Do you want to automate your smeltery because you are planning to make stacks of glass blocks? 
No problem, craft a large bronze pipe and place it under the faucet. Now the molten fluid will flow inside the pipe. Under or next to the pipe you have to place the casting basins or tables.
A hopper and a chest underneath would auto-output products. NOTE: Faucets will output precisely 144L each activation if you toggle it off immediately. That's going to have some uses later on...

betterquesting.name: §6§lAutomation tier 2
betterquesting.desc: You want a better automation than using pipes? Sure, craft a comparator and link it with redstone dust placed on the ground. The redstone needs to be adjacent to the faucet to activate the crafting process.

betterquesting.name: §6§l2x steel
betterquesting.desc: Steel production is so slow. If you got enough bricks and clay, build a second BBF. Build it attached to the first one, so they can share a wall and you will save some bricks, clay and concrete.

betterquesting.name: §6§l4x steel
betterquesting.desc: Not even two BBFs are fast enough...Can you figure out how to save the most bricks making 4?

betterquesting.name: §6§lWhy one coke oven when you can have ten?
betterquesting.desc:
Your bricked blast furnace uses coal like hell and your steam boiler too? Well it's time to make more coke ovens and automate them a bit. Wooden fluid pipes and tin item pipes will help you reach your goal.

Search NEI for a more efficient way to make coke oven bricks.

betterquesting.name: How dark can you go?
betterquesting.desc: Seriously, how dark can one be? You are sure the face in that crystal was nothing but imagination...

betterquesting.name: Ascended
betterquesting.desc: You feel empowered, light, almost like a ghost.

betterquesting.name: Tier 5 slates
betterquesting.desc: 1023 Buckets of blood in one slate! How much more I can store, oh I wish I would know. Then I add one and check if it works. 1024 buckets of blood in one slate! ... ...

betterquesting.name: Powerful shards
betterquesting.desc: The demons summoned are rather strong, but their souls contain immense power!

betterquesting.name: Tier 4 slates
betterquesting.desc: Tier 4 slates: Getting close.

betterquesting.name: §3§lAccelerated plant growth
betterquesting.desc: Plants grow very slowly, you might've discovered that by now. So why you don't counter that? A watering can will come in handy very soon.

betterquesting.name: Ethereal chalk
betterquesting.desc: Top tier chalk, for fancy wall paintings?

betterquesting.name: Archmage orb. Let them come!
betterquesting.desc: Your tier 5 orb.

betterquesting.name: Master orb: Getting close
betterquesting.desc: Your tier 4 orb.

betterquesting.name: Elemental chalk II
betterquesting.desc: Enhanced elemental chalk, to write "darker" runes than you're used to...

betterquesting.name: Tier 4 runes
betterquesting.desc: You will want both runes. Rune of superior capacity to increase the storage of your blood altar, and rune of the orb. Later it is required if you want to advance to higher levels.

betterquesting.name: Tier 5 runes
betterquesting.desc: The final frontier: There are not many runes available. The acceleration rune allows you to speed up the interaction with external tanks.

betterquesting.name: Advanced rituals
betterquesting.desc: More powerful rituals require dusk runes. With your new dusk chalk, you can enhance your ritual diviner to place those. Allowing you to perform a lot more rituals.

betterquesting.name: Highend rituals
betterquesting.desc: The last rune so far, used for the most powerful rituals.

betterquesting.name: Convocation of the damned
betterquesting.desc: Time to open a portal to the demons we're using all the time. What could possibly go wrong? (It is recommended to do this ritual on a planet, as the demon city will spread quite a bit...)

betterquesting.name: Imbued spell upgrades
betterquesting.desc: With these new shards you are able to craft the most powerful spell components. Maybe it's time to upgrade your mining spell?

betterquesting.name: §5§lFind some Certus Quartz
betterquesting.desc: The Nether is full of different kinds of quartz. For the emitter and the sensor you will need to find some certus quartz.

betterquesting.name: §4§3§5§lGood Circuits
betterquesting.desc:
Good circuits are an improvement on basic circuits. They are a component of all MV gregtech machines. Be sure you build the electric blast furnace first, so you can process some aluminium dust into ingots.

§4This will also open the Project Red tab, one of the early automation options.

betterquesting.name: §2§lMoron's Manual to Fecund Farms
betterquesting.desc:
If you ever wanted to know how crop breeding works you are in the right place. Get some crops (the sticks) and some seeds from farming with a hoe or mattock. You can also place some plants and berries directly on crop sticks. Good plants to start with are flowers, wheat, cactus and sugarcane. 

Make a plot of farmland with your tool and place water in the middle. For now, make 3x1 plots, separated by a row of dirt or cobble. You want to be able to see the center of each column of 3x1 plots all at once, like this:
FFFdddFFF
dddFFFddd
FFFdddFFF
dddFFFddd
FFFdWdFFF
dddFFFddd
FFFdddFFF
dddFFFddd 
FFFdddFFF
Now place crop sticks in each end of the 3x1 plot. Then place the seeds on the sticks and wait a bit.

When they are almost fully grown you can put double crop sticks in the center spots by using crop sticks on already placed crop sticks. This center area can now grow new crops, even new species.

With some luck you might get a new unknown seed which can be scanned later.

Weeds need to be removed with a trowel  or spade otherwise your field will become overgrown by them.

Using 3x1 plots is easy and not much work.  Check them every 5-10 minutes to remove weeds and gather new seeds. If you forget, you only lose one or two seeds. 

If you find a really nice seed, you can do 3x3 or 5x5 plots with the nice seed in the middle and others next to it for crossing. But this requires more babysitting since weeds could destroy the whole field.

Don't leave new crops in these intensive fields. Pull them out and hopefully get a seedbag. Put low stat seeds in production fields that don't require babysitting. Keep the high stat seeds for more crossing. 

Crossing happens when 2 or more almost mature crops are next to a double cropstick. There is a 90 percent change of getting the same species as the parents. The rest of the time will be a mutation. More details in the IC2 cropnalyzer quest.

betterquesting.name: First Breeding
betterquesting.desc:
New plants have grown on your crop sticks. You can harvest the crop by right clicking it.

Left clicking with a seed bag will destroy the plant and replace it with the seedbag, so be careful. Collect 8 seeds of any kind.

To unlock the next quest, you will need the LV scanner.

If you haven't already, go back to Steam and build some Filing Cabinets. They make storing and moving large quantities of seeds a breeze. Plus they will properly sort the seeds based on name. To find a specific seed, type its name in the NEI search bar, and double click the bar so it highlights yellow.  Now you can look through the Filing Cabinet and find the exact seedbag you want.

betterquesting.name: Weed II
betterquesting.desc:
Weeds, weeds, and more weeds. You get so many of them while cross breeding. 
Need some  biogas cells for your power production in exchange? Or maybe some glowstone to light up your fields?

betterquesting.name: Unknown seeds no more
betterquesting.desc:
You have a lot of unknown seeds already. Use your scanner to scan all the seeds.
 
Seeds can be planted again to breed better and more resilient crops.

Later you can use your portable scanner to see the crop stats while still in the ground.

Growability depends on having dirt beneath your crop(4 max), biome (swampy is best, followed by jungle and mushroom - basically any humid or wet biome such as tropical rainforest or bayou), air quality (Up toY=124 and don't place a lot above/around your plants), hydration, and fertilizer.  When the crop tier and plant stats get high enough, they will actually die without enough Growability.

As long as you water and fertilize them, you can pretty much grow crops anywhere, but as you improve the stats you have to optimize their environmental conditions.

If the Growth stat gets too high, greather than 24 or so, the plant will spread weeds onto neighbors.

Some crops, such as Redwheat, require certain light levels to crossbreed or grow.

betterquesting.name: Speed up your plant growth
betterquesting.desc: To speed up the growth process a bit you can use a fertilizer. You will note, however, that bone meal no longer works. A bit of ash, apatite or calcite mixed with some water in a chemical reactor will give you the fertilizer you need. Apply by hand.

betterquesting.name: Potatos, Carrots, Pumpkins and Melons
betterquesting.desc:
Your seeds have three different values: Growth, gain, and resistance (GGR).

The only way to change a crop's GGR without 3rd party tools is through cross breeding. When two plants cross-breed, the resulting plant will have a GGR score that is between both "parent" plants' GGR. Sometimes it will also be a little bit higher or lower. Thus, to obtain high GGR scores you must go through numerous generations of crossbreeding.

The highest score for GGR is 31.

betterquesting.name: Weed
betterquesting.desc: Weed will show up from time to time on your crop sticks. Be careful and harvest the weed with your weed trowel before the whole field becomes overgrown with them and they destroy all your plants. Later you can make some weed Ex to destroy it.

betterquesting.name: Flower Power
betterquesting.desc:
Growing dyes on crops sticks? Try to plant some flowers. If you cross breed Rose and Dandelion flowers you maybe get a new flower and new dyes with different colors.

You will need to plant 4 vanilla flowers to get them on a cropstick.

To get "Rose Seeds" place poppies.

betterquesting.name: §5§lChemical rubber production
betterquesting.desc: A much more efficient way to make insulated cables is by making molten rubber in a chemical reactor which can be applied to a cable in the assembling machine. When you put both machines next to each other you can output the molten rubber directly to the assembling machine by clicking the fluid auto-output button on the chemical reactor. Make sure to set the correct side of the reactor as output side by wrenching it.

betterquesting.name: §1§2§lBetter than barrels
betterquesting.desc:
While barrels offer a slot for a single item, drawers can have up to 4 slots each (holding 16 stacks per slot). Once you reach HV you can combine them with some ProjectRed pipes to set up a "ghetto ME storage system" (Tec2k17).

Just watch out, they do come with some downsides. You won't be able to make them point up or down, and you can only acces the contents from the front (automation can use any side). 

Also, if placed on top of a hopper, they can bug out and void items when the hopper is full.  If you plan on that, use barrels or chests instead.

betterquesting.name: §2§lCompact Drawers
betterquesting.desc: They are very compact and add some fanciness to your glorious dirt base.

betterquesting.name: §2§lFraming Drawers
betterquesting.desc: Now you can really make some swaggy and even FANCIER drawers using this table, all you have to do is place some decorative blocks (works with almost ALL decorative blocks) and it will take their texture, the TOP left is the outer Square bottom left is for the front face and top right is for the borders.

betterquesting.name: §6§lBio Fuels
betterquesting.desc:
You are using steam, creosote, and possibly oil plus their by-products to generate Power. It's time to start with bio diesel. You can use wheat, sugarcane, apples, saplings or fish.

Be sure you have a managed Forestry farm, Steve's Cart Farm, IC2 Crop Sticks with a harvester, or a lot of fish catchers because you need plenty of biomaterials for constant biodiesel production.

§4Hint: Hazelnut is the ultimative source for biodiesel.

betterquesting.name: §6§lPlant balls
betterquesting.desc: The first step is to compress plantballs out of your wheat. Your LV compressor is too slow for it. I suggest crafting 4 MV compressors for the new bio diesel processing line.

betterquesting.name: §6§lPlant Mass
betterquesting.desc: Macerate the plantballs down to plant mass for better processing. In the LV and MV tiers you get only one plant mass per, in HV tier you recieve two. IV macerator gives up to four of them with a chance of 50 percent and 25 percent.

betterquesting.name: §6§lBio Chaff
betterquesting.desc: Plant mass needs to be centrifuged into bio chaff, the base material to make biomass. You need 1 or 2 MV centrifuges to run the new production line.

betterquesting.name: §6§lWay One: IC 2 Fluid Canner
betterquesting.desc:
The first way you get biomass out of bio chaff is to use the IC2 Fluid Canner. One bucket of water and one bio chaff gives one bucket of biomass. 

§4In MV Tier you can use the pyrolyze oven to do it in a more efficient way.

betterquesting.name: §6§lWay Two: Brewery
betterquesting.desc:
If you are lucky and find some brewing stands or familiar enough with Thaumcraft to make one you can craft a brewery. You get 750mb of biomass out of 750mb water and 1 bio chaff. 

§4In MV tier you can use the pyrolyze oven to do it in a more efficient way.

betterquesting.name: §6§lFermented Biomass
betterquesting.desc:
With the MV fermenter you can produce fermented biomass. This is the base product to make methane, ethanol and methanol.
When you reach HV tier there's a more efficient way to process it - the distillation tower multiblock.

betterquesting.name: Can u eat those?
betterquesting.desc:
No you can't eat them but you can add them to your routed pipes. Without chips routed pipes can't do anything on their own, chips also have a GUI to configure them which can be opened by right clicking. 
There are 8 types of chips:

-Item extractor chip can be used to send items from its inventory to responder, dynamic responder, terminator and overflow responder chips in a pipe network. 

-Item responder chip will request items from the extractor chips in your network which match the filter configured to the inventory connected to the responder chip. Chips with higher priority value will receive items first until the inventory is full then will be sent to other inventories with valid filters and remaining space.

-Dynamic item responder chip will request items from the extractor chips in your network that match items inside the dynamic item responder connected inventory. This chip has to be in the same interface pipe as the item responder chip in order to work. Priority rules apply here as well. 

-Item overflow responder works exactly the same as the item responder chip, however it only accepts items that cannot go to an item responder chip, dynamic item responder chip, or item terminator chip. 

-Item terminator chip works as a backup for responder chips.

-Item broadcaster chip will show you the inventory connected to the routed request pipe on the pipe network and can be used to retrieve items from it. They can also extract from the side you configure. 

-Item stock keeper chip will constantly check the network for items and pull them to its pipe. If the chip is set to pull when empty, it will only pull if the inventory next to it is empty, otherwise it will pull when there are less items in the inventory than configured in the chip.

-Item crafting chips craft things. 

-Item crafting extension chips are placed inside the item crafting chips. Make sure you randomize the id.

betterquesting.name: Routed Pipes
betterquesting.desc:
There are six types of routed pipes: 

-Junction pipe is used to form an intersection that will allow other routed pipes to communicate. 

-Interface pipe will connect to an inventory allowing you to extract or insert items, chips can be used to control the logic. 

-Request pipe will allow requesting only specific items to be send through pipes.

-Firewall pipe can control which items can pass through them.

betterquesting.name: Ghetto ME System
betterquesting.desc:
Now that you are familiar with the mod it's time to organize items in your base a bit. These are the things you need in order to get a basic extract/insert system.

First of all you will need a drawer controller. You can pick it from here or craft it yourself and place it down. Next to it add as much drawers as you want, and make sure they are touching each other or the controller.

The next step is to connect a routed interface pipe to your drawer controller. Take the item responder chip and configure it to filter mode: blacklist (this will allow you to get any items from your system) and add the chip to the routed interface pipe by right clicking on it. Don't forget the dynamic item responder.

In order to allow your system to be able to see items you need to add the item broadcast chip TO THE SAME ROUTED INTERFACE PIPE WHICH IS CONNECTED TO THE DRAWER CONTROLLER.

The last step is to connect a routed request pipe IN THE SAME NETWORK AS THE ROUTED INTERFACE PIPE and right click it to access the GUI. You can only extract items from it. In order to insert items simply right click them on the drawer controller. 

You can find more complex tutorials on youtube for autocrafting.

betterquesting.name: §6§lExtrude all the things
betterquesting.desc:
Now you hit the MV tier and it's time to get a better ratio when making sticks, pipes, wires, plates and many more parts. Most recipes use more than 32 EU/t so better make an MV extruder. After crafting the machine you need some extruder shapes for the different types of parts you want to make.

§4Most of the Tinkers Gregworks tool parts are made in the extruder.

betterquesting.name: §5§3§lTool Forge
betterquesting.desc: Finally you get your first alumite. Now it's time to craft a tool forge for making bigger Tinkers tools.

betterquesting.name: §3§lOne Block mining is so Old School
betterquesting.desc: By making a hammer you are now able to mine a shaft of 3x3 blocks. You can use iron, steel, or alumite poured from the Smeltery, it doesn't need to be steel. Higher tier metals require the MV extruder.  You'll need a hammer head,two large plates and a large rod for your hammer.  Be careful in the Nether or you could be boiled in lava very quickly.

betterquesting.name: §3§lCutting a Tree log by log is so Old School
betterquesting.desc: By making a lumber axe you are now able to cut down the entire tree in one hit. You can use iron, steel, or alumite poured from the Smeltery, it doesn't need to be steel. Higher tier metals require the MV extruder.   Don't forget your backpack when you are cutting a sacred oak tree down.

betterquesting.name: §3§lMining Dirt Block by Block is so Old School
betterquesting.desc:
By making an excavator you are now able to mine dirt in a 3x3 area. You can use iron, steel, or alumite poured from the Smeltery, it doesn't need to be steel. 
Higher tier metals require the MV extruder.  Don't destroy your whole garden.

betterquesting.name: §5§lGlue
betterquesting.desc: If you centrifuge sticky resin, you get some glue. Glue is very useful in the creation of good circuit boards.

betterquesting.name: §6§lSilicon
betterquesting.desc: Due to the chip production, silicon becomes a more important material. You can centrifuge it out of fullers earth, asbestos or redstone dust. The electric blast furnace is needed to make ingots. One ingot requires a temperature of 1687 K for 84 seconds at 120 EU/t using raw silicon.  Using silicon dioxide and carbon dust, you can get an ingot in 12 seconds! Another time when it is wise to search NEI and not stop on the first recipe.

betterquesting.name: §5§lDiode
betterquesting.desc:
Good circuits need diodes. There are two ways to craft them. Right now you have to use the Gallium Arsenide method with fine copper wires and molten glass. Later when you get an EBF you can use it to make silicon wafers to make even more. Once you have polyethylene you can use annealed copper wires to increase your output yet again. 

Make sure you check all the NEI recipes for advanced items instead of just using the first one you find.

betterquesting.name: §5§lEmpty Circuit Board
betterquesting.desc: Good circuit boards require wooden pulp and refined glue to make phenolic circuit boards. By adding gold wire you can craft a good circuit board.

betterquesting.name: §6§lAre you Prepared for HV?
betterquesting.desc:
Stainless steel will be the material for the HV Tier. There are two ways to process it. Mixing it by hand outputs 8 stainless steel dust.

Manganese can be found from ore veins with grossular ore, spessartine ore, pyrolusite ore and tantalite ore. Alternative sources are Garnet dusts from Garnet sands, or Almandine. If you get desperate, you can buy some ore from the Coins tab.

Chrome can be centrifuged out of manganese dust and ruby dust.

betterquesting.name: §6§lMolten Plastic
betterquesting.desc: Molten polyethylene can be made in a chemical reactor using ethylene, compressed air cells or oxygen - using oxygen gives a 50% boost. Use a mold for making plates in a fluid solidifier to make plastic sheets.

betterquesting.name: §6§lMixing Stainless Steel
betterquesting.desc:
Stainless steel will be the material for the HV Tier. There are two ways to process it. Mixing it in a mixer outputs 9 stainless steel dust each process.

Manganese can be found in ore veins together with grossular ore, spessartine ore, pyrolusite ore and tantalite ore.

Chrome can be centrifuged out of manganese dust and ruby dust.

betterquesting.name: §6§lSilicon Plate
betterquesting.desc: Advanced circuits require transistors, which are made out of silicon plates, fine tin wire and molten polyethylene.

betterquesting.name: §6§lStainless Steel EBF processing
betterquesting.desc:
Stainless steel ingots are made in the electric blast furnace at a temperature of 1700K. 
It takes 80 seconds at 480 EU/t or by adding oxygen gas 60 seconds at 480 EU/t.

§4You need a miniumum of two MV energy hatches to power the EBF.

betterquesting.name: §6§lMV Energy Hatch
betterquesting.desc:
Some materials like stainless steel require 480 EU/t. Your LV hatches are not good enough. Craft a minimum of two MV hatches to upgrade your electric blast furnace to HV.
If you not make some Ultra Low Power ICs go and make some wafers first.

betterquesting.name: §6§lBetter than Duct Tape
betterquesting.desc:
A soldering iron tool to remove the "burned out circuits" message is better than duct tape. 
The soldering iron requires one soldering material item and 10,000 EU. Valid soldering materials are fine wires, rods, and ingots made from either tin, lead, or soldering alloy. The soldering iron will consume the first such material it finds in the player's inventory.

In order to "complete" the quest they will need to charge the soldering iron after you craft it.

For the other problems other tools are necessary.

Possible problems                  Tool to fix
"Pipe is loose."                        Wrench
"Screws are missing."             Screwdriver 
"Something is stuck."               Soft mallet 
"Platings are dented."              Hammer 
"Circuitry burned out."          Soldering Iron 
"That doesn't belong there."     Crowbar

betterquesting.name: §6§lLess Power loss
betterquesting.desc: When you reach MV tier you can make your own duct tape in case you have to move your multiblock machines around. Duct tape will fix all maintenance problems in any multiblock machine.

betterquesting.name: §6§f§6§lRuby Electrolyzing
betterquesting.desc:
Ruby is a good source for electrolyzing to get chrome and aluminium.  Your new MV electrolyzer gives you access to a lot of new recipes. Once you get low on Ruby, you can centrifuge Redstone to get more.
Another good source of aluminium and oxygen is red granite dusts. You can get those from red stonelillies in the Fishing Farming Cooking tab using ic2 crops.

betterquesting.name: §6§lMV Batteries
betterquesting.desc: Better machines need some better batteries. Let's make some MV battery hulls for new batteries. Now it's up to you to make lithium, cadmium, sodium or acid batteries with these hulls.

betterquesting.name: §6§lMolten Polyethylene
betterquesting.desc:
Polyethylene is made out of ethylene in a chemical reactor.
Molten Polyethylene cells carry 144L, perfect for 1 ingot or plate. 
If you want precise amounts, you can use a Volumetric Flask once you electrolyze some Boron from Borax.

betterquesting.name: §6§lClay Electrolyzing
betterquesting.desc: You found out that electrolyzing clay dust will give you silicon dust. There are plenty of stained clay blocks found in canyon and lush desert biomes or on mountains that can be pulverized to clay dust.

betterquesting.name: §6§lPowderbarrels
betterquesting.desc: Powderbarrels are twice as good as dynamite in the implosion compressor. Craft one stack.

betterquesting.name: §6§lTNT
betterquesting.desc:
TNT is much more powerful than the powderbarrel but much harder to craft. There are LV and HV ways to craft. At LV you need heavy or light fuel to make some toluene which can be solidified to gelled toluene. Alternatively you can use sugar and plastic dust in a chemical reactor to make toluene more efficiently. Mix it with sulfuric acid to make TNT.

The HV way requires an oil cracking unit to make all kinds of cracked fuel or cracked naphta and a distillation tower to extract toluene from that.

betterquesting.name: §6§liTNT
betterquesting.desc: Industrial TNT is the HV variant of TNT. It explodes with more power, yet does not destroy blocks when it explodes.

betterquesting.name: §6§lDynamite
betterquesting.desc:
Dynamite is the most basic explosive you can use in the implosion compressor.
Mix some paper, string and glyceryl trinitrate in a chemical reactor to get dynamite.

betterquesting.name: §6§lTime to oil drill!
betterquesting.desc:
Pumps are nice but you're going to reach a point where you will want MOOOOOOOOOOOOORE oil. This multiblock will help with that but you will need to search for oil using a seismic prospector. You can find raw, light and heavy oil. There's also a chance to find natural gas.

Higher tiers of power will drill faster. You need to upgrade the energy hatch corresponding to the power tier. 

Later you can upgrade the oil drilling rig so it extracts from more than one chunk at a time.

You need mining pipes in the machine controller block.

These are GT machines, so remember to protect them (and their power sources!) from rain on any side. And set a waypoint with Journeymaps so you don't forget where you placed it!

betterquesting.name: §6§lLet's get crackin!
betterquesting.desc:
Cracking oil products like light and heavy fuel with the oil cracker is faster and more efficent than using a chemical reactor, producing 25 percent more output. Cracked products will result in additional by-products in the distillation tower. It is a smart idea to get this multiblock since you are going to need TONS of industrial TNT from Toluene for advanced tier rockets. 

The 16 coils form 2 vertical rings of 8 on either side of the controller. The casings between the rings can be replaced with a hatch for steam/hydrogen input. Energy hatch and maintenance hatch can replace any of the casings. The input product hatch and output product hatch must replace one of the casings outside of the coils.

Hint: Only GT/Railcraft steam can be used, not ic2 steam.

betterquesting.name: §6§lAnalyzing the soil
betterquesting.desc:
Tired of looking for ores by hand? Want to find deep oil that will last a long time? A seismic prospector will tell you the ores in the surrounding chunk in a handy book you can read, and also the oil in the oilfields beneath each 8x8 chunks.

To determine which kind of oil or gas there is in the chunk you need to scan the soil by right clicking an Advanced Seismic Prospector with 2 Powderbarrels, 4 Glyceryl Trinitate cells, 8 iTNT or 16 TNT.  Make sure you wait a few seconds after placing the prospector before applying the explosives.

Then use a Data Stick to extract the data by right clicking on it after the animation has finished.

Now you need to put the analyzed data stick in a GT scanner. Then place it in the bottom right slot of the printer and add 3 paper in the top left slot and make sure you have at least 144 mb squid ink in it. (Only gregtech machines will work)

After the process is done take the printed pages and combine it with a piece of leather in an assembling machine filled with at least 20 mb of refined glue. Don't assemble more than one book at time.

TADA now you have a book with detailed info about the chunks you scanned.

Note: Each oilfield is 8x8 chunks, and always on a by 8 chunk boundary. Within the field the amount can vary +- 25 percent. The amount reported in the book is the minimum and maximum per oilfield across all chunks in the field. The prospector reports on 3x3 oil fields at all tiers with the center oil field where the seismic prospector is located. Oil extraction rate depends on many factors, check the wiki for details. In general, anything above 300 is really good. The total amount in the chunk is complicated. 

Ore locations are given as the center of the chunk. Ores that are marginal in that chunk may not be found in the center but on an edge. Look at where ores are located and determine the center of the vein. At higher tiers, it scans more chunks for ores.

betterquesting.name: §6§lYou smell like a distillery!
betterquesting.desc:
This bad boy will tremendously boost the by-products of your cracked fuel or pyrolyse oven. This way you can make industrial TNT, polyethylene, polytetrafluoroethylene and other plastics more efficiently. 

You will also need this for your automated setups.

You will need to make EV circuits in a cleanroom to build this machine.

For hatches, you can choose your own tier. 1 MV energy does most of the useful recipes. 2 MV energy or 1 HV energy hatch will cover almost all the rest except pollution or acetone.

You will need 1 input hatch, and at least 5 output hatches. An output bus will capture any solid outputs.

betterquesting.name: §9§lPlaying with dust
betterquesting.desc: This machine will help you turn dust into crystals which you will need for high tier recipes.

betterquesting.name: §9§lAvengers, Assemble! 3
betterquesting.desc: You know what this does. :D

betterquesting.name: §5§lDust to crystals
betterquesting.desc: Use the autoclave to crystallize your dust. You can make raw carbon mesh out of carbon dust.

betterquesting.name: §9§lPrecision is required
betterquesting.desc: You will use this a lot to make high tier circuits, and for other recipes

betterquesting.name: §6§lWay one: Raw carbon mesh
betterquesting.desc: This way of making carbon requires autoclaving 4 carbon dust. You can use polyethylene which gives you only 1 raw carbon fibre at LV tier, polytetrafluoroethylene gives you 2 at MV Tier or go for the best way: molten epoxid which yields 4 at HV Tier.

betterquesting.name: §6§lWay two: Bio Organic Mesh
betterquesting.desc:
If want to save the ecosystem you can autoclave 16 plantballs to get raw bio fiber with the following liquids:

§4-Biomass 33% chance
-Methanol 50% chance
-Fuel 90% chance
-Nitro-diesel 100% chance

§rHowever, making carbon plates this way will require an electric blast furnace.

betterquesting.name: Carbon parts
betterquesting.desc: These are the first parts you will need for your beloved nano armor.

betterquesting.name: Seeing things brighter
betterquesting.desc: The nano helmet is a bit special. It will provide you with night vision as long as you have energy!  Don't turn it on in bright areas or you'll be blinded!

betterquesting.name: Are those green diamonds?
betterquesting.desc: They may not be green diamonds but they are needed for your nano armor.

betterquesting.name: §7§6§lCarbon Plates
betterquesting.desc: Carbon plates are needed for the nano armor. Go check out the armor chapter.

betterquesting.name: Carbon skin
betterquesting.desc: You can stop worrying about some mobs for now. This will help you survive a bit and will give you some of that SWAG. Your journey doesn't stop here traveller, as quantum armor awaits you!

betterquesting.name: §6§lOrganic Way
betterquesting.desc: Bio carbon plates are made out of raw carbon mesh. Put it in the electric blast furnace to make carbon plates.

betterquesting.name: §6§lStill not enough charcoal?
betterquesting.desc:
This oven is the best way to get charcoal and creosote (x50 faster than Railcraft's coke oven) and other byproducts. You will need tons of bronze, iron and steel to build it, but it's worth it. Finally, it will be possible to dismantle the charcoal pit.
With Cupronickel coils the oven is a bit slower. Each coil tier speeds up the charcoal production.

betterquesting.name: §6§lMonocrystalline Silicon
betterquesting.desc: To make wafers, you need to make monocrystalline silicon first. The process takes 450 seconds and requires silicon dust and gallium arsenide dust in the electric blast furnace. You can make 16 wafers out of every boule.

betterquesting.name: §6§lWe need big toys
betterquesting.desc:
All your little turbines take up too much space? Are you running out of water? It is time to solve these problems. This large turbine can help you produce a tremendous amount of energy. It will also distill water for you, so you can use the same water again inside your large boiler.  Don't forget to make a rotor for the turbine. 

Make sure you provide the optimal flow of steam using a fluid regulator. Don't exceed your dynamo hatch's EU rating, or it will explode! For HV you will probably want an IC2 fluid regulator. Above HV you can use the fluid regulator covers.

Turbines with a small turbine durability below 75k have their recipes removed. Use NEI with the appropriate long rod to find assembler recipes that will work for you. Long magnalium for small turbines, long titanium for normal turbines, etc.

Pre-moon, the best rotors are small ardite or vibrant alloy. Remember to disassemble rotor blades before they break to recover the materials.

Post-moon, the best HV rotors are normal damascus or blue steel. Risk-takers can try ultimet but you must not provide optimal flow since it will give 517 EU/t, blowing up a single amp dynamo. Luckily turbines are now fully functional with multi-amp dynamos, so give those a try if you need extra amps!

For additional choices, see the Large Turbine Calculator in Discord.

betterquesting.name: §6§lIt's time to get more steam
betterquesting.desc:
As soon as you have the ability to store energy in large quantities, it would be necessary to have a way to generate energy in large quantities. You need a large bronze boiler. But in order to make this boiler, you will need a mountain of bronze. This boiler produces 800 liters of steam per tick. This is enough to run 10 basic steam turbines.

The large boiler can use either water or distilled water. Water is consumed at a rate of 1L of water per 150L of steam.

To make a large boiler you must make a 3x3x5 structure with Bronze Pipe Casings in the center of the middle 3 levels. The lowest level must contain at least 1 or 2 input hatches, 1 or 2 input buses, 3 or 4 fireboxes, 1 muffler, and one maintenance hatch. The lowest level can not contain any plated bricks. All hatches, buses, and mufflers must have their back side touching a firebox. The output hatch can be placed on any of the upper 4 levels.

betterquesting.name: §6§lTransistor
betterquesting.desc: For the next tier we need advanced circuits. To create some advanced circuits, you need some transistors.

betterquesting.name: §6§lSteam is never enough
betterquesting.desc: Now you can make advanced circuits, which means it's time to build a large steel boiler. This boiler is one and a half times more efficient than a bronze one, and that means we need 5 more steam turbines. Don't forget to monitor the water level!

betterquesting.name: §6§lMoooooore steam
betterquesting.desc: Stock up on titanium, it will be fun. A large titanium boiler produces 1600 litres of steam per tick. For this amount you need to choose the right rotors for your turbines. For example, 2 normal damascus steel rotors will be just right. Optimal flow for such rotor is 800 liters per tick. Make a fluid regulator in the assembler to control the flow rate. If you have more than one boiler, you will need to make calculations in order to select the appropriate rotors. Make sure your dynamo hatch is capable of accepting all the EU, or it will explode!

betterquesting.name: §6§lEven more steam? Are you sure?
betterquesting.desc: This boiler is the most efficient source of steam. It allows you to produce as much as 2000 litres of steam per tick. If you need more, then build a dual or even quad boiler.

betterquesting.name: §9§lEnergy Crystals
betterquesting.desc: Make energy crystals out of ruby and redstone dusts in the MV mixer. Energy crystals can store 1 million EU and work as an HV battery.

betterquesting.name: §9§lNano Crystal
betterquesting.desc: Nano crystals are used for making the nano armor.

betterquesting.name: §6§lMV Precision Laser
betterquesting.desc: Advanced circuits need an MV precision laser. Let's craft one.

betterquesting.name: §6§lSilicon Wafer
betterquesting.desc: To create some silicon wafers, put the monocrystalline silicon boule in a cutting machine. It would be better to immediately make the MV version because you will need it later for RAM, IC's and other chips.

betterquesting.name: §6§lGood Integrated Circuits
betterquesting.desc: Good circuits have three variants. For the advanced circuits you need the good integrated circuits.

betterquesting.name: §6§lIntegrated Circuit
betterquesting.desc: There are two variants of basic circuits. The basic circuit from IC2 or the integrated circuit which needs a circuit assembling machine to be made. The good integrated circuit needs two integrated circuits to be crafted.

betterquesting.name: §5§lBasic Circuit Assembler
betterquesting.desc: Advanced circuits require an LV circuit assembling machine. Basic ones can be made much more efficient with this machine. Let's craft one.

betterquesting.name: Sensor lens
betterquesting.desc: The night vision goggles need special sensor lenses to work.

betterquesting.name: Advanced Heat Exchanger
betterquesting.desc: The night vision goggles need advanced heat exchangers to work.

betterquesting.name: Iron capped Greatwood Wand
betterquesting.desc:
Making a gold capped greatwood wand requires 35 vis, but your old wand's limit is 25. So first create an iron or copper capped greatwood wand and then create a gold capped greatwood wand.
Make sure you use NEI 'U' command on the wand caps to find the correct GT:NH recipe for the wand.

betterquesting.name: Don't try to dive with it
betterquesting.desc: Combining a scuba helmet with a nano helmet in an assembling machine will give you a nano scuba helmet. You'd better not try to dive with it because you can't. It is a part of the new quantum suit helmet.

betterquesting.name: Plated Leggings - Better not try to wear it
betterquesting.desc: Combining stainless steel platings with some nano leggings in the assembler gives you nano plated leggings. Better not try to wear them because you can't. They are part of the new quantum suit leggings.

betterquesting.name: Don't try to walk with it
betterquesting.desc: Combining some rubber boots with nano boots in the Assembler gives you Nano Rubber Boots. Better not try to put them on because you can't. They are part of the new quantum suit boots.

betterquesting.name: Iridium Plated
betterquesting.desc: Plating all your armor parts with iridium alloy casings gives them a better durability. Before you can wear these quantum armor parts you need to activate them with some quantum crystals.

betterquesting.name: Quantum Armor
betterquesting.desc: The quantum armor is a high tier and very durable armor with a lot of features like night vision, fall damage reduction and running very fast.

betterquesting.name: Quantum crystal
betterquesting.desc: The quantum crystal is needed to turn quantum armor parts into wearable quantum armor.

betterquesting.name: §a§lLapotron Dust
betterquesting.desc: Lapotron crystals require you to mix your energium dust with some lapis dust.
