betterquesting.name: §a§lLapotron Crystal
betterquesting.desc:
With your new HV mixer you can make lapotron dust. Place it in an autoclave to make some raw lapotron crystals. With an EV assembler and advanced circuits you can make lapotron crystals which store up to 10 million EU.

§4Hint: Nei shows only ic2 advanced circuits in recipe but all advanced circuits works.

betterquesting.name: §a§lQuantum Crystal
betterquesting.desc: For your quantum armor you need some quantum crystals. Place a lapotron crystal in your precision laser to get a quantum crystal

betterquesting.name: §9§lMixing at HV Level
betterquesting.desc: High Tier dusts need HV Mixer.

betterquesting.name: NASA Workbench aka Dire Crafting Table
betterquesting.desc: The Avaritia 9x9 dire crafting table replaces the NASA workbench. It is required to craft all rockets and high tier equipment. First of all you need 81 crafting tables to make a double compressed crafting table, a few HV components, wafers and a crystal matrix. And yes, you do need nether stars. Hint: Check out the nether star recipe which uses null catalyst and salis mundus. Null catalyst can be duplicated by adding magma cream, blaze powder and a tiny pile of nether star dust.

betterquesting.name: Rocket Tier 1
betterquesting.desc: After hours of hard work and a few stacks of TNT your first rocket is finally ready. But before you can go to the Moon you need to craft a few more things.

betterquesting.name: Tier 1 Schematic
betterquesting.desc: Each rocket needs a construction plan. You can craft the first one using a data circuit and a compressed steel plate in a hv circuit assembler.

betterquesting.name: Tier 1 Heavy Duty Plates
betterquesting.desc: Rockets require heavy duty plates for the main hull. Let's craft 36 of these plates out of compressed aluminium plates, compressed bronze plates and compressed steel plates.

betterquesting.name: Rocket Nose Cone
betterquesting.desc: Every rocket needs a nose cone.

betterquesting.name: Rocket Fins
betterquesting.desc: Every rocket needs a few rocket fins.

betterquesting.name: Rocket Engine
betterquesting.desc: Every rocket needs a rocket engine. Better craft two, because the Moon lander needs one also.

betterquesting.name: Moon Lander
betterquesting.desc:
The Moon lander is required for a soft landing.
You will need an additional frequency module for hearing things on planets and a second seat for a Moon buggy you may build later.

betterquesting.name: Buggy Seat
betterquesting.desc: The buggy seat is part of the Moon lander and the Moon buggy.

betterquesting.name: Frequency Module
betterquesting.desc: The frequency Module will help you hear sounds properly while in space (it's also used with the telemetry unit so that your buddies can keep track of you from your base, if you are playing with friends). You need it in your inventory and in the Moon lander.

betterquesting.name: Small Fuel Canister
betterquesting.desc: Every rocket needs fuel storage canisters. For the tier 1 rocket you need to craft two of them.

betterquesting.name: Rocket Launch Pad
betterquesting.desc:
Every rocket needs a launch pad. Build a 3x3 launch pad and place your rocket on top of it.

Make sure you don't have any lightning warp effects or you'll be really sad.

betterquesting.name: Rocket Fuel
betterquesting.desc: To pump fuel into your rocket you need a fuel loader. Place it right next to the middle of any side of the launch pad.

betterquesting.name: Oxygen Gear
betterquesting.desc: Oxygen gear is used to attach oxygen tanks to the oxygen mask. This is absolutely vital for any astronaut.

betterquesting.name: Oxygen Mask
betterquesting.desc: The oxygen mask is part of the system used to breathe on planets without oxygen, the others being oxygen gear and oxygen tanks.

betterquesting.name: Oxygen Tanks
betterquesting.desc:
The Light oxygen tank is an oxygen storage tank that can hold up to 900 units of air. It is used to provide a portable source of oxygen while in areas that do not have an oxygen source of their own.

Usage:
Up to two oxygen tanks can be worn at a time. To wear any type of oxygen tank, open your inventory and click on the Galacticraft tab at the top of the menu. Here you will see the available spots for your various types of equipment. Simply place your tank(s) in one of the slots with a grey picture of an oxygen tank. Other types of oxygen tanks are the medium oxygen tank, which holds twice the amount of oxygen as a light tank, and the heavy oxygen tank, which holds three times the amount of a light tank. I recommend making the medium tanks and using the light tanks as spares to return to base.

betterquesting.name: §2§lCopper Ore
betterquesting.desc:
Can be found between y levels 5 and 60 either as "Copper Ore" or "Chalcopyrite". Most of the time you'll find it together with  "Iron" and "Pyrite".

§4Hint:
To see where a special ore can be found click the raw ore in NEI and it will show you more details. Works with small ores too.

betterquesting.name: §2§lIron Ore
betterquesting.desc:
With iron tools, you are able to mine most of the Overworld ores. I think you already found iron or magnetite. So bring me some ores and make some iron ingots out of them.

§4Hint:
To see where a special ore can be found click the raw ore in nei and it will show you more details. Works with small ores too.

betterquesting.name: Rocket Fuel
betterquesting.desc:
For every flight the rocket needs some fuel. So refine some fuel and fill some fuel canisters. 
You can use Fuel or Rocket Fuel from Ender IO.

betterquesting.name: Oxygen Collector
betterquesting.desc: The oxygen collector is a block that gathers oxygen from leaves and farm plants to use in an oxygen bubble distributor, oxygen sealer, oxygen compressor, and other oxygen-reliant machines. If you plan to build a Moon base, which needs a continuous oxygen supply, you will need to build one.

betterquesting.name: Oxygen Compressor
betterquesting.desc: The oxygen compressor is used to fill empty or depleted oxygen tanks. Connect an oxygen pipe to the blue ring input side and a power source to the grey square input side. Place an oxygen tank in the bottom right slot and it will take oxygen from the input and place it into the tank.

betterquesting.name: Parachute
betterquesting.desc:
A parachute is used to prevent death upon re-entry into the Overworld's atmosphere. The parachute is an essential part of your journey to space. You should never journey into space without it. There will even be a warning if you try to launch without one on you.

Use the assembler to save materials.

betterquesting.name: Advanced Wafers
betterquesting.desc: The advanced wafer is used for more advanced machines such as the advanced solar panel or the Avaritia dire crafting table. It is also used in the creation of a space station.

betterquesting.name: Wafers
betterquesting.desc: The basic wafer is used for creating basic machines such as the basic solar panel, the fuel loader, the energy storage module and the compressor.

betterquesting.name: Purge your warp
betterquesting.desc: The warp you have accumulated over time is starting to become a problem. Making bath salts to clean off the warp is only a temporary solution. To truly get rid of it, you need something more powerful, a pure tear. If you collect a few things for me, I will give you one. Think wisely about using it, since it's a very long journey to unlock it through research.

betterquesting.name: §3§lCircuit Boards
betterquesting.desc: For every circuit you need a basic circuit board. Craft a coated circuit board and use copper wire to finish it.

betterquesting.name: §5§4§3§lResistor
betterquesting.desc: Every basic circuit needs two resistors to work

betterquesting.name: §5§lGallium Arsenide
betterquesting.desc:
The diode requires gallium arsenide and you may be wondering how to get gallium or arsenic this early in the game.

Sphalerite dust in an electrolyzer is the primary source of gallium at this tier. 
You can also get gallium out of crushed zinc ore by using a thermal centrifuge. You can find the small zinc ores in the Overworld or the in the Nether at Y Level 80 - 210. To get additional crushed ore, use a Tinker's Construct tool with the Luck (Fortune) enchant on it - apply a lot of Lapis. 

You can get arsenic from realgar small ores in the Nether at Y level 5 - 85. Centrifuge the dusts in a centrifuge. Other sources are Tinker's Construct cobalt ore in the nether and cobaltite ore in the Twilight Forest.

You need to level up your obsidian level tool, use a alumite tool, or make an Ironwood Pickaxe to harvest cobalt ore.

Another nice way to get gallium and arsenic is with XP buckets in a crafting grid.

Mix those two dusts in a mixer to get gallium arsenic dust.

In the nether it is easier to use a GT miner near the ceiling to get all the ores you need.

betterquesting.name: §6§lILC and RAM
betterquesting.desc:
Advanced circuits need integrated logic circuits and random access memory chips.
You can get those by cutting the ILC and RAM wafers.

betterquesting.name: §6§lAdvanced Circuits
betterquesting.desc: For the next tier we need advanced circuits. To make an advanced circuit, you need good integrated circuits, RAM, an integrated logic circuit, and transistors.

betterquesting.name: §6§lHandle tiny piles like a K1ng
betterquesting.desc:
Don't you hate having to manually compress all those tiny piles ? Well, let me show you how to automate that. A combination of typefilter, chest buffer (or super buffer in HV) and packager frees you from that annoying task. The chestbuffer can hold up to 9 stacks of tiny piles and the super buffer can hold 256 stacks of tiny dusts, which is more than enough. You can set its mode with a screwdriver on the output side. Set it to 9 to export 9 tiny piles at a time and let the packager compress these into regular dusts.

Super buffers can be lag sources, so be careful to keep them as empty as possible. If you are using a multiblock packager, be sure to change the buffer from Stocking mode to Transfer Size mode.

betterquesting.name: §5§lButane and Propane
betterquesting.desc:
You can distill a lot of different gases out of your "refinery gases".
Methane, butane, propane, helium and ethane.

§4Hint:
Refinery gas is not the best source for Propane and Butane. Better refine those out of naphtha.

betterquesting.name: §9§lTetranitromethane
betterquesting.desc: Bio diesel and diesel can be boosted using tetranitromethane. Ethenone and nitric acid are required to make tetranitromethane in a chemical reactor.

betterquesting.name: §6§lMethane Gas
betterquesting.desc: Methane gas with a burn value of 104,000 EU per cell can be burned in the gas turbine.

betterquesting.name: §6§lMethanol
betterquesting.desc: Methanol with a burn value of 84,000 EU per cell can be used to make biodiesel and other fluids.

betterquesting.name: §6§lEthanol
betterquesting.desc: Ethanol with a burn value of 192,000 EU per cell can be used to make biodiesel and other fluids.

betterquesting.name: §6§lBio Diesel Fuel
betterquesting.desc:
With ethanol or methanol and seed oil or fish oil you can make bio diesel. Burn value is 256,000 EU per cell. Diesel and bio diesel are needed for cetane-boosted diesel.

You get some glycerol as by-product. Save it so you can make glyceryl trinitrate for your dynamite or for your future epoxid production.

betterquesting.name: §6§lO like Oxygen
betterquesting.desc: Oxygen can be made in several different ways. Most commonly you'll either electrolyze it out of cassiterite sand, sugar from sugar canes or sugar beets, water, or various other oxygen-rich dusts, or centrifuge it from brown or yellow limonite dust.

betterquesting.name: §6§lEthylene
betterquesting.desc:
You can make ethylene many different ways

- Ethanol and sulfuric acid in a Chemical Reactor 
- Ethanol in a Chemical Dehydrator
- Distilling various gases (i.e. wood gas) in a Distillery
- Cracking Naphtha, fuels or refinery gas with hydrogen or steam in the Chemical Reactor will work too. Check NEI or the Game Mechanics Spreadsheet at http://bit.ly/gtnh-datasheets for details

betterquesting.name: §6§lSeed Oil
betterquesting.desc:
To make some bio diesel you need seed oil or fish oil and mix that with ethanol or methanol. Seeds give seed oil and fish produce fish oil when placed in a fluid extractor.

§4Pam's peanuts are a good seedoil source.  Another option is Forestry Butternuts. Or you can use IC2 crops to get Rapeseed.

betterquesting.name: §6§f§6§lSodium Hydroxide
betterquesting.desc:
Make some sodium hydroxide. You can make it out of sodium (or out of salt water once you reach EV).

§5§4The by-product hydrogen can be burned in a gas turbine.

betterquesting.name: §6§lEthenone
betterquesting.desc:
Hopefully you saved some sulfuric acid during your fuel production. Together with acetic acid you can make ethenone.
Craft an advanced chemical reactor to get access to more advanced recipes.

Save the ethenone for HV, you will need it to make tetranitromethane for cetane boosted diesel.

betterquesting.name: §9§lNitric Acid
betterquesting.desc: Nitric acid can be made out of water, oxygen and nitrogen dioxide.

betterquesting.name: §6§lAcetic Acid
betterquesting.desc: Acetic acid can be made out of oxygen and ethylene. Alternatively, it can be made out of biomass, wood vinegar or vinegar.

betterquesting.name: §9§lNitrogen Dioxide
betterquesting.desc: To make nitrogen dioxide you need to combine oxygen gas and nitric oxide in a chemical reactor.

betterquesting.name: §9§lAmmonia
betterquesting.desc: Nitrogen and hydrogen... Ammonia.

betterquesting.name: §9§lNitric Oxide
betterquesting.desc: To make nitric oxide you need to combine oxygen and ammonia in a chemical reactor.

betterquesting.name: §9§l1,1-Dimetylhydrazine
betterquesting.desc: To make 1,1-dimethylhydrazine you need to combine some dimethylamine and chloramine in a chemical reactor.

betterquesting.name: §9§lDimethylamine
betterquesting.desc: Combining ammonia and methanol in a chemical reactor produces some dimethylamine.

betterquesting.name: §9§lChloramine
betterquesting.desc: Combining hypochlorous acid and ammonia in a chemical reactor produces some chloramine.

betterquesting.name: §a§9§lHypochlorous Acid
betterquesting.desc: Hypochlorous acid requires water, chlorine and some mercury.

betterquesting.name: §9§lTitanium finally
betterquesting.desc:
Rutile, chlorine and carbon dust makes Titaniumtetrachloride. Combining this with Magnesium in an HV EBF will give you hot Titanium ingots. Freeze those and you will get your first titanium.
On the Moon if you are lucky you can find Ilmenite ore which make the processing of Titanium a bit easier.

betterquesting.name: §a§lTungstensteel
betterquesting.desc: Tungstensteel is needed for the next tier. Tungsten can be found on Mars or in Moon stone dust. Mix that with some steel dust. Smelt it at 3000K (requires nichrome coils) in an electric blast furnace.

betterquesting.name: §2§lYour first bow
betterquesting.desc:
Since vanilla bows are only craftable in the assembling machine and mobs do not drop them very often you have to make a Tinkers bow. Wood would be the best material for now.  So craft the bow limbs out of wood and the bow string out of strings. The arrow that has the most durability is bone, so craft the stick out of bone. It is much lighter but less durable than a regular arrow. Use a flint tip to make it repairable with flint.

§4You can repair your bow the same way as all the other Tinkers tools. Arrows can be regained by repairing them or picking them up from the floor.

betterquesting.name: §2§lBronze javelin
betterquesting.desc: The bronze javelin is a bit expensive and has only 7 throws, yet it is a good mid-range weapon. With one bronze ingot you can replenish your stack of javelins.

betterquesting.name: §2§lYour first flint throwing knife
betterquesting.desc: Is the bone bow too expensive for your taste? Then make a flint throwing knife instead. You need flint and a stick to get 12 knives. The durability and the attack damage are very low but it still helps with killing mobs from a safe distance.

betterquesting.name: §1§lMonster trap
betterquesting.desc: If you're lucky you spawned in a sand or rainforest biome and find some quicksand. Collect a stack of the stuff, dig a small ditch and fill it with the quicksand to protect your "dirt base" home. Just don't fall in!

betterquesting.name: The transcontinental railroad
betterquesting.desc: All the different mining veins that have been found seem to be really far apart. One way to shorten the travel time is to create a railroad from your base to the different mines. Sadly this requires a large amount of both iron and creosote. Let's not forget to place the last symbolic rivet on one of your new train lines.

betterquesting.name: §3§lLapis, Lazurite, Sodalite, Calcite
betterquesting.desc:
In order to make your bricked blast furnace you need to find a lapis vine containing calcite.
You can find the vein in the overworld or the Twilight Forest at Y 20-50.

betterquesting.name: §1§2§3§lGypsum
betterquesting.desc: To make bricks for the blast furnace you need concrete and gypsum. Gypsum can be found in a vein together with basaltic and granitic mineral sand, and fullers earth. Y 50-60 and only in the overworld.

betterquesting.name: §5§lSifting Machine
betterquesting.desc:
You need flawless or exquisite diamonds, emeralds, rubies or other gems? Well then it's time for you to make a Sifting Machine.

You can find small Zinc ores (look in NEI) or you can search the Nether for Sphalerite.

You'll need either an Ore Washer or Simple Ore Washer since the Sifter only takes purified ores.

betterquesting.name: §6§lSmelt all the things...
betterquesting.desc:
Smelting up to nine items at once? With a bit of steel you can make a railcraft Steam Oven. 2x2x2

Hint: All furnace recipes work just fine, but you cannot use it to make charcoal from wood.

betterquesting.name: §4§3§lMolds, molds, molds
betterquesting.desc: After you can make steel and have a tinkers smelter you have to make molds. Molds can be used in the alloy smelter and the fluid solidifier. You need them to make vacuum tubes, ingots, gears and more.

betterquesting.name: Maple Syrup
betterquesting.desc: You spent hours and hours to find some maple trees? Why not use your forest ranger coins to buy some syrup? Add some spruce saplings and plant some maple trees.

betterquesting.name: Seed Bags
betterquesting.desc: Finding some special "pams harvest craft" seeds can be very difficult. With your farmer coins you can buy some seedbags.

betterquesting.name: Jetpack v.0.1 Alpha
betterquesting.desc: Do you like flying? Ok then, make a slimy bouncepad and enjoy the good view.

betterquesting.name: §3§lSlime Island Journey
betterquesting.desc:
Rubber trees are not the only source for raw rubber. Go and find a slimy island high in the sky. Slime balls and slime leaves give raw rubber too.
Make some slime tree farms beside your rubber farm.

betterquesting.name: §6§lBring me my vat of polyethelyne!
betterquesting.desc:
Tired of using small cells to process chemicals? Build a Large Chemical Reactor and you can just pipe in and out fluids. Or use the glorious large fluid cells to deliver and remove fluids from the hatches. 

Be careful, if the output hatches are full, the reactor will void any extra products!

Some of the old recipes can now be done simply in the LCR, btw.

The LCR also counts as a cleanroom for any cleanroom recipes.

You will also need:
1 Maintenance Hatch
1 Energy Hatch
1 Input Bus
5 Output Bus
5 Input Hatch
5 Output Hatch

betterquesting.name: Scepter with 75 vis capacity
betterquesting.desc: A scepter is crafted from a wand core, a primal charm, three wand caps, a twilight forest monster mob drop, and some screws. Any sort of core or cap may be used, but the caps must match each other. A scepter cannot hold a focus, but holds 150 percent as much vis as a wand with the same core, and gives an additional 5 percent discount for costs, beyond any discounts from its caps or the user's worn equipment.

betterquesting.name: Magic Staff Core
betterquesting.desc: A staff requires an extra step for crafting: Two (matching) wand cores must be combined with a primal charm, and crystal clusters to produce a staff core. (While the recipes are all similar, each type of staff core requires a separate research topic to be learned.)

betterquesting.name: Primal Charm
betterquesting.desc:
With your new 50 vis wand you are able to make a Scepter which holds up to 75 vis.
First you need some primal charms which cost 50 vis to craft.

betterquesting.name: Witch
betterquesting.desc: You feel lonely. What's cooking?

betterquesting.name: Pigmen
betterquesting.desc: You feel lonely. Do you want some bacon?

betterquesting.name: Blaze
betterquesting.desc: You feel lonely. Let me warm you up a bit.

betterquesting.name: Magma Cube
betterquesting.desc: You feel lonely, and bouncy.

betterquesting.name: Enderman
betterquesting.desc: You feel lonely. Don't look me in the eyes!

betterquesting.name: Cave Spider
betterquesting.desc: You feel lonely. Let me sing itsy-bitsy spider for you.

betterquesting.name: Ghast
betterquesting.desc: You feel lonely. At least you're not a big cry-baby?

betterquesting.name: A Wizard's Staff has a Knob on the End
betterquesting.desc: Join the core with two wand caps, a twilight forest mob drop, and screws just as for making a wand. A staff cannot be used for crafting, but holds 250 percent as much vis as a corresponding wand. It can even serve as a backup weapon for melee. While it cannot receive weapon enchantments, its damage is decent, and it does not take damage with use (no durability bar).

betterquesting.name: Silverfish
betterquesting.desc: You feel lonely. Let me be as annoying as possible.

betterquesting.name: Magma Cube
betterquesting.desc: You feel lonely. Wanna bounce?

betterquesting.name: §4§3§lBetter Tank... ULV Tank
betterquesting.desc: Next step is to store 32 buckets in a tank. The ULV Tank from Gt++ needs steel plates, iron plates, tin plates, a clay pipe, and a water bucket.

betterquesting.name: §5§lBetter Tank... LV Tank
betterquesting.desc: Next step is to store 64 buckets in a tank. The LV Tank from Gt++ needs steel plates, iron plates, bronze plates, a huge clay pipe, and an LV pump.

betterquesting.name: §5§lBetter Tank... MV Tank
betterquesting.desc: Next step is to store 128 buckets in a tank. The MV Tank from Gt++ needs steel plates, darksteel plates, bronze plates, a bronze pipe and an LV pump.

betterquesting.name: §6§lYou're gonna hate this #2 in MV too
betterquesting.desc:
The second item you'll need a lot of in MV tier. When you want to get fluid out of tanks you'll need one. 

§4Hint: Goes pretty well with fluid pipes or GT machines, adjust with a screwdriver. It can also be upgraded further into a fluid regulator which allows precise control of fluid transfer speed.

betterquesting.name: §6§lBetter Tank... HV Tank
betterquesting.desc: Next step is to store 256 buckets in a tank. The HV Tank from Gt++ needs aluminium plates, darksteel plates, vacuum tubes, a steel pipe, and an MV pump.

betterquesting.name: §6§lYou're gonna hate this #1 in MV too
betterquesting.desc:
The first item you'll need a lot of in MV too. If you want to pull items out of chests or barrels you'll need one. 

§4Hint: Goes pretty well with item pipes or GT machines, adjust with a screwdriver.

betterquesting.name: §6§lYou're gonna hate this #3 in MV too
betterquesting.desc: An electric piston for your MV machines. The third item you are going to craft a lot of in the future.

betterquesting.name: §6§lYou're gonna hate this #4 in MV too
betterquesting.desc:
The fourth item you'll need a lot of in MV, which is also a pain to craft. Arguably the most painful item ever. 

§4Hint: Works like a conveyor but can work with selected item slots. Adjust with a screwdriver.

betterquesting.name: §5§lSimple Ore Washer
betterquesting.desc: Too lazy to make an ore washer, yet bored with your non-automatable cauldron? Then the simple washer is the machine for you! It works reasonably fast and uses only 8eu max - make sure you don't provide too much voltage! Ok, so you do not get any byproducts, but who cares!

betterquesting.name: Paying the highest price
betterquesting.desc: A tier 2 blood altar needs 8 runes placed around the altar. Your new altar can hold more blood.

betterquesting.name: Don't look it in the eyes!
betterquesting.desc: Bad things may happen if this creature is allowed to stay alive. The ores in its cave are valuable anyway.

betterquesting.name: I don't even...
betterquesting.desc: Ok so there is this maze. And there are... minotaurs. But what in the world is a minoshroom?

betterquesting.name: A big ugly snake
betterquesting.desc: Required for your first wand and in general, an ugly creature.

betterquesting.name: Adventure time!
betterquesting.desc: Stop him before he makes his wish at Prismos'!

betterquesting.name: Who you're gonna call?
betterquesting.desc: Phantom Busters! Or wait... Ah whatever. They drop good armor by the way.

betterquesting.name: The big fluffy crybaby
betterquesting.desc: It flies, it makes funny sounds, and .. IT'S SO FLUFFY! Well, kill it.

betterquesting.name: Let her go
betterquesting.desc: It seems the cold doesn't bother her. Committed crimes: None. But... you know... you have to progress somehow...

betterquesting.name: Yeti. Alpha, Yeti.
betterquesting.desc: Wanted: Alpha Yeti. Death. Committed crimes: Violently throwing ice at people, for no reason.

betterquesting.name: Secret: A nice....
betterquesting.desc: Hey, you! I want that lamp. I have something for you in return. You don't need it anyways, do you?

betterquesting.name: Time to kill (Creeper)
betterquesting.desc: Who hasn't experienced this... You think nothing evil, mine a few diamonds, and suddenly, you wake up in your bed, all your items gone. Time to strike back!

betterquesting.name: Time to kill (Pigman)
betterquesting.desc: "Zombie Pigman"? What the hell is going on with you zombies! Maybe you should encase your animals better at night...

betterquesting.name: Time to kill (Spiders)
betterquesting.desc: Eeeek! Wall climbing monsters, gross! Slay them. Quickly! Watch out for the witch spiders, they can give as good as they get.

betterquesting.name: Time to kill (Skeleton)
betterquesting.desc:
Arrows are nice, if you shoot them. If one hits you, well, bad things happen. 

Hint: Arrows are an excellent source of telum.

betterquesting.name: Time to kill (Blaze)
betterquesting.desc: You should be careful with this task. Fire protection is highly recommended.

betterquesting.name: Time to kill (Zombie)
betterquesting.desc: Nobody knows who they are, or where they came from. They're just annoying at night, and too stupid to make a crafting table.

betterquesting.name: Time to kill (Enderman)
betterquesting.desc: Uh, fancy teleport pearls. You need them. All of them. Now!

betterquesting.name: Time to kill (Wither)
betterquesting.desc:
After collecting a couple of those wither skeleton heads, you feel like you could use some more action. So why not kill a wither? You'll need a ton of nether stars anyway...

Kill it twice for something nice.

betterquesting.name: Secret: The trade for life
betterquesting.desc: You have been busy my friend. I have something for you. Give me your hearts, and I will magically enhance them so you can actually use them.

betterquesting.name: Skeleton: Evolved
betterquesting.desc: In order to advance to a higher tier and reach Mars, Deimos and Phobos, you need to make yourself a better rocket. There are rumors that an Evolved Skeleton hiding out on the Moon has schematics of such a device.

betterquesting.name: Creeper: Evolved
betterquesting.desc: Not that regular creepers are nasty enough, no. There is an evolved creeper boss! He is your key (Well he HAS a key...) to reach the next tier of planets (Asteroid Belt, Ceres, Io, Europa, Ganymede, Callisto).

betterquesting.name: Blaze: Evolved
betterquesting.desc: In order to proceed to Tier 4 Planets, the blaze boss needs to be killed. Find him in one of the dungeons on Ceres.

betterquesting.name: Ghast: Evolved
betterquesting.desc: Fluffy, fluffier, ghasts! And also big crybabies. This one hides in a dungeon on IO, and holds the key for Tier 5 planets.

betterquesting.name: Crystal Boss: Ayyy.. Wait, what?
betterquesting.desc: Seriously, a crystal boss? Anyway, it's your key to Tier 6 planets, and he lurks around on Enceladus.

betterquesting.name: Slime: Evolved
betterquesting.desc: Totally looks like a thaumic slime to me. Don't you think so? Find this dude on Proteus.

betterquesting.name: Wolf:Evolved
betterquesting.desc: The final frontier... A... wolf that is not even an Iron Maiden fan?... What did you expect, a super boss? Heh. No. Budget was too tight...

betterquesting.name: Technology: Evolved
betterquesting.desc: You beat the game, literally. There is nothing left to do, you might want to try real life... But one thing might be interesting for you. You know, just for the phuns. Select one of the totally OP items here.

Lore: This! Is OP

betterquesting.name: Blood Altar Tier 3
betterquesting.desc: To make your altar more powerful you need to upgrade it. You need to build pillars two block high out of blood-soaked thaumium block and on top one block of glowstone blocks on each pillar.

betterquesting.name: Blood Altar Tier 4
betterquesting.desc: If you want to make tier 4 slates you need a Tier 4 altar. This can be made like the tier 3 altar with pillars out of void-blood-soaked stones four blocks high and a blood brick on top of the pillars.

betterquesting.name: Blood Altar Tier 5
betterquesting.desc: If you want to make tier 5 slates you need a Tier 5 altar. This can be made with 4 beacons. Beacons have thaumcraft recipes and can be found in the thaumcraft book on the GTNH page.

betterquesting.name: Blood Altar Tier 6
betterquesting.desc: The highest tier of the blood altar is tier 6. You need pillars of blood-soaked ichorium 7 blocks high and on top the crystal cluster blocks made out of demon soul shards.

betterquesting.name: §5§lAuto Mining
betterquesting.desc:
A miner in LV age? Wow! This nifty machine will find ores for you. Place up to two stacks of mining pipes in the right slots. This machine needs 8 EU/t to work. The miner searches for ores in a 17x17 block work area. Now comes with 2 fortune bonus! Great for gathering additional small ores...

Don't forget to cover it up! These are GT machines, so remember to protect them (and their power sources!) from rain on any side. And set a waypoint with Journeymaps so you don't forget where you placed it!

betterquesting.name: §6§lAuto Mining MV
betterquesting.desc:
The MV miner will find ores for you faster than the LV miner. Place up to two stacks of mining pipes in the right slots. This miner need 32 eu to work. The Miner searches ores in a 33x33 block area and works two times faster than the LV variant. Comes with 4 fortune bonus, great for gathering small ores in the Nether.
These are GT machines, so remember to protect them (and their power sources!) from rain on any side. And set a waypoint with Journeymaps so you don't forget where you placed it!

betterquesting.name: §9§lAuto Mining HV
betterquesting.desc: The HV miner will find ores for you faster than the MV miner. Place up to two stacks of mining pipes in the right slots. This miner needs 128 eu to work. The Miner searches ores in a 49x49 block area (three chunks wide, perfect for a chunkloader) and works two times faster than the MV variant. It also has a 6 fortune bonus, making it even better for small ores.  Recommend taking some with you to the Moon to gather meteoric iron.

betterquesting.name: §6§lPower of the Sun
betterquesting.desc:
Now its time to invest in some renewable energy. Let's start with solar panels. The basic one only gives 1 EU/t. Most GT machines can use them as covers. Be sure to put a glass layer above them in case it rains while you swap panels. You will still want to keep rain off the sides of the machine hull too.

§4The Aluminium Iron plate needs an MV Forming Press.

betterquesting.name: §6§lPower of the Sun 8V
betterquesting.desc: The next solar panel you can make is the ULV one. It generates 8 EU/t. Most gt machines can use them as covers.

betterquesting.name: §6§lPower of the Sun 1x1
betterquesting.desc: Put those single eu panels on a block to make them placeable in the world. Use an MV assembler to combine the panel with a ULV hull.

betterquesting.name: §a§lPower of the Sun at LV Level
betterquesting.desc: The next solar panel you can make is the LV one. It generates 32 EU/t max. Most gt machines can use them as covers. First you need to produce a sunnarium item by using 10 million eu power.

betterquesting.name: §a§lPower of the Sun 1x1 LV
betterquesting.desc: Put those 32 EU panels on a block to make them placeable in the world. Use an MV assembler to combine the panel with an LV hull, a battery, and a robot arm. Now this panel will clean itself!

betterquesting.name: §6§lAutomated Sticky Resin Farmer
betterquesting.desc: If you are tired of crafting tons of tree taps, how about a machine that uses power but never breaks? Let's craft an electric tree tap!

betterquesting.name: §6§lAutomated Farmer
betterquesting.desc: Your hoe must be getting worn out by now. Why not craft an electric one which never breaks?

betterquesting.name: §6§lCleanroom
betterquesting.desc:
If you want to make more advanced circuits you'll need a cleanroom. The cleanroom is a multiblock between 3x4x3 and 15x15x15 (WxHxD) blocks. Besides plascrete blocks for all edges you'll need a controller in the top center, filter machine casings for the rest of the top except edges, an energy and maintenance hatch , a reinforced door and three machine hulls. For now you can use MV tier.

Let's build a 5x5x5 room. Expanding it vertically is easy to do, or you can make it wider and longer, as long as both X and Z match and are odd. Up to 5% of the plascrete blocks can be replaced with Reinforced Glass to see into the cleanroom and check on machines.

You can pass materials through the walls using Machine Hulls.  You can pass 1A of power using Machine Hulls as well, or you can use Diodes to pass multiple amps through walls.

Just be really careful when upgrading you machines. Be sure to remove the machine hulls and diodes and replace them with the new power tier, or else you will be very sad.

If the Cleanroom has maintenance issues, it will have a chance to void recipes needing a cleanroom. Monitor your cleanroom with a Hand Scanner, Industrial Information Panel, or using a Needs Maintenance Cover and a Redstone Powered Light or Howler Alarm.

betterquesting.name: §6§lA very useful Scanner
betterquesting.desc:
The portable scanner is a tool capable of showing advanced information about almost every block in the game. 
In order to function, the tool needs to be charged first. It can hold up to 400k EU and accept 128 EU/t or less. This is MV tier.

It can scan crops, which shows more information than the cropnalyzer does. The crop, which was scanned in the world, will drop a scanned seed bag.
It can scan machines from GregTech, giving information about current progress, the stored energy, efficiency, problems and CPU-load - be sure to check the full chat window for additional details.
For any block in the game it scans, it gives information about its ID, Metadata, position in the world and hardness value.
It also gives information about pollution level in the chunk the scanned block belongs to.
In addition it shows when the cleanroom has reached its 100 percent efficieny level.

betterquesting.name: §3§lIt's a dirty job, and you're going to do it
betterquesting.desc:
The Plunger is used to clear liquids from pipes. It can also be used on a machine to remove up to 1000mb of fluid from its internal buffer. You don't have to wrench your machine and replace it. It can be crafted from a rod of the desired material and rubber sheets. 

§4Hint: Plunger deals 2.75 - 7.75 damage depending on the materials used.

betterquesting.name: §9§lPerforming chemical experiments at HV Level
betterquesting.desc: High tier chemical recipes like ammonia need an HV chemical reactor.

betterquesting.name: §6§lSuper Tank I
betterquesting.desc: Next step is to store 4000 buckets in a tank. The super tank I needs a hermetic casing made with aluminium plates and PTFE pipe. The tank need 4 circuits, a pulsating iron plate and an MV pump. Now you can store the same amount of fluids a steel 5x5 Railcraft tank contains in a single block.

betterquesting.name: §2§lChad - A better way to make Paper
betterquesting.desc: Making paper out of wood pulp and water can be tedious and difficult. Why not macerate some sugar cane down to chads and press it with two stone plates to paper? Later on you can use the chemical bath for a even better ratio.

betterquesting.name: §1§lBamboo fence
betterquesting.desc:
Maybe you are lucky and start off in a bamboo forest.
Bamboo is a very useful tree since it grows really fast and when you place bamboo sticks they will grow and protect your base behind a 3 block tall wall.
Alternatively, you can also use Berry Bushes.

betterquesting.name: §2§lPunji Sticks
betterquesting.desc: A early game protection moat can be made out of punji sticks. It hurts all mobs/players and additionally gives a slowness II potion effect. Make a trench around your base and put the punji sticks inside.

betterquesting.name: §3§lBetter than iron
betterquesting.desc:
Wrought Iron will become more important very soon when you have a bit of steel and are able to build high pressure steam machines. The material is much harder than iron, and you can make better tools with it too.
To make wrought iron, you need a tinkers smelter to melt some iron ingots down and cast nuggets; put these in a furnace to get wrought iron nuggets. With the compressor, you can compress the nuggets into ingots.

§§§4§4§9§4Hint:
Crushed or purified iron ore (not an impure version, look for Chalcopyrite veins) can be smelted to iron nuggets directly. Or you can use an alloy smelter to turn iron ingots into nuggets faster than a smeltery.

Later on, you can use an arc furnace to make wrought iron ingots directly.

betterquesting.name: Garden Bags
betterquesting.desc: Finding some special "Pam's HarvestCraft" gardens can be very difficult. With your farmer coins you can buy some garden bags.

betterquesting.name: XP berries
betterquesting.desc: And a few xp berries for cash.

betterquesting.name: §6§lFluid Solidifier
betterquesting.desc: Use molds to make plates, sticks, bolts and many more item parts in the fluid solidifier.

betterquesting.name: §6§lBase too big? I've got a fix for you!
betterquesting.desc: Keeping a base spread apart for pollution or explosion prevention can really wear you out. Try harvesting some Marble and centrifuging it into Calcite, and mix up some concrete in your Mixer. Next output it into a Fluid Solidifier with a block mold to make concrete blocks. You'll move faster on top of these blocks. They can even be turned into bricks to prevent unwanted spawns! Hint: 10 buckets of wet mix converts to exactly 160 blocks. These blocks can also be Chiseled into different varieties.

betterquesting.name: Stainless Steel Pipes
betterquesting.desc: Stainless steel pipes are much better than steel pipes. Like all high tier pipes (Titanium, Tungstensteel etc) you need a better wrench to deconstruct the pipes.

betterquesting.name: §6§lThe "Water Problems" are solved
betterquesting.desc: Entering the HV age you found a way of making a water reservoir which solves the finite water problem. Craft it with some fused quartz glass, HV pumps, and cauldrons.

betterquesting.name: Piston
betterquesting.desc: Want some pistons? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Bronze Fluid Pipes
betterquesting.desc: Want some bronze fluid pipes? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Magnetic Iron
betterquesting.desc: Want some magnetic iron for motors? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Tin Rotor
betterquesting.desc: Want some tin rotors? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Iron Rods
betterquesting.desc: Want some iron rods? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Brass Rod
betterquesting.desc: Want some brass rods? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Certus Quartz
betterquesting.desc: Want some certus quartz? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: §5§lVroooooom...
betterquesting.desc:
Tired of standing around to collect all the drops and XP from your diamond spikes?

Make yourself a vacuum hopper to suck up all the drops and XP.  Feed the XP into a tank to store it.

betterquesting.name: Basic Circuit Board
betterquesting.desc: Want some basic circuit boards? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Good Circuit Board
betterquesting.desc: Want some good circuit boards? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Vacuum Tubes
betterquesting.desc: Want some vacuum tubes? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Resistors
betterquesting.desc: Want some resistors? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Diodes
betterquesting.desc: Want some diodes? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Wafers
betterquesting.desc: Want some wafers? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Transistors
betterquesting.desc: Want some transistors? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Ram Wafer
betterquesting.desc: Want some ram wafers? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Integrated Logic Circuit Wafer
betterquesting.desc: Want some integrated logic circuit wafers? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Oil
betterquesting.desc: Want some oil? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Creosote Oil
betterquesting.desc: Want some creosote oil? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Naphtha
betterquesting.desc: Want some naphtha? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Methane
betterquesting.desc: Want some methane? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Ethanol
betterquesting.desc: Want some ethanol? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Oxygen
betterquesting.desc: Want some oxygen? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Nitrogen
betterquesting.desc: Want some nitrogen? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Hydrogen
betterquesting.desc: Want some hydrogen? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Glue
betterquesting.desc: Want some glue? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Lubricant
betterquesting.desc: Want some lubricant? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Sulfuric Acid
betterquesting.desc: What some sulfuric acid? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Engineering processor
betterquesting.desc: Want some engineering processors? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Silverwood Sapling
betterquesting.desc: Silverwood saplings are always rare to find. Want some? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Time to kill (Ghast)
betterquesting.desc:
They shoot you with explosive fireballs but they are weak when you hit them or knock the fireballs back with a weapon. Better upgrade your armor with fire and blast protection.

Sorry about the giant ghast Amancila, it can't be changed. 

You'll need to kill 10.

betterquesting.name: Is this the End? No the END Dimension
betterquesting.desc:
Your investigation into the pearls has shown you that the source of the disturbance seems to be coming out of the shimmering portals inside strongholds. You feel strangely drawn into its mysterious depths.

Hint: throwing Ender Eyes in the air in the Overworld will guide you to the nearest stronghold . From time to time Ender Eyes are destroyed in this process, so make extras.

betterquesting.name: §9§lUpgraded RF Batteries
betterquesting.desc: Capacitor Banks are upgraded RF batteries which can store the RF power you generate. You can put many blocks together to enlarge your total battery capacity.

betterquesting.name: §9§lBigger, Better, Chargier?
betterquesting.desc: The Vibrant Capacitor Bank is the largest RF Battery for now. It can store 25 million RF in a single block. Putting many capacitor banks together will enlarge your total battery capacity.

betterquesting.name: §a§9§lVibrant alloy
betterquesting.desc: Vibrant alloy is a high tier EnderIO alloy made out of ender eye, energetic alloy and chrome dust. 3600k heating coils and a vacuum freezer are needed to make ingots.

betterquesting.name: §9§lEnergetic Alloy
betterquesting.desc: Energetic alloy is a new alloy from EnderIO made out of gold, conductive iron and black steel dust. Double-layer capacitors need it and it can be made in the  electric blast furnace with tier 2 coils (2700K).

betterquesting.name: Dark Steel Armor basic upgrades
betterquesting.desc: In order to upgrade one armor item with basic upgrades, you need a vibrant crystal and 10 xp levels.

betterquesting.name: Go find some tropical bees
betterquesting.desc:
Next you will need to find some tropical bees. The hives can be found in Jungle biomes. Be careful as these bees are very aggressive and can poison you. Collect the silky combs and extract some silk wisp from those in order to make some Apiarist's clothes.
Looking for pristine Bees.

betterquesting.name: Silky combs and Propolis
betterquesting.desc:
Collect silky combs and extract some silk wisp out of it in order to make some Apiarist's clothes.
This can take quite a bit of time.
Use a GregTech or Forestry Centrifuge to get Silky Propolis.

betterquesting.name: The Centrifuge
betterquesting.desc: The Forestry Centrifuge is able to centrifuge up to 9 items out of bee combs. It uses RF energy.

betterquesting.name: Woven silk
betterquesting.desc:
Centrifuge your silky propolis to get some silk wisp at a chance of 60 percent. Put 9 silk wisp in the Forestry carpenter or Gregtech assembler to get woven silk. 
This fine fabric can be used for crafting Apiarist's Clothes or to upgrade your Forestry Backpacks to 45 slots.

betterquesting.name: Apiarist's Cloth
betterquesting.desc: If you have collected 24 woven silk you can make a complete Apiarist's suit to be protected from bee stings and other bad bee effects. You can also use the suit parts to upgrade your EnderIO Dark Steel Armor.

betterquesting.name: Dark Steel Armor advanced upgrades
betterquesting.desc:
Your Dark Steel armor can be upgraded in various ways by combining it with various other items. You will need an anvil and a lot of XP.

Make sure when making the potions to only do three at a time, so the NBT data matches.

betterquesting.name: §9§lDark Steel Tool and Weapon basic upgrades
betterquesting.desc: In order to upgrade a weapon or tool, you need a vibrant crystal and 10 xp levels.

betterquesting.name: §9§lDark Steel Tool and Weapon advanced upgrades
betterquesting.desc: Your weapons and tools can be upgraded even more by adding capacitors and various other items.

betterquesting.name: §9§lRF Solar Panel
betterquesting.desc: It is possible to power RF machines with a solar panel. It outputs 10 RF/t. Perfect for low use RF machines.

betterquesting.name: §9§lRF Solar Panel Tier 2
betterquesting.desc: The upgraded RF solar panel is much better. It outputs 40 RF/t.

betterquesting.name: Enchanted Earth
betterquesting.desc: Enchanted Earth makes saplings and seeds planted on it grow faster. When stacked on top of each other it has a chance to add ticks to the block above accumulating all the way to the top. This will randomly speed up growth a bit.

betterquesting.name: §aPower of the Sun at MV Level
betterquesting.desc: The next solar panel you can make is the MV one. It gives 128 EU/t max. Most GT machines can use them as covers. First you need to produce sunnarium out of 9 smaller sunnarium pieces.

betterquesting.name: §a§lPower of the Sun 1x1 MV
betterquesting.desc: Put those 128 EU panels on a block to make them placeable in the world. Use an HV assembler to combine the panel with an MV hull, a battery, and a robot arm. This panel doesn't need to be cleaned manually.

betterquesting.name: §a§lIndium
betterquesting.desc:
At EV Level you are able to make Indium for HV Solar Panels. Indium cannot be found in Ore form. It can only be made with an EV chemical reactor.
First you need to make indium out of purified galena and sphalerite ore. Mix in some aluminium to get indium.

betterquesting.name: §b§lPower of the Sun at HV Level
betterquesting.desc: The next solar panel you can make is the HV one. It generates 512 EU/t max. Most GregTech machines can use them as covers. First you need to produce enriched sunnarium by mixing irradiated uranium and sunnarium. The Avaritia 9x9 dire crafting table is required to make this panel.

betterquesting.name: §b§lPower of the Sun 1x1 HV
betterquesting.desc: Put those 512 EU panels on a block to make them placeable in the world. Use an EV assembler to combine the panel with an HV hull, a battery, and a robot arm. This panel doesn't need to be cleaned manually.

betterquesting.name: §3§lBooks
betterquesting.desc:
Books can be found easily enough in villages or in the roguelike dungeons surface brick house.
I'm sure they have a recipe too.

Now glue on the other hand...or should I say horse? Try and get a horse inside a smeltery and feed it hay to keep it alive.

Or you can wait until after you go to the Nether and get some sulfur. Either way.

betterquesting.name: Fish trapping 2.0
betterquesting.desc:
Fishing can be very boring. Why not automate it with a fish trap?
This is your fish trap 2.0

betterquesting.name: Fresh Water and Milk
betterquesting.desc:
Many cooking recipes need milk and water. Crafting it in the crafting table can be very tedious.
It is much easier using a Forestry worktable. Drag-click all your buckets into the worktable, and craft them all at once.

betterquesting.name: §9§lFind Bauxite
betterquesting.desc: The main goal when you reach the Moon is to find some bauxite ore to make titanium for the EV machine tier. Some meteoric iron is required for your tier 2 rocket for reaching Mars so be sure to collect a stack from fallen meteors and small ores beneath the surface.

betterquesting.name: §9§lRutile
betterquesting.desc:
Rutile can be thermal centrifuged out of bauxite and ilmenite dust. 
Electrolyzing bauxite can extract even more rutile and putting ilmenite in the electric blast furnace can give some rutile too.

betterquesting.name: §6§lSMD Circuit components
betterquesting.desc:
Surface-mount devices are more advanced circuits parts. They are needed for high tier circuits and are cheaper to craft than basic capacitors, transitors, diodes and resistors. You need an Advanced Assembler and some molten polyethylene.

Be sure to check how much gallium you have available. It might not be worth it to use SMD diodes and resistors until you have a steady supply with an HV macerator, bees, or bauxite ore. Also look into IC2 crops to 4x your zinc, sphalerite, and bauxite.

§4The easiest way to get Platinum is with Nickel ore and a chemical bath.

betterquesting.name: §9§lWorkstation Extreme Circuit
betterquesting.desc:
The next tier of circuits are the extreme circuits. Workstation Circuits are the easiest one and are needed in EV Tier. Let's craft some.

In addition, you will need 16 Diodes, SMD or non-SMD.

betterquesting.name: §6§lEmpty Plastic Board
betterquesting.desc: Plastic circuit boards require plastic Plate with Sulfuric Acid to make an Empty Board. By adding copper foil and Iron(III) Chloride or Sodium Persulfate you can craft a plastic circuit board.

betterquesting.name: §9§lIntegrated Processor
betterquesting.desc:
There are three variants of good circuits. The good electronic circuit, the good integrated circuit and the integrated processor which needs an MV circuit assembling machine. The integrated processor requires a CPU, capacitors, transistors and resistors.
A cleanroom is needed.

You will need in addtion 4 Resistors, 4 Capacitors and 4 Transistors. You can use SMD or non SMD versions.

betterquesting.name: §9§lProcessor Assembly
betterquesting.desc:
Another variant of the advanced circuit from IC2 is the processor assembly.
Two Integrated Processors are needed in the MV circuit assembler recipe.
The recipe is a cleanroom recipe.

In addition you will need 8 Capacitors, SMD or non-SMD is fine.

betterquesting.name: §9§lCentral Processing Unit
betterquesting.desc:
Integrated Processors need central processing units. You can get these by cutting a ram wafer.
A cleanroom is needed.

betterquesting.name: §9§lSmall Coil
betterquesting.desc: Processing assembly needs some small coils.

betterquesting.name: §6§lIron (III) Chloride
betterquesting.desc:
Iron(III) Chloride can be made by first making hydrochloric acid out of hydrogen and chlorine. Then combine this with some iron dust to make Iron(III) Chloride.
You can etch your board with it.

betterquesting.name: §6§r§6§k§r§6§lSodium Persulfate
betterquesting.desc:
Sodium Persulfate can be made in the electrolyzer out of sodium bisulfate dust.
Sodium bisulfate is made out of sulfuric acid and salt in the chemical reactor.
You can etch your board with it.
Save the hydrochloric acid for your future epoxid production.

betterquesting.name: Magnetic Steel
betterquesting.desc: Want some magnetic steel for motors? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Alu Rods
betterquesting.desc: Want some alu rods? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Bronze Rotor
betterquesting.desc: Want some bronze rotors? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Steel Fluid Pipes
betterquesting.desc: Want some steel fluid pipes? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Electrum Rods
betterquesting.desc: Want some electrum rods? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Flawless Emerald
betterquesting.desc: Want some flawless emeralds? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Ender Pearl
betterquesting.desc: Want some ender pearls? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Magnetic Neodymium
betterquesting.desc: Want some magnetic neodymium for motors? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Stainless Steel Rods
betterquesting.desc: Want some stainless steel rods? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Steel rotor
betterquesting.desc: Want some steel rotors? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Stainless Steel Fluid Pipes
betterquesting.desc: Want some stainless steel fluid pipes? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Chrome Rods
betterquesting.desc: Want some chrome rods? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Ender Eyes
betterquesting.desc: Want some ender eyes? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: §5§lBe sure to get your armpits
betterquesting.desc: Want to use all that delicious XP to raise your levels? Move the tank with XP above you and attach this convenient shower head to take the XP from the tank.

betterquesting.name: Plastic Circuit Board
betterquesting.desc: Want some plastic circuit boards? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Central Procesing Unit Wafer
betterquesting.desc: Want some central processing unit wafers? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Resistors SMD
betterquesting.desc: Want some SMD resistors? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Diodes SMD
betterquesting.desc: Want some SMD diodes? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Transistors SMD
betterquesting.desc: Want some SMD transistors? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Capacitor SMD
betterquesting.desc: Want some SMD capacitors? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Logic processor
betterquesting.desc: Want some logic processors? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Chlorine
betterquesting.desc: Want some chlorine? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Iron (III) Chloride
betterquesting.desc: Want some iron 3 chloride? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Sodium Persulfate
betterquesting.desc: Want some sodium persulfate? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Pyrochlore Ore
betterquesting.desc: Can't find Pyrochlore ore because of an old worldgen? Buy some Ores.

betterquesting.name: Forest Hive
betterquesting.desc: Want some Forest Bees? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Deep Hive
betterquesting.desc: Want some Attuned Bees? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Ender Hive
betterquesting.desc: Want some Ender Bees? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Bees House
betterquesting.desc: Want some bee houses? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Apiary
betterquesting.desc: Want some Apiaries? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Impregnated Frames
betterquesting.desc: Want some impregnated frames? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Infernal Hive
betterquesting.desc: Want some Infernal Bees? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Oblivion Hive
betterquesting.desc: Want some Oblivion Bees? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Did you want to know your warp level?
betterquesting.desc:
After a few forbidden researches your warp level has increased a bit. Do you want to know how much warp you have?
Craft some litmus paper to print out the warp level.

betterquesting.name: Meadow Hive
betterquesting.desc: Want some Meadows Bees? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Modest Hive
betterquesting.desc: Want some Modest Bees? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Tropical Hive
betterquesting.desc: Want some Forest Bees? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Wintry Hive
betterquesting.desc: Want some Wintry Bees? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Marshy Hive
betterquesting.desc: Want some Marshy Bees? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Water Hive
betterquesting.desc: Want some Water Bees? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Rocky Hive
betterquesting.desc: Want some Rocky Bees? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Nether Hive
betterquesting.desc: Want some Embittered Bees? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Curious Hive
betterquesting.desc: Want some Mystical Bees? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Unusual Hive
betterquesting.desc: Want some Unusual Bees? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Resonating Hive
betterquesting.desc: Want some Sorcerous Bees? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Space Station
betterquesting.desc:
Here's an idea for your space station.
You can add up to four spin thrusters to your station to rotate it.

Days on space stations last longer than on the overworld, so you can generate more solar power.

betterquesting.name: Are you prepared?
betterquesting.desc:
Are you prepared for the Moon?
A few things will help you to live longer and prevent you from dying on the Moon.
If you die on the moon you will be returned to earth without your stuff. A Soulbind enchantment will keep an item with you when you die.
Graves are placed at the location where you died.

betterquesting.name: Oak, Spruce, Birch, Jungle Sapling
betterquesting.desc: You spawned in a desert and need Oak or Birch saplings? No problem! For five Forestry Coins you can select which one you want to buy.

betterquesting.name: Magic Feather
betterquesting.desc:
Let's craft some magical Map focuses to create a magical map which will help you find Twilight Monster Bosses.
Go find some Raven feathers. You can get them by killing Ravens sitting on Obsidian Blocks in Twilight. Then you need some Torchberries and some Glowstone dust.

betterquesting.name: Magic Map
betterquesting.desc: For the Magic map you need the magic map focus and a stack of paper. Please only use the map in the Twilight Forest. You can only get one map every 24 hours so be careful with it. Using the map in the Overworld or another dimension will lag the server.

betterquesting.name: Moon arrival
betterquesting.desc:
I have a small present for you: a Talisman of Remedium which is very useful to persevere during the dark nights with all these monsters.
First you have to prove you can survive on the moon by yourself. After mining some moon turf, dirt, and rock, you can have it.

Make sure you check back in the HV questline for necessary ores you should gather while here.

betterquesting.name: Naga
betterquesting.desc: Summon a Naga in the Twilight Forest.

betterquesting.name: Lich
betterquesting.desc: Summon a Lich in the Twilight Forest.

betterquesting.name: Minoshroom
betterquesting.desc: Summon a Minoshroom in the Twilight Forest.

betterquesting.name: Hydra
betterquesting.desc: Summon a Hydra in the Twilight Forest.

betterquesting.name: Knight Phantom
betterquesting.desc: Summon a Knight Phantom in the Twilight Forest.

betterquesting.name: Ur Ghast
betterquesting.desc: Summon an Ur-Ghast in the Twilight Forest.

betterquesting.name: Yeti
betterquesting.desc: Summon a Yeti in the Twilight Forest.

betterquesting.name: Snow Queen
betterquesting.desc: Summon a Snow Queen in the Twilight Forest.

betterquesting.name: §6§lMV Bending
betterquesting.desc: This Plate Bending Machine allows you to directly make double, triple or more compressed plates, which might be useful for your first rocket in HV Tier.

betterquesting.name: §6§lMV Battery Buffers
betterquesting.desc:
MV machines can internally hold 1 battery. But sometimes you need to store more power than that, or you want a whole powerline to share batteries. You can use a battery buffer to store large amounts of batteries. They come in different sizes like 1x, 4x, 9x and 16x.
Build a 4x buffer.

betterquesting.name: §6§lMV Lithium Battery
betterquesting.desc: Better machines need some better batteries. Lithium is the best material to use when making batteries.

betterquesting.name: §5§lLubricant
betterquesting.desc:
Using lubricant instead of water or distilled water in your cutting machines will increase the output or speed of the machines.
You can make lubricant out of oil, seed oil, fish oil or creosote in a distillery. If you are able to craft a brewery you can use talc and soapstone to get much more lubricant each cycle.

Lube cells are required to make low tier energy hatches, so stockpile a few cells and use the rest to make your cutting machine faster.

betterquesting.name: §2§lMore Compact Storage
betterquesting.desc: Now that you are starting to find more and more iron you feel your wood chests are too small to hold all the stuff you found and collected. Now it's time to upgrade your chests to iron chests. You can just build a new chest or upgrade the wood chest with a wood to iron chest upgrade item.

betterquesting.name: Juice
betterquesting.desc: Most of your berries can be extracted to juice. This is a chance to get more food variants and the nutritional value is higher than eating the fruit directly.

betterquesting.name: Potato Cakes
betterquesting.desc: Potatoes, onions, butter and a skillet make very tasty potato cakes.

betterquesting.name: Fried Eggs
betterquesting.desc: So easy, skillet and an egg.... fried egg.

betterquesting.name: Hearty Breakfast
betterquesting.desc:
Let's now combine all the things together and make a healthy and very good breakfast.
Some cooked meat, potato cakes, toast, fried egg and a tasty juice provide you with a very nourishing meal.
You can use any cooked meat and any fruit juice here.

betterquesting.name: §5§lTry to dry out the Nether
betterquesting.desc:
Pumps can do more than pump oil and water. You can go to the nether and pump lava from the huge lava lakes too.
Don't forget to bring some tanks or fluid cells with you. Once you reach HV lava can be centrifuged for gold, silver, tin, copper, and a little tungstate.

This is a good use for your LV pumps once you upgrade to MV pumps for oil.

betterquesting.name: §5§lDiamond Tanks... Oh shiny
betterquesting.desc: After you build a cutting machine you can make some diamond plates for your new 64 buckets single block tank.

betterquesting.name: §5§lNew source of Glowstone
betterquesting.desc: Find some glowflowers in the Nether and plant them in the Overworld. You will never need to go to the Nether and harvest glowstone again.

betterquesting.name: §6§lDid you run low on Gold or Redstone?
betterquesting.desc:
Did you run low on redstone and gold? No problem with your glowstone flower farm. You can centrifuge glowstone dust to redstone and gold dust.
Redstone is also a good source of aluminium and chrome.

betterquesting.name: §5§lDiamond Chests... Oh shiny
betterquesting.desc: After you build a cutting machine you can make some diamond plates for your new big diamond chests.

betterquesting.name: §2§lEven More Compact Storage
betterquesting.desc: If you found enough gold you can upgrade your chest to make it an even bigger inventory of 9x9. You can just build a new chest or upgrade the iron chest with a wood to gold chest upgrade item. You can use an assembler to make them a little easier.

betterquesting.name: Scribing Tool
betterquesting.desc: To unlock your researches you need a scribing tool and paper. Better make two of them. One for your research table and one for researches. You also need some paper and ink.

betterquesting.name: Bathing the warp effects away.
betterquesting.desc: Litmus paper tell you how high you warp level is, but how can you get rid of the nasty warp effects? Bath salt will help you by prohibiting warp effects for a short period. Just throw the salt into a 1x1 water hole and jump inside. You will feel relieved a bit after bathing.

betterquesting.name: Bathing in a Spa. Automated Warp removing
betterquesting.desc: Bathing in a spa will automate the process of temporary removing warp effects. Take the bath salt with you into the spa.

betterquesting.name: Temp warp remover Soap
betterquesting.desc:
This soap is very special. It will remove temporary warp and has a small chance to also remove some normal warp, if you are lucky. Taking a bath first increases your chances.

Hint: You need to chisel your tallow block for the recipe to work.

betterquesting.name: Enchanting Table 1.0
betterquesting.desc: Finally with your new wand and 50 stored vis you are able to build your own enchantment table. The recipe can be found on the GTNH Thaumcraft Page

betterquesting.name: Division Sigil
betterquesting.desc:
Maybe you found a division sigil in a chest already. You have heard about some ritual to activate it.

You need an enchantment table, 8 redstone dust, a good sword and an animal you want to sacrifice at night. Catching and holding it with a lasso would be the easiest way.
Place your enchantment table on a grass field and surround it with redstone dust.
Precisely at midnight place the animal on or near the table and kill it.
Of course you also need to have your sigil on you.
Be aware! Your actions will have consequences.

betterquesting.name: Beacon
betterquesting.desc: With your new wand you are able to create a beacon. The beacon recipe is found on the GTNH Thaumcraft Page. Activate it in your base to gain various positive effects.

betterquesting.name: Cursed Earth
betterquesting.desc: Kill the monsters that spawn on the cursed earth. Use a shovel with the silk touch enchantment to dig up the cursed earth blocks. You will need these blocks for your mob spawner later.

betterquesting.name: Silky Jewel
betterquesting.desc:
It's time to craft some silky jewels for your tinkers tools. Lots of blocks you can easily grab with this tool.

The recipe can be found on the GTNH page after researching the enchantment table.

betterquesting.name: Division Sigil Stable
betterquesting.desc:
The second ritual will not be as easy as the first one. After this ritual your sigil will be stable enough to make stable unstable ingots which will not explode.

This ritual needs to be performed in The End dimension. 
The ritual is performed by placing a Beacon in the centre of a flat area of at least 11x11, not necessarily End Stone. Then place a chest in each of the cardinal directions leaving 4 spaces empty between the chest and the Beacon. In each chest insert these specific contents:

North: iron ingot, gold ingot and the other things listed in the task.
South: The different Ore Blocks and the other things listed in the task.
East: The potions.
West: The Music disks.

A spiral pattern of Redstone and String is then laid out around the beacon. At any time, Shift+Right-clicking the Beacon with an Activated Division Sigil in hand will show the building progress of the ritual.

Finally, kill an Iron Golem while it stands within the ritual area to activate the process. If it works, there will be an explosion that destroys the beacon and chests, while every Enderman in the End vanishes. During the ritual, throngs of aggresive mobs imbued with Haste will begin spawning and attacking the Player who needs to kill 100 of them to complete the ritual. If the Player dies or leaves the dimension, the ritual will fail and will have to be started over. Once enough mobs have been killed, the first activated Sigil in the inventory will stabilize. The Pseudo-Inversion Sigil can be used an unlimited number of times, and dividing an Iron Ingot by Diamond will produce Mobius "Unstable-Stable" Ingot which does not explode, can be produced in any crafting interface and will stack up to 64.

betterquesting.name: Blub blub blub.....
betterquesting.desc:
The brewing stand is really important for brewing the various potions like night vision, healing, haste and jump. Toxic potions or splash potions can be created too. 
With your basic wand you can create one.

The recipes can be found on the GTNH page in the Thaumonomicon.

betterquesting.name: §4§3§lThe Iron Guy
betterquesting.desc:
Do you feel lonely? Need some extra protection in your base? Want to keep the pigmen off your back in the Nether?
They can do good amounts of damage and aggro enemies like the pigmen away from you. They can even take care of that pesky Vampire Pigman.
Craft some Iron Golems and the monster problem inside your base will be gone.

betterquesting.name: §3§lThe Cool Guy
betterquesting.desc:
Feeling lonely? Located far away from a smow biome?
Craft a Snow Golem, and perhaps challenge him to a snow ball fight.

betterquesting.name: Oh crunchy
betterquesting.desc: After hours of doing Thaumcraft research you found a way to craft pure tears. Ichorium purifies the nether star which sucks all the warp away. Be careful, as this may have a deadly end.

betterquesting.name: Purge all your warp
betterquesting.desc:
Did you ever have a dream where you could purge all your warp with no bad side effects? This purification talisman will let your dreams come true.
Do not forget to wear it.

betterquesting.name: A Chest for Bees
betterquesting.desc: A chest for bees only. It can hold up to 125 different bees in one chest.

betterquesting.name: Frames
betterquesting.desc:
Untreated frames are the simplest frames. They do not work in bee houses, only in apiaries. You will need them to craft bee houses.

They increase the bee's performance. Each untreated frame will double a bee's productivity.

betterquesting.name: Impregnated Frames
betterquesting.desc:
Impregnated Frames are even better than untreated Frames. 
Each frame doubles the bee's productivity. It has a longer durability than the untreated frame, but a shorter one compared to the proven frame.

betterquesting.name: Proven Frame
betterquesting.desc:
Proven frames are much better than impregnated ones.
Each frame doubles the bee's productivity. Out of the three Forestry frames (Untreated, Impregnated and Proven), the proven frame has the longest durability.

You can make them or purchase them from a villager. If you can't find a beekeeper, there are couple of different options to get one. Rescue a zombie villager, add doors to a village to get them to make kids, or perhaps use a cupid's bow and arrow...

betterquesting.name: Moron's Guide to Taller Trees
betterquesting.desc:
Forestry trees have a variety of attributes.  Once you get a tree with a useful attribute, you can breed that attribute into other tree species. This way you can get an ultimate tree that combines all the attributes you want - including the type of fruit! These breeding lines do not cover every option or even the best, but are great starts to get you into Forestry.

IT IS RECOMMENDED YOU DO YOUR FORESTRY TREE BREEDING IN AN ENCLOSED AREA, OR UNDERGROUND. BUTTERFLIES ARE A KNOWN LAG SOURCE.

For faster tree breeding, enclose your trees so that butterflies cannot escape, and breed bees with better traits for area and pollination.

Girth - The width of your tree.  Wider trees have more leaves, but will also need more saplings to begin growing. All saplings must be the same species and girth. The sapling in the NW corner determines the stats of the new tree, and is where bone meal must be applied to mature the tree. Butternut already provides 2x2 girth.

Height - Controls how high the tree grows. Jungle trees are already Larger, but if you want Largest there is a guide to getting Cocobolo trees. There are rumors of rare villagers with Giant Sequoia saplings capable of reaching into the clouds...

Matures - The growth speed of a sapling into a tree.  Important if you plan to cut it down right away for logs.

Saplings - Chance of getting a sapling from a detroyed leaf. Balsa, a tree on the way to Cocobolo, has High number of saplings. Good for making into biomass or other uses.

Sappiness - The amount of biomass a sapling produces in the Fermenter. Boost Fermenter output more using honey or fruit juice. Blue Mahoe provides the highest sappiness, but Lemon and Plum are respectable.

Yield - Chances of getting a fruit from a destroyed leaf. Plum is the best here.

Fruit - Each fruit from various trees provides different advantages. Lemons are great sources of Fruit Juice but don't provide much Mulch for the fermenter. On the other hand, Plum is a mediocre source of Fruit Juice, but great for Mulch. The best seedoil nut is coconut, but butternut or hazelnut are good alternatives.

When breeding these trees for quests, you will need to breed the species "pure", not a hybrid.

betterquesting.name: Breed some cultivated bees
betterquesting.desc:
Common Princess and Foresty Drone can be bred to cultivated bees. 

Cultivated bees have the shorest lifespan - this means they make great princesses to breed with your newly bred drones. The queen will die quickly, quickly giving genetic material to work with.  Make sure the traits you want are kept!

They are also a Fast production bee, which means lots of honey combs for powering your Beealyzer or Treealyzer. 

Cultivated Bees produce Honey Combs every 0.9 minutes. Note that production times are an approximation based on the bee's base production speed and the product's rarity. They do not reflect actual production time.

Make sure your cultivated bees are pure with a Beealyzer or GT scanner.

The main bee breeding quests will require pure bees but you can use Ignoble or Pristine princesses.

betterquesting.name: Breed some common bees
betterquesting.desc:
To cross breed bees you need two different species of bees. One drone and one princess from different hives (Meadows and Forestry as an example)
Bee Houses do not allow crossbreeding. In an Apiary you can cross breed them to a new species. Certain frames will help this process. Shortening their lifespan means faster crosses. Increasing Mutation rate means getting rare bees quicker.

Common Bees produce Honey Combs every 2.2 minutes. Note that production times are an approximation based on the bee's base production speed and the product's rarity. They do not reflect actual production time. 

Make sure your bees are pure by checking their genetics with a Beealyzer or GT scanner.

betterquesting.name: Breed some noble bees
betterquesting.desc:
Cross breeding common and cultivated bees can result in noble bees. 

Noble bees produce dripping combs every 3.8 minutes and honeydew. Note that production times are an approximation based on the bee's base production speed and the product's rarity. They do not reflect actual production time. 

You've heard of a drunk beekeeper saying he has perfected a method of creating proven frames using Honeydew and a little magic. It might be worth your time to try experimenting yourself.

betterquesting.name: Dripping Combs
betterquesting.desc:
Your noble bees produce some dripping combs.
A good source for honey, and if have a magical mind, honeydew for proven frames.

betterquesting.name: Breed some majestic bees
betterquesting.desc:
Cross breeding noble and cultivated bees can result in majestic bees.

Majestic bees have a very important attribute - high fertility. They will leave 4 drones when they die. This means lots of genetic material for the next generation to work with.

Majestic bees produce dripping combs every 1.5 minutes. Note that production times are an approximation based on the bee's base production speed and the product's rarity. They do not reflect actual production time.

betterquesting.name: Breed some imperial bees
betterquesting.desc:
Cross breeding noble and majestic bees can result in imperial bees.

These bees produce a Regeneration buff in their active area.  You can probably find a use for this in case of...accidents.

Imperial bees produce dripping combs every 3.8 minutes and royal jelly every 5.1 minutes. Note that production times are an approximation based on the bee's base production speed and the product's rarity. They do not reflect actual production time. 

Royal jelly is needed in making scented paneling for an Alveary - the third tier bee housing.

You can now start working towards the Master Registry in the To Grind, or Not to Grind tab.

betterquesting.name: Royal Jelly
betterquesting.desc: Royal jelly is a honey bee secretion that is used in the nutrition of larvae, as well as adult queens. It is only produced by the imperial bee. It's production can be increased with proven frames or any other kind of frames except for the soul frame. Royal jelly is also useful because it can craft ambrosia, which fills 8 hunger points (4 full food icons) and gives Regeneration I for 40 seconds. Royal jelly is used to craft scented paneling which are required in the creation of alveary blocks.

betterquesting.name: Alvearies
betterquesting.desc:
The alveary is an advanced variant of the apiary. The alveary allows for combs to be produced faster due to its natural speed increase to production (as well as the ability to add up to six frames via the Extra Bees frame housings) and due to its ability to be modified by other blocks. 
It is possible to adjust the internal temperature of the alveary using the alveary heater or alveary fan in order to accommodate bees that require hotter or colder climates.
 It is also possible to use mutators to increase chances of mutation, alveary lighting and alveary rain shield to allow bees without the nocturnal and tolerant flyer traits to work during the night and rain, respectively, and the swarmer to use excess royal jelly to create princesses that last for a limited number of generations.

A submission station is recommended for quests with large amounts of items.

betterquesting.name: Barrel Upgrades
betterquesting.desc:
Are your cobblestone or dirt barrels filled to the brim? 
No problem, upgrade them!

betterquesting.name: Barrel Upgrades Tier 2
betterquesting.desc:
Are your upgraded cobblestone or dirt barrels full again? 
No problem, upgrade them some more!

betterquesting.name: §3§lAlumite
betterquesting.desc: It's upgrade time again. You can make alumite like modpack Moron by mixing obsidian, steel and alumin(i)um in the smeltery, or you can be a GregTech hero and search NEI for an alternate recipe using dusts. Alumite pickaxes are able to mine ardite in the Nether.

betterquesting.name: §3§lReinforced X? Unbreakable
betterquesting.desc:
With your steel tool you are able to mine obsidian. Large obsidian plates give a reinforced modifier which increases the durability of your tool. 
Reinforced level X makes a tool unbreakable.

betterquesting.name: §4§3§lLapis? Lucky!
betterquesting.desc:
Maybe you were lucky and received the luck modifier on your pickaxe. If not, you may still have an unused modifier on your pick so you can add some lapis lazuli. Or you can perhaps add another modifier by adding a diamond and a gold block to your pick and then add some lapis. 

You can put the lapis lazuli in more than one slot in the tool station, use blocks to raise the luck level faster, and even use lapis blocks in the crafting station with your tool for maximum luck gain.

betterquesting.name: §2§lRedstone? Haste!
