betterquesting.desc: Mining and digging can be soooo slow. Get some redstone on your pick, shovel or axe to make it faster. You can use the Crafting Station to upgrade your tool 8 dust at a time. Later when you get a compressor you can use blocks to do 9 per block.

betterquesting.name: §2§3§e§4§3§lExtra Modifier
betterquesting.desc:
If you don't have an extra modifier on your tool you can easily add one.
A gold block and a diamond are all you need.
You can add two more modifiers, but you need to figure out how yourself.

betterquesting.name: §5§lArdite and Cobalt
betterquesting.desc: If you are done with all quests you can look for cobalt and ardite in the Nether. Remember, you need an electric blast furnace to process these materials before you can make tools with them.  But you have heard rumors of a special wood only found in another land, a forest of twilight, that can make tools strong enough to mine them.

betterquesting.name: §3§f§3§lNetherquartz? Sharpness
betterquesting.desc:
Your sword is too dull? Get some nether quartz to sharpen it again.

If you have lots of Certus quartz, 1 piece of Certus is equal to 24 Nether quartz.

betterquesting.name: §3§lSubmission Station
betterquesting.desc:
Although many of the questing tasks can be submitted directly through your inventory (including liquids) sometimes you need a more automated solution. This is where the Object Submission Station (OSS) comes in handy. 
Tasks supporting the OSS can be selected through the built in interface to enable its use. Once setup, liquids and items can be either piped in or dropped into the interface's input slot. It will not void items or liquids if no task is selected or if it has already been completed, however, making it relatively safe from accidental item/fluid deletion. Multiple OSS are also capable of taking on separate sub-tasks under the same quest simultaneously!

betterquesting.name: §5§lLV Advanced Steam Boiler
betterquesting.desc: The LV Gt++ Steam Boiler is the next machine you can build to produce steam more efficiently than with the High Pressure Boiler.

betterquesting.name: §5§lULV Transformer
betterquesting.desc: To get your simple ore washer working you need a ULV Transformer. The Washer can only work with 8 EU. If you put more energy into it you get a big hole in your base.

betterquesting.name: §5§lLossless LV Cables
betterquesting.desc:
How about losless 32 EU LV Cables ? Redstone alloy is a superconductor wire and will transfer your energy without any loss.
Redalloy is a new alloy which requires an EBF. Mix redstone, silicon and coal by hand, or in the mixer for a better result.

betterquesting.name: §9§lKinetic Power
betterquesting.desc:
The Kinetic Generator will transform mechanical energy into electricity. The EU output depends on the KU input. It is most commonly used together with a Kinetic Wind Generator, Kinetic Water Generator or a Kinetic Steam Generator.

When placing a kinetic generator, any time, the "input" side is the side facing you.  So you will place the kinetic generator, then the wind/water/steam gen, and then place a rotor inside. Power can be drawn from any side of the kinetic generator, up to the rated amount per side. 

NOTE: It now requires an Avaritia Dire Crafting Table and Titanium. Follow the quests in Space Race and get to the moon. Use NEI to find the recipe since Better Questing cannot show it.

WARNING: Breaking a kinetic generator improperly will not return the generator.  Use a GT wrench, and right-CLICK it.  It should drop immediately.  Try again if it just changed directions.

betterquesting.name: §9§lKinetic Wind Power
betterquesting.desc:
The Kinetic Wind Generator generates energy from wind power which varies randomly, although certain factors can change this. 
Unlike the Windmill, the Kinetic Wind Generator will require maintenance in the form of the Rotors. These are needed to run the Kinetic Wind Generator.
Once a Rotor is placed inside the GUI, the block is given sufficient space, and the current wind level is adequate for the current rotor, the Kinetic Wind Generator will begin to generate Kinetic Energy. 
This can be converted into EU by using a Kinetic Generator attached to the correct face (the black circle).
About Wind
First off, the wind strength of a particular area is affected by 3 factors: Height, Weather, and Chance. The higher up in the world you are, the higher the wind level. Below y64, there is never enough wind to be used, and KWG's will not function at all. Weather will also give boosts; Rainy weather will give a 20% boost to normal wind levels, and stormy weather will give a 50% boost. The final factor of chance makes the wind strength vary randomly, however there is a limited range of variation.
The easiest way to check the current wind level in an area is by using a Windmeter.
Wind is strongest at around Y160, towards the build limit of Y255 there is very little wind, hence no point attempting to run Windmills that high.
While inconvenient, the Wind Generator can run anywhere.

You will need to use NEI to see the recipe, since it use the Dire Crafting table. Make sure to put the items in the right place, or you will get a Water Generator instead.

betterquesting.name: §9§lKinetic Water Power
betterquesting.desc:
The Kinetic Water Generator allows Kinetic Units to be produced via the movement of water in river and ocean biomes. As with the Kinetic Wind Generator, it requires either Gearbox Rotor. Search NEI for appropriate options.

If the Kinetic Water Generator's Rotor isn't entirely submerged in water, it will alert you there is "no room for the rotor". If the Kinetic Water Generator isn't placed in a river, ocean or deep ocean biome, it will alert you it "must be placed in a river or ocean biome". Check the Game Mechanics spreadsheet on Discord for a list of biomes and their tags.

While inconvenient, the Water Generator runs more consistently.

You will need to use NEI to see the recipe, since it use the Dire Crafting table. Make sure to put the items in the right place, or you will get a Wind Generator instead.

§4You can use Witchery to convert biomes.

betterquesting.name: §c§9§lRotor
betterquesting.desc: The Kinetic Wind and Water Generators need Gearbox Rotors to function.  They can be added and removed with standard automation. Higher tier rotors will last longer.

betterquesting.name: §9§lWind Meter
betterquesting.desc: The Windmeter measures wind strength. It show's you on which height you can place your Wind Generator.

betterquesting.name: §9§lHV Battery Buffers
betterquesting.desc:
HV machines need battery buffers too. They come in different sizes like 1x, 4x, 9x and 16x.
Build a 1x and a 4x buffer for HV.  

You can use the 1x with a transformer and run MV machines for a decent time.  Or transform it twice  to LV and run a bunch of LV machines for a long time. Useful when you want scanner near your bees or trees. Remember to cover them up or else rain will make you very unhappy.

betterquesting.name: §9§lHV Batteries
betterquesting.desc: Better machines need some better batteries. Let's make some HV battery hulls for new batteries. Now it's up to you to make lithium, cadmium, sodium or acid batteries with these hulls.

betterquesting.name: §9§lHV Lithium Battery
betterquesting.desc: Better machines need some better batteries. Lithium is the best material to use when making batteries. Make sure to use the Assembler recipe with Polyethylene to save on resources.

betterquesting.name: §9§lHV EV Tranformer
betterquesting.desc:
Gregtech cables will not connect to IC2 machines so you need transformers to convert the energy. The best way is building two transformers and a battery buffer to store the generated energy in batteries or energy cells. The longer the cable the more energy will be lost at low tiers. So use high tier voltages when transporting energy over long distances.

Be careful; IC2 machines do not care about rain but your GT machines will explode violently if exposed to water.

It is also important to transfer the power up, not down, to avoid explosions if the rotor generates more than 120 EU/t. It is not recommenend to use better rotors than the iron ones on HV tier.

betterquesting.name: §2§lGT 6 styled Pipes
betterquesting.desc:
Maybe you are wondering why the new pipes don't auto-connect anymore? This was changed to make the pipe smarter. You can now use a wrench to connect only the pipes you want. You don't need a plate or a foil to prevent pipes from connecting anymore.

You'll still want to cover hot pipes to prevent getting hurt!

Shift clicking on the end of a pipe will disable the fluid input on that side. This is super handy, for example, to prevent coal boilers from feeding back steam into water pipes. 

Also, pipes now come with a shutter built in for free to reduce sloshing. Shift-rightclick with a wrench on the side you want prevent input.

Large or Huge fluid pipes can be a "poor man's" storage tank, holding large amounts on their own.

For machine outputs, including the boilers, and water siding tanks you will not need pumps. Other tanks will need pumps or Tinker's Construct faucets to move fluids.

§4Hint: If you click one pipe onto the other they will auto-connect.

betterquesting.name: §3§2§4§3§lGT 6 styled Wires and Cables
betterquesting.desc:
Maybe you are wondering why the new wires and cables don't auto-connect anymore? This was changed to make the wires and cables smarter. You have to use a wirecutter or soldering iron to connect the wires and cables on the side you want. No more burnt cables or wrongly connected wires and cables from now on. You can shift-rightclick to attach a cable on the side of a machine you cannot see, like attaching a cable to the bottom while looking at the front.

Hint: If you click one wire or cable on the other it will auto-connect. Cables and pipes can be painted to make sure you do not cross your MV line with your EV line, or dump hot lava into your plastic water pipes. No boom today.

Ha ha just kidding there is always a boom today!

betterquesting.name: §6§lMV Machine hull
betterquesting.desc: The next tier of machine hull needs aluminium - a lot of aluminium. Keep your EBF running and make some aluminium.

betterquesting.name: §5§lA new alloy - Magnalium
betterquesting.desc:
You wonder why you need magnalium now? It's not for GT machines right now but for a material update for your crossbow.
It's a very good material in LV Tier. Go to the Twilight Forest and find an Olivine/Glauconite vein located at Y 10-40 or in the Overworld a Glauconite Soapstone mix located at Y 20-50 and a Granitic Mineral Vein in the Overworld Located at Y 50-60 (The Gypsum vein you will need for the Bricked Blast Furnace).
With your Ore Washer you can get Magnesium and Aluminium out of the Ores (Magnesite for Magnesium (marbel can be used too)and Fullers Earth for Aluminium) and mix it in the Alloy smelter to Magnalium.
Magnesite gives 10 tiny piles of Magnesium each dust but fullers earth gives only a tiny pile of Aluminium.

betterquesting.name: §5§lMagnalium Crossbow
betterquesting.desc: Now its time to craft your Crossbow Limb and the Crossbow Body to upgrade your old Wooden Crossbow.

betterquesting.name: §3§lWooden Crosbow
betterquesting.desc:
Now you are able to make a better long range weapon - a crossbow. Use wood for the the crossbow limb and the body and use obsidian (Reinforced III) for the tough binding. Normal strings for the bowstrings would be enough for now.

Assemble the bow yourself on your tool forge.

§4For upgrades:
§5§4§3Redstone - Speed on the draw
Lapis - Fortune on kills
Moss - Self-repair (this is not visible in NEI until you unlock it in the GTNH Thaumcraft tab)

betterquesting.name: §5§lFiery Bowstring
betterquesting.desc: Why not upgrade your bowstring too? You got some from the last quest, but will need to find some more in the Nether by killing spiders. Craft some fiery bowstring with it.

betterquesting.name: §5§lArdite Crossbow Body
betterquesting.desc:
To make your crossbow even better craft an ardite crossbow body. You received a few ardite ingots as reward before but will need to find ore in the Nether and process it in an Electric Blast Furnace.
With redstone you can make your bow faster. This requires a free modifier slot on your crossbow.
Don't bother putting Nether Quartz on the crossbow, it only improves damage from whacking mobs over the head with it.  Put the Nether Quartz on your bolts instead.

betterquesting.name: §5§lMagnalium Crossbow Bolts
betterquesting.desc:
Magnalium bolts are much better than your old wooden bolts.
You can use nether quartz on the bolts to make them even better. 
This requires a free modifier slot.
NOTE: Unlike other tinker tools and weapons, bolts cannot be upgraded.  You will need to make a fresh one. Experiment with NEI to find other good bolt materials. 

§4To make it, you must use a Fluid Solidifer instead of the Tinker's casting table.

betterquesting.name: §5§lBasic Fluid Solidifier
betterquesting.desc: To get your molten fluids back to a solid state you need a fluid solidifier. This is handy for processing molten rubber directly from the chemical reactor. It is used for crossbow bolts as well.

betterquesting.name: §3§lWooden Bolts
betterquesting.desc:
Your crossbow need some ammo to shoot with. Let's craft some wooden bolts. For now, you can put either iron, alumite, or steel on the tip of your bolts using the Smeltery.  For higher tier bolts and tips you will need to pump metals into a Fluid Solidifier with the correct tool rod inserted.

§4For upgrades
§3Nether or Certus Quartz - More damage
Moss - Self-Repair (unlock in GTNH Thaumcraft tab)

betterquesting.name: §3§lRubber Soft Mallet
betterquesting.desc: Your wooden soft mallet breaks after a few uses. Now you can make a rubber mallet which is much more durable.

betterquesting.name: Iron Wood
betterquesting.desc:
Ironwood is much harder and durable than rubber. Ideal for a soft mallet. Collect some liveroot, macerate it and mix the powder with iron and gold to create a new magical material.

You can make some unique armor with this material.

betterquesting.name: Steeleaf
betterquesting.desc:
If you locate a labyrinth you may find steeleaf in chests inside if you are lucky.
This is the best material for a soft mallet, however a unique armor out of steeleaf would be an even better use for this material.

betterquesting.name: §5§lEmpty Cells
betterquesting.desc: With your plate bender you are able to make empty cells. The circuit needs to be configured to 12 otherwise you will make foil. Once you have an LV Extruder, you can make cells directly from ingots.

betterquesting.name: Redalloy Cable
betterquesting.desc: Want some redalloy cable? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Tin Cable
betterquesting.desc: Want some tin cable? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Copper Wire
betterquesting.desc: Want some copper wires? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: §9§lUniversal Macerator
betterquesting.desc:
One of the important machines in HV is the Universal Macerator. It has an additional output slot to get more materials when macerating ores.

§4This is a key source of extra Gallium.

betterquesting.name: Rubber Ingots
betterquesting.desc: Want some rubber ingots? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: §5§lQuartz and Quartzite Veins
betterquesting.desc: The Nether is full of different kinds of quartz. Go and find a quartzite and certus quartz vein. They are located between Y levels 80-120.

betterquesting.name: §4§5§lLithium
betterquesting.desc: Lithium can be washed out of Lepidolite Ore or centrifuged out of Spodumene Ore. At MV you can electrolyze clay dust for it. Look for canyons to find hardened clay and macerate it for dust.

betterquesting.name: §4§5§lSodium
betterquesting.desc: Sodium can be washed out of Glauconite Ore and Sand. It can also be electrolyzed out of salt.

betterquesting.name: Bath Salt
betterquesting.desc: Oh you feel so dirty. Go and take a bath.

betterquesting.name: Bath Soap
betterquesting.desc: Oh you feel so dirty. Get the soap and take a long hot bath to get rid of some of that nasty Warp.

betterquesting.name: Damascus Steel Ingots
betterquesting.desc: Damascus Steel is very durable and useful for GT tools. Buy some.

betterquesting.name: §5§lCheaper Annealed Production
betterquesting.desc: It' s even faster and cheaper to make annealed copper in the arc furnace than in the electric blast furnace. Annealed copper is a very good material for cables in MV. It only loses 1 EU per block.

betterquesting.name: Wrought Iron Ingots
betterquesting.desc: Whant some wrought iron ingots?  Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Steel Ingots
betterquesting.desc: Want some steel ingots?  Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Aluminium Ingots
betterquesting.desc: Want some aluminium ingots? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Stainless Steel Ingots
betterquesting.desc: Want some stainless steel ingots? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Thaumium cooking
betterquesting.desc: Now it is time to cook your first thaumium ingots. After researching it you need iron ingots and praecantatio aspect to make it.

betterquesting.name: Food 2.0
betterquesting.desc:
Forget everything you know about food and values. With your new canning machine you are able to fill tin cans with very nourishing food. This food can be consumed in milliseconds and makes you full and happy. And you can eat as much as you want without getting tired of the food.
Eating before you are starving restores saturation and conserves cans.

betterquesting.name: §6§lEBF Infos
betterquesting.desc:
You can use a scanner to manually check how your EBF works, or you can make an information panel from nuclear control and always see the status. Make a GT sensor kit and use it on the EBF controller. Place the the sensor card in your info panel. Enable it with a redstone signal.

The GregTech sensor card can monitor Gregtech machines like the EBF, Turbines, and Pyrolyse ovens. This is handy for keeping an eye on maintenance issues for multiblocks.

If you want to put the panels far from the machines they are monitoring, you will need range upgrades.

betterquesting.name: §6§lPassive Chunkloading
betterquesting.desc:
Using the MV bender you can finally press dense plates. Let's craft some passive chunkloaders.
3x3 chunks are loaded. You need coins or ender pearls to power the chunkloader. 
Ender pearls power personal anchors for 4 hours per pearl, and 1 hour in passive anchors . Personal anchors can also be powered  with ender fragments for 1h.  

§4Personal anchors are loaded  once the owner visits, and stays loaded while the player is logged in. 
Passive anchors are loaded once the owner visits, and stays loaded until the server resets.

betterquesting.name: Minecart with Tank, Workbench or Furnace
betterquesting.desc: You want to transport oil or other fluids, have a portable crafting table or a portable chest? Then you need to craft some minecarts with tanks, chests or crafting tables.

betterquesting.name: Fluid loader and unloder
betterquesting.desc: If you plan to automate the oil transport from your oil field far away, you need a fluid loader and unloader. A locking track will stop the train as long as oil is loaded or unloaded.

betterquesting.name: Locomotive 0.1 Alpha
betterquesting.desc: The furnace cart is a cheaper locomotive. Click with coal or charcoal on the cart and and it will start moving.

betterquesting.name: Steam Locomotive
betterquesting.desc: The steam locomotive is much better than the furnace cart. You can control the speed and the direction the locomotive will move. You need to put water and coal inside to make steam to power the locomotive.

betterquesting.name: Electric Locomotive
betterquesting.desc: Electric Locomotives are much better than steam ones. You need electric rail for it.

betterquesting.name: Boost your speed
betterquesting.desc: If you decide to not use a locomotive and drive with one or two carts only, you can use some booster tracks. Activate them with a lever or a redstone torch.

betterquesting.name: The transcontinental railroad - high speed
betterquesting.desc: Did you ever dream of driving in a railcart at high speeds? Well your dreams can come true with the high speed tracks. Be careful though; you need to lower the speed when your rails change direction or when the track ends.

betterquesting.name: The transcontinental railroad - blast proof
betterquesting.desc:
Railroads in the nether are dangerous. The reinforced tracks are blast proof. Hope you are blast proof too. 
You can move 25% faster than with normal tracks.

Nei not shows the right recipe on the first page. Switch a bit through the recipes to find the right one.

betterquesting.name: The transcontinental railroad electrical
betterquesting.desc:
Electrical tracks are used together with your electrical locomotive. You need to power the rails with energy.

Nei not shows the right recipe on the first page. Switch a bit through the recipes to find the right one.

betterquesting.name: Electric feeder Unit
betterquesting.desc: To get your tracks electrified you need an electric feeding unit, shunting wires and some support frames. You can use an MFE or a transformer to get GT energy into the feeder unit.

betterquesting.name: Magic "Staffter"
betterquesting.desc: It is also possible to create a bizarre hybrid of staff and scepter (sometimes called a "staffter"), by using a staff core instead of a wand core in the scepter recipe. The resulting device can neither hold a focus nor be placed in a crafting table, but it can still be used to activate constructs, or as a "vis battery" for Repair-enchanted equipment or Runic shielding.

betterquesting.name: Aluminum berries
betterquesting.desc: And a few aluminum berries for cash.

betterquesting.name: Gold berries
betterquesting.desc: And a few gold berries for cash.

betterquesting.name: Iron berries
betterquesting.desc: And a few iron berries for cash.

betterquesting.name: Copper berries
betterquesting.desc: And a few copper berries for cash.

betterquesting.name: Tin berries
betterquesting.desc: And a few tin berries for cash.

betterquesting.name: §d§lFusion reactor MK2 - bigger, better, fusor
betterquesting.desc: Now that you have some europium, put it to use by making an mk2 reactor. This one will require the same block placement, but replacing LuV casings with fusion machine casings, superconducting coil blocks with fusion coil blocks, and using ZPM tier hatches. This reactor can handle recipes up to 320M eu startup. In addition, if you perform an mk1 recipe on an mk2, you will overclock it. Fusion overclocking is different than normal gt. It will take 2x the power, but the recipe will go 2x faster.

betterquesting.name: §d§lUpgrading the reactor
betterquesting.desc: A mark 2 is nice, but why not make a mark 3? It will double the power needed per recipe, while cutting the processing time in half. This time you will need UV or above hatches, as well as Fusion machine casings MK2. This reactor is capable of doing all fusion recipes. Each energy hatch is capable of providng up to 8192eu/t, per energy hatch, for the recipe. The reactor can take as little as 8192eu/t to run. The UV hatch can accept up to 2 amps of 524288eu/t before it explodes, as usual.

betterquesting.name: §d§lMaking americium
betterquesting.desc: Before you can upgrade your reactor, you will need to get some americium. The recipe will look pretty expensive, but once you made the next tier of reactor, you will unlock a simplier and cheaper one. You will need at least 128 plates for the reactor casings, 9 to scan for the recipe, and 4 to build one.

betterquesting.name: §d§lMaking power with your plasma
betterquesting.desc: Now that you have a reactor, it's time to utilize it. The simplest plasma you can make for power is Helium plasma. It's renewable from water, but also provides a lot of power. However, you will need a way to convert the plasma into EU. To do this you will need a large plasma turbine. This will also need a dynamo hatch that can handle the power you're outputting. For Helium plasma, you will want a UV or above hatch.

betterquesting.name: §d§lTurbine Time
betterquesting.desc: Your fancy new Large Plasma Turbine will need a rotor to go inside of it. You can make it out of any gt material, but the best are trinium, awakened draconium and neutronium. Trinium will give you the most eu/t out of a single multiblock, with the best efficiency. Neutronium will give you the longest lasting turbine rotors with a lower efficiency, and less power per reactor. Awakened draconium will give you a balance between the two. You can make turbines in 4 different sizes. The larger the turbine the more eu/t it will produce. However, the largest turbine isn't also the most efficient. When using turbines be careful of flow rates. To find the optimal flow rate, you divide the optimal energy flow rate listen on the turbine, by the energy value for the plasma. Make sure to use a fluid regulator set to this flow rate.

betterquesting.name: §e§d§n§o§r§l§d§lTime for another reactor
betterquesting.desc: While one reactor is nice and all, why not make another? This time you can use the MK3 americium recipe to make it easier.

betterquesting.name: §d§m§l§r§d§lMaking more americium
betterquesting.desc: Costing just 1 ingot of Plutonium, and 2 buckets of hydrogen, this recipe is much easier and faster than the MK2 version. By making americium plasma, then putting it through a turbine, you will get americium in the liquid state. Again you will need at least 132 plates for the controller, and the fusion machine casings.

betterquesting.name: §1§lCrafting time
betterquesting.desc: It's time to get yourself a 3x3 crafting area. Grab some flint and some wood, and build one!

betterquesting.name: §3§lHoppers
betterquesting.desc:
Hoppers come in handy when you want to automate your machines. 
You can input items via hoppers directly into GT pipes and you don't have to use a conveyor belt. 
However, the input rate is much slower, and the hopper must be beneath its source inventory.

betterquesting.name: Light Fuel
betterquesting.desc: Want some light fuel? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Heavy Fuel
betterquesting.desc: Want some heavy fuel? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Cart modules: Power Solar
betterquesting.desc: Your cart needs power, obviously. A cart can be powered via coal, solar or lava. If you are able to make solar panels you can power your cart with the sun.

betterquesting.name: Cart modules: Digging
betterquesting.desc: Want to automate digging for ores ? A drill head made out of iron is the cheapest alternative.

betterquesting.name: Cart modules: Thermal Engine
betterquesting.desc: Your cart needs power, obviously. A cart can be powered via coal, solar or lava. Why not power your cart with lava?

betterquesting.name: Cart modules: More Storage
betterquesting.desc: After you craft side chests you can add more different chests to the cart. Some sides are reserved for tools so no chest can be placed there.

betterquesting.name: §d§lStarting Fusion
betterquesting.desc: Now that your power needs are increasing, you need a way to keep up with demand. To generate over 1A ZPM with a single machine you have two options: solars, and fusion. While solars are simpler to set up, solars cap out at 524288eu/t. Fusion can reach levels close to eight times that with the right setup. For your first reactor, you will need a controller, 2-16 fluid input hatches, 1-16 fluid output hatches, and 16 energy hatches. All hatches have to be LuV tier or better. Each hatch provides 2048eu/t for the recipe, and has a storage capacity of 160M eu. This means you can do any fusion recipe that takes less than 32768eu/t or less, and has a startup of 160M eu or less. Using more fluid hatches means you need less fusion casings. While this doesn't matter as much for the mk1 reactor, this principle helps tremendously with the high reactor tiers.

betterquesting.name: §d§lGetting europium
betterquesting.desc: To make an mk2 reactor, you will need europium. Once you make a t6 rocket you will be able to find this as an ore. Until then you need to produce it in the reactor.

betterquesting.name: Clockwork Engine
betterquesting.desc: Producing RF Power by hand is a good idea for making one or two recipes in the Forestry machines. The turrets can be charged with it too.

betterquesting.name: Bio Gas Engine
betterquesting.desc:
Producing RF Power with Lava is possible with the Biogas engine. You need Water, Seedoil, Milk, Sap Cresote or FR Biomass in the other slot. The engine outputs 50RF/t depends on the fluid you put in.

Fuel /Lava /  Usage Energy Ticks
Water Constant 10 RF/t 1000
Fruit Juice Startup/Restart Only 10 RF/t 2500
Liquid Honey Startup/Restart Only 20 RF/t 2500
Milk Constant 10 RF/t 10000
Seed Oil Startup/Restart Only 30 RF/t 2500
Biomass Startup/Restart Only 50 RF/t 2500

betterquesting.name: Peat fired Engine
betterquesting.desc:
Peat fired engines use Peat or Bituminous Peat to run. Peat burns for 5000 ticks and produces 10 RF every tick, 1 peat makes 0.66 Ash, so you get 2 Ash for burning 3 peat.
Bituminous Peat burns for 6000 ticks and produces 20 RF/tick.

Peat Farms can be setup by using a managed farm with tin electron tubes. It is possible with a manual farm too.

betterquesting.name: Copper, Tin, Bronze Tubes
betterquesting.desc:
Electron tubes are used to set farms to a special kind of crop and can be used in engines, alvearies and some crafting recipes.

Use a soldering iron to attach an electron tube to a circuit board.

betterquesting.name: Iron, Gold, Diamantine Tubes
betterquesting.desc:
Electron tubes are used to set farms to a special kind of crop and can be used in engines, alvearies and some crafting recipes.

Use a soldering iron to attach an electron tube to a circuit board.

betterquesting.name: Rubberised, Obsidian, Lapis Tubes
betterquesting.desc:
Electron tubes are used to set farms to a special kind of crop and can be used in engines, alvearies and some crafting recipes.

Use a soldering iron to attach an electron tube to a circuit board.

betterquesting.name: Blaze, Endereyes, Emerald Tubes
betterquesting.desc:
Electron tubes are used to set farms to a special kind of crop and can be used in engines, alvearies and some crafting recipes.

Use a soldering iron to attach an electron tube to a circuit board.

betterquesting.name: §9§lAdvanced Circuit Assembler
betterquesting.desc: More advanced circuits require an MV circuit assembling machine. Let's make one.

betterquesting.name: §9§lAdvanced Circuit Assembler II
betterquesting.desc: With your workstation circuits you can craft an HV circuit assembler. This is need for higher tier circuits.

betterquesting.name: §b§a§lEV Circuits Assembler
betterquesting.desc: An EV circuit assembler requires IV Circuits to craft. With this assembler you can make a lot more high tier circuits.

betterquesting.name: Epoxid
betterquesting.desc: Epoxid is needed for your advanced Circuits boards. You need Sodium Hydroxide, Epichlorohydrin and Bispenol A to make it.

betterquesting.name: §9§lIV Circuit Mainframe
betterquesting.desc:
Mainframes are the first IV Circuits you can make in HV. Used for EV and IV machines and components.

In addition, you will need 16 Capacitors, SMD or non-SMD.

Once you get a reliable polyethylene setup, it will save a lot of resources to use SMD components.

betterquesting.name: §6§lGlycerol
betterquesting.desc: Glycerol becomes important in creating epoxid in the next tiers. It is important for TNT production too. It is left over when producing bio diesel.

betterquesting.name: §6§lHCL
betterquesting.desc: HCl becomes important for your epoxid production in HV/EV tier.

betterquesting.name: §a§lEpichlorohydrin
betterquesting.desc: Epichlorohydrin is another product needed in your epoxid production. By now you should be experienced enough to figure out which path is best for your setup using NEI.

betterquesting.name: §a§lPhenol
betterquesting.desc: The easiest way is to get phenol out of heavy fuel. There are other ways, like getting it out of wood tar from a pyrolyse oven, isopropylbenzene and oxygen, or chlorobenzene and water.

betterquesting.name: §a§lBisphenol A
betterquesting.desc: To get Bisphenol A you need to combine Phenol, Acetone and HCl in a chemical reactor.

betterquesting.name: §9§lYou gonna hate this 1-4 in HV
betterquesting.desc: Pumps, pistons, conveyor Belts and robot arms are the most needed machine parts in HV. Go and craft one of each.

betterquesting.name: §9§lYou gonna hate this 5 and 6 in HV
betterquesting.desc: Some machines need emitters and sensors, like the analyzer or the circuit assembler.

betterquesting.name: §9§lEnder Eyes
betterquesting.desc: Ender eyes are available at HV in the chemical reactor. Combine some ender pearls with blaze powder.

betterquesting.name: §a§lEmpty Expoxid Board
betterquesting.desc: Epoxid circuit boards require epoxid plate, gold foil and sulfuric acid to make an empty board. By adding electrum foil and Iron(III) Chloride or Sodium Persulfate you can craft an epoxid or advanced circuit board.

betterquesting.name: §9§lMicroprocessor LV
betterquesting.desc: The Microprocessor is the most highest tier way to craft an LV circuit, but you get 2 per recipe. It requires plastic board, a cleanroom, a cpu and a few smd components.

betterquesting.name: §9§lCutting Machine HV
betterquesting.desc: Nor, nand and other high tier chips require an HV cutting machine. This machine is also needed for cutting glowstone doped wafers.

betterquesting.name: §a§9§lGlowstone Doped Monocrystalline Silicon
betterquesting.desc:
To make more advanced wafers, you need to make glowstone dopped monocrystalline silicon first. The process takes 600 seconds and requires silicon dust and glowstone dust in the electric blast furnace. You can make 32 wafers out of every boule.

Unfortunately, these boules seem to require higher heat than cupronickel coils can produce.  You'll need to go to Multiblock Goals and get a cleanroom, vacuum freezer, and kanthal coils in order to make them.

betterquesting.name: §9§lGlowstone Doped Wafer
betterquesting.desc:
To create some glowstone doped silicon wafers, place the monocrystalline glowstone doped silicon boule in a cutting machine. An HV version of the cutting machine is needed for future wafers and chips.

You will need to cut these wafers in a cleanroom.

betterquesting.name: §9§lNor and Nand chips
betterquesting.desc:
The data stick requires nand chips. Nor chips are needed for more advanced circuits. You can get these by cutting nand and nor wafers.
A cleanroom is required.

betterquesting.name: Data Sticks
betterquesting.desc: Data sticks are very important for seismic prospecting and for the assembly line in the LuV age. Go and craft a few data sticks.

betterquesting.name: §a§lRadon
betterquesting.desc:
Radon is used for quantum eyes, quantum stars and emitters and sensors in the EV machines. Try to find a Pitchblende vein first and/or recycle your plutonium and uranium from your reactor.

§4This Vein can be found on Mars and Phobos.

betterquesting.name: §b§a§lEV Chemical reactor
betterquesting.desc: An EV chemical reactor is required to get some indium or make your radon production much faster. If you already made a large chemical reactor use that instead.

betterquesting.name: §a§lPitchblende
betterquesting.desc: In order to try running your nuclear reactor you need some uranium or plutonium fuel. Go and find a pitchblende vein on Mars at Y 30-60.

betterquesting.name: §a§lScheelite, Tungstate
betterquesting.desc: Tungstensteel is the material you need but first go find some scheelite and tungstate mix on Mars. Look at Y 20-60.

betterquesting.name: §a§f§a§lYou gonna hate this 1-4 in EV
betterquesting.desc: Pumps, pistons, conveyor belts and robot arms are the most needed machine parts in EV. Go and craft one of each.

betterquesting.name: §a§lYou gonna hate this 5 and 6 in EV
betterquesting.desc: Some machines need emitters and sensors, like the analyzer or the circuit assembler.

betterquesting.name: §a§lQuantum Eye
betterquesting.desc: Quantum eyes are required in EV emitters and sensors. Just infuse your ender eye with radon to get one.

betterquesting.name: §a§lNano Processor
betterquesting.desc:
There are three variants of advanced circuits. The advanced electronic circuit, the processor assembly and the nanoprocessor. The Nanoprocessor needs an EV circuit assembling machine to be made. Use your epoxid boards for it.
A cleanroom is required.

betterquesting.name: §a§lNano CPU Wafer and Chip
betterquesting.desc:
The Nano CPU Wafer is made out of a CPU Wafer with carbon fiber and molten glowstone in an EV chemical reactor. Cut it for nano CPU chips.
A cleanroom is needed.

betterquesting.name: §a§lNano Processor Array
betterquesting.desc:
The nano processor array is an EV circuit. 
A cleanroom is needed.

betterquesting.name: §a§lElite Nano Computer
betterquesting.desc:
The elite nano computer is an IV circuit.
A cleanroom is needed.

betterquesting.name: §a§lHV Chemical Bath
betterquesting.desc: An HV chemical bath or better is needed for the quantum eye.

betterquesting.name: 16k Component
betterquesting.desc: Second largest storage component, used to make 16k ME storage cell, or can be upgraded to make 64k ME storage component. Can be recovered from a crafted 16k ME storage cell by fully emptying the storage cell, and shift clicking it in your hand.

betterquesting.name: 16k Crafting Storage
betterquesting.desc: Component of the crafting CPU which provides 16,384 bytes of storage for crafting.

betterquesting.name: 64k Item Storage Cell
betterquesting.desc: Highest tier storage cell, which can contain 65,536 bytes of storage. 65,536 bytes of storage can hold 8,128 stacks of a single item, or 4,160 stacks, while holding 63 different items. The 64k storage cell uses 512 bytes of data to store a single type. When placed inside a drive or chest will consume 2.0 ae/t. Must be in an ME drive or ME chest to be usable. You can remove the 64k ME storage component by fully emptying the storage cell, and sneak clicking it in your hand.

betterquesting.name: 64k Component
betterquesting.desc: Largest storage component, used to make 64k ME storage cell. Can be recovered from a crafted 64k ME storage cell by fully emptying the storage cell, and shift clicking it in your hand.

betterquesting.name: 64k Crafting Storage
betterquesting.desc: Component of the crafting CPU which provides 65,536 bytes of storage for crafting.

betterquesting.name: Wireless Booster
betterquesting.desc: The wireless booster is used to increase the range of the ME wireless access point.

betterquesting.name: Filling Tanks
betterquesting.desc: Export bus for fluids only.

betterquesting.name: Crafting Monitor
betterquesting.desc: Component of the crafting CPU which displays the top level job and its current progress so you can monitor at a glance how your crafting jobs are progressing.

betterquesting.name: §a§lNano Processor Mainframe
betterquesting.desc:
The nano processor mainframe is the cheapest LuV Circuit.
A cleanroom is required.

betterquesting.name: §a§lBattery Buffer x9
betterquesting.desc: EV battery buffer for up to nine batteries.

betterquesting.name: §a§lBlue Steel
betterquesting.desc: Your sunnarium batteries are made out of blue steel: a mixture of steel, black steel, brass and rose gold.

betterquesting.name: §a§lEV Sunnarium Battery
betterquesting.desc: Your first EV sunnarium battery used in EV tier. You make it with the sunnarium you generated before.

betterquesting.name: §a§lEV GT++ Batteries
betterquesting.desc: A cheaper variant is the GT++ EV battery.

betterquesting.name: §5§lLow Voltage Transformer
betterquesting.desc: It's possible to run MV machines while still in LV age. Build a transformer and use 4 power sources 32 eu/t to power one 128 eu/t machine. You can change the mode of a transformer with a soft mallet. If the transformer is wired and loaded then DO NOT change the mode otherwise there probably will be a big explosion. Be careful when switching directions - better to break and replace than rotate with the wrench and blow up a line of machines.

betterquesting.name: §6§lMedium Voltage Transformer
betterquesting.desc: It's possible to run HV machines while still in MV age. Build a transformer and use 4 power sources 128 eu/t to power one 512 eu/t machine. You can change the mode of a transformer with a soft mallet. If the transformer is wired and loaded then DO NOT change the mode otherwise there probably will be a big explosion.

betterquesting.name: §6§lLV High-Amp Transformer
betterquesting.desc:
If you need a transformer with more than 4 amperes you need a high amp transformer. You can input four 128 eu/t power sources and output 16 ampere at 32 eu/t.
Modes can be changed with a soft mallet.

betterquesting.name: §6§lLow Voltage Power Transformer
betterquesting.desc: If you need even more amps then craft a power tranformer with a max LV output of 64 amps. You can input sixteen 128 eu/t power sources and output 64 amps at 32 eu/t. Modes can be changed with a soft mallet.

betterquesting.name: Time for a Spade
betterquesting.desc:
Having a Weeding Trowel, Hoe and Shovel in your Inventory is painful when dealing with crops. Get the Spade - it combines these items, is unbreakable, and increases the chance of getting seeds from plants.

Be careful! Right-clicking on a plant pulls it for seeds.  Make sure to switch to Sense or your open hand to harvest.

betterquesting.name: §9§lExtruder HV
betterquesting.desc: The HV Extruder is needed to extrude tough metals like Tungstensteel and HSS.

betterquesting.name: Wheaty juice
betterquesting.desc: The first step to brew beer or other alcoholic fluids is wheaty juice.

betterquesting.name: §5§lBrewing, the Industrial Way
betterquesting.desc: If you want brews or alcohol, I recommend you to build one of these. You might have noticed that you cannot build a brewing stand without Thaumcraft. But fear not, you can still find them in chests. Better get searching...

betterquesting.name: §5§lFerment your brew!
betterquesting.desc: What's better than lame brews? Alcoholic brews! Get one of these to make beer, rum or even vodka.

betterquesting.name: Fake Jagermeister
betterquesting.desc: Jagermeister is a common drink in Germany, why don't you grab a bottle? This one seems to be a cheap fake tho...

betterquesting.name: Korn and Doppelkorn
betterquesting.desc: Korn is german for wheat. That's why this special alcoholic brew is named like this. Doppelkorn means double-wheat.

betterquesting.name: Sugarcanes
betterquesting.desc: Sugarcanes are a source of sugar, and therefore alcohol. If you want some rum or sugar, you'll need these.

betterquesting.name: Vodka
betterquesting.desc: Vodka is Russian for "small Water". It is a rather high proof alcoholic fluid.

betterquesting.name: §6§lFirestone Ore/Dust
betterquesting.desc:
Firestone ore is handy for some base building machines. Unforunately, it's in the nether...at the bottom of the lava ocean! Here are some tips for finding it

Firestone can be mined with the GT miners, if you place it within range.
Firestone only spawns in deep lava, at least 6 deep. It will only replace netherrack, so a fjord filled with soulsand won't have any. Can you think of ways to check the lava depth, and what's down there?
Normally you can't see through lava, but if you enable nightvision on the nanosuit, you can see a short distance at the bottom. But how to prevent getting burned?
Alternatively, if you keep your head at just the correct height above the lava and at the correct angle, you'll be able to see underneath it - surely there must be a hovering jetpack?
Firestone ore and products will cause random fires to start nearby, so get it into a backpack quickly!

betterquesting.name: The industrial way
betterquesting.desc: Making rum can be automated, but you need to follow this industrial way for it.

betterquesting.name: Rum
betterquesting.desc: Rum. Yummy!

betterquesting.name: The gathering: Sugar
betterquesting.desc: Stockpiling sugar might be a good idea if you have a sweet tooth. Or not?

betterquesting.name: Honey for sugar.
betterquesting.desc: Since honey contains a lot of sugar, it might be a good idea to get some honey.

betterquesting.name: Wasps honey
betterquesting.desc: Giant wasps can be found in the Nether. Quick! Sneak into their hive and steal some honey!

betterquesting.name: §5§lDiamond Spikes
betterquesting.desc:
Diamond Spike damages mobs that touch any side of it other than the bottom. With +7 attack damage, the Spike does as much damage as a Diamond Sword. Mobs will not walk around the block, but will try to walk over it as if it were a regular solid block. Most explosions won't destroy the Spike because it has a very high blast resistance.

These can also be enchanted with all the enchantments a regular diamond sword would receive. This includes Looting and Sharpness, which function exactly as it does on a sword. Interestingly, mobs killed by the Diamond Spike will return experience as if killed by the player.

betterquesting.name: Primal Shrooms
betterquesting.desc:
Primal shrooms allow you to refill wands easier before you can move nodes to your base.
Go and find some in a magical forest biome. Try using a Nature's Compass. Or buy some if no biome is close to your location.
2 pumpkins and 4 entropy slivers are the perfect combo to make these.

betterquesting.name: Vish Shroom
betterquesting.desc: Magic mushrooms whoooo!

betterquesting.name: Hops, the source of beer
betterquesting.desc: If you don't want pure alcohol, but beer, get some hops by crossbreeding IC2 crops.

betterquesting.name: §9§lHV Bender
betterquesting.desc:
An HV Bender is going to be 4x faster than your LV Bender, but it also opens up an important recipe - Tin cans!  

With this bender you can turn Tin Casings into Tin Cans.  Using the Tin Cans with food in a Canner (LV is fine) will make Canned Food. This can stack up to 64, and will fully restore your shanks - no need to rotate food types any more! You will eat as much as you need with one click. One drawback is you will no longer get the Well Fed buff with its slight health regen bonus. Also, these cans don't fit in the lunch bag or lunch box so you don't need those any more.

betterquesting.name: Imma chargin' my...
betterquesting.desc:
Charged certus quartz is one of the basic components for a lot of AE recipes. Just mix some certus quartz and redstone dust to get charged certus quartz dust.
Use the autoclave to make crystals.

betterquesting.name: Keeping your Network Happy
betterquesting.desc: Helps with fluctuating power. Energy cells store up to 200,000 AE. They do not accept power directly but are used to buffer some power in an already existing ME network.

betterquesting.name: Storing your ME data
betterquesting.desc: A block designed to do one thing, store storage cells. This block holds 10 storage cells so you can tightly pack your storage into a very small space. ME drives show their contents and the storage cell status on the front of the drive face. Red - Indicates the storage cell is full. Orange - Indicates the storage cell cannot hold any more types, but it can store more items. Green - Indicates the cell can hold more types, or more items. Black - Indicates there is no channel, or power is offline. It's important to note, that without an ME Network this block does nothing. It's only useful when combined with a way to input, and output items, and requires 2 AE/t power to function, and additional power for each storage cell stored inside it. The ME drive requires a channel to function.

betterquesting.name: Safety first!
betterquesting.desc: This storage cell housing is blast proof and stores only 3 cells.

betterquesting.name: Speeding up growth
betterquesting.desc: Used to accelerate the process of purifying crystals, which allows you to create pure certus quartz crystal, pure nether quartz crystal and pure fluix crystal. Must be powered by an ME Network via the top or bottom, and consumes a steady 8 ae/t while plugged in. Crystal Seeds must be in an adjacent water block to be affected - the seeds will shimmer more rapidly when in the presence of a powered crystal growth accelerator. Can only connect to cables, or other networked machines on the top and bottom of the machine.

betterquesting.name: Perfecting Crystal Growth
betterquesting.desc: The crystal growth chamber is used for fast crystal growth, and it is possible to increase its speed by installing an acceleration card in an upgrade slot.

betterquesting.name: Purifying the impure
betterquesting.desc: Purified versions of nether, certus and fluix crystals

betterquesting.name: Dragon essense
betterquesting.desc: Need some Dragon essense? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Wireless Setup
betterquesting.desc:
Allows you to configure which users, and what permissions the users have with the ME System. By existing it enforces permissions on the usage of the system.

The security system does not prevent destructive tampering, removing cables / machines or breaking of drives. If you need to protect your system from physical vandalism you will need another form of physical security. This block provides network level security.

The player who places the ME security terminal has full control over the network and cannot exclude himself any rights. By adding a blank biometric card you define a default behavior for every player who has no biometric card registered.

In addition to security on the software layer, you can link up your wireless terminal with the network and access it wirelessly.


Allows wireless access via a wireless terminal. Range and power usage is determined based on the number of wireless boosters installed into the ME wireless access point. A network can have any number of ME wireless access point with any number of wireless boosters in each one, allowing you to optimize power usage and range by altering your setup. Requires a channel to be operational.

betterquesting.name: Dense boys
betterquesting.desc: Giving your network even more stability. Dense energy cells store AE energy up to 1.6 million units. They do not accept power directly but are used to buffer power in an already existing ME Network.

betterquesting.name: ME in the Ether
betterquesting.desc:
After you linked up the wireless terminal in the ME security terminal, it grants a portable access to the ME network. Put it into a charger to recharge it.

Holds 1.6m AE in its battery and drains 1 AE/t for each block you are away from the nearest ME wireless access point.

betterquesting.name: Annihilation and Formation
betterquesting.desc:
Formation Core - a component which can convert energy back into matter.
Annihilation Core - a component which can convert matter into energy.
Gates all network I/O.

betterquesting.name: Interfacing with Machines
betterquesting.desc: The ME Interface is the only component which can be used as a part, or as a Block. Crafting an ME interface in either form by itself produces the other form. The thin form is useful if you want to provide several different interfaces in a single block of physical space, but each will need its own channel. The block form lets multiple other blocks connect to a single ME interface, using only one channel for the interface. The ME Interface acts as an in between when working with pipes, tubes, networks, or machines from other mods.

betterquesting.name: Interfacing with Inventories
betterquesting.desc:
The ME storage bus, when attached to another inventory block in the world lets you access that inventory via networked functions. This allows you to use chests, barrels, or other types of item storage in your networks.

The storage via the ME storage bus is bi-directional, it can both insert, or extract items from the inventory block it is attached to as long as the ME storage bus has its required channel.

The UI allows you to control which items are selected as storable items, this selection has no effect on what items can be extracted once they are in the storage.

The storage bus will function with nearly any inventory block, including ME Interface, Minefactory Reloaded DSUs, Factorization barrels, JABBA Barrels, and Better Storage crates. They can also be used to route items passively into Buildcraft pipes.

If you place a storage bus on an ME Interface the storage bus will be able to interact with the full conents of the target network, unless that interface is configured to store items inside itself, in which case it will see those stored items.

betterquesting.name: Interfacing with Tanks
betterquesting.desc: Storage bus for fluids only.

betterquesting.name: For Fluid Recipes
betterquesting.desc: ME interface for fluids only.

betterquesting.name: Extracting Items From the Network
betterquesting.desc: The ME export bus extracts items from the ME network's networked storage and places them into the inventory it faces. You must configure which items it will insert, leaving the configuration blank will result in nothing. The ME export bus will try to export any of the items on its list skipping over those it cannot fit into the destination. The ME export bus requires a channel to function. This is the functional opposite of the ME import bus.

betterquesting.name: Dragon essense II
betterquesting.desc: Need some Dragon essense? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Inserting Items Into the Network
betterquesting.desc: Pulls items from the inventory it is pointed at and places them into the ME network's networked storage. You can specify which items it will pull out via the UI, else it tries to pull out any item in the adjacent inventory. The ME import bus will attempt to import any possible options, even if 1 or more of the configured items cannot be stored. The ME import bus requires a channel to function. This is the functional opposite of the ME export bus.

betterquesting.name: Emptying Tanks
betterquesting.desc: Import Bus for Fluids only.

betterquesting.name: Something to put your Components in
betterquesting.desc: An empty storage container, you can insert any of the various storage cell parts into it to create a usable storage cell.

betterquesting.name: Tier 1 Storage
betterquesting.desc:
The main processor for 1K and 4K cells.

As alternatives to storing items in ME, you can use a storage bus connected to other blocks.  A common tactic is to connect to a bank of Compressed Chests or even a Drawer Controller in this way. This can help reduce the power requirements in your AE system.

betterquesting.name: Automating Crafting
betterquesting.desc: Is a component of the crafting CPU. This particular block provides the CPU with no additional features, but can be used as a "filler" block and as a crafting ingredient for the crafting storage, monitor and co-processing units.

betterquesting.name: 1k Item Storage Cell
betterquesting.desc: Lowest tier storage cell, which can contain 1,024 bytes of storage. 1,024 bytes of storage can hold 127 stacks of a single item, or 65 stacks, while holding 63 different items. The 1k storage cell uses 8 bytes of data to store a single type. When placed inside a drive or chest will consume 0.5 ae/t. Must be in an ME drive or ME chest to be usable. You can remove the 1k ME storage component by fully emptying the storage cell, and sneak clicking it in your hand. The settings can be changed in the cell workbench.

betterquesting.name: 1k Component
betterquesting.desc: Smallest storage component, used to make 1k ME storage cell, or can be upgraded to make 4k ME storage component. Can be recovered from a crafted 1k ME storage cell by fully emptying the storage cell, and shift clicking it in your hand.

betterquesting.name: 1k Crafting Storage
betterquesting.desc: Component of the crafting CPU which provides 1024 bytes of storage for crafting.

betterquesting.name: 4k Item Storage Cell
betterquesting.desc: Second tier storage cell, which can contain 4,096 bytes of storage. 4,096 bytes of storage can hold 508 stacks of a single item, or 260 stacks, while holding 63 different items. The 4k storage cell uses 32 bytes of data to store a single type. When placed inside a drive or chest will consume 1.0 ae/t. Must be in an ME drive or ME chest to be usable. You can remove the 4k ME storage component by fully emptying the storage cell, and sneak clicking it in your hand.

betterquesting.name: 4k Component
betterquesting.desc: Second smallest storage component, used to make 4k ME storage cell, or can be upgraded to make 16k ME storage component. Can be recovered from a crafted 4k ME storage cell by fully emptying the storage cell, and shift clicking it in your hand.

betterquesting.name: 4k Crafting Storage
betterquesting.desc: Component of the crafting CPU which provides 4,096 bytes of storage for crafting.

betterquesting.name: Tier 2 Storage
betterquesting.desc: The main processor for 16k and 64k cells.

betterquesting.name: §6§lAdvanced Compressor
betterquesting.desc: The MV compressor is twice as fast as the LV one but uses 4x the power. I suggest crafting 4 MV compressors for the new biomass processing line.

betterquesting.name: §6§lAdvanced Macerator
betterquesting.desc: The MV macerator is twice as fast as the LV one but uses 4x the power.

betterquesting.name: §6§lAdvanced Centrifuge
betterquesting.desc: The MV centrifuge is twice as fast as the LV one but uses 4x the power.

betterquesting.name: §5§6§lBiomass
betterquesting.desc: Chose the IC2 or the gregtech way to make biomass. Water and BioChaff is needed.

betterquesting.name: §6§lAdvanced Fluid Extractor
betterquesting.desc: The MV fluid extractor is twice as fast as the LV one but uses 4x the power.

betterquesting.name: Dagger of Sacrifice
betterquesting.desc: Time to get more blood. Mobs are a good source for more blood. Transform your knife of sacrifice in your tier 2 altar into a dagger of sacrifice.

betterquesting.name: Co-Processing
betterquesting.desc:
Component of the crafting CPU which provides additional item delivery from the CPU to the ME Interface for crafting.

This can be used to make more assemblers active in parallel for the job, and thus increase overall crafting speed. These only help if your setup has steps properly separated so the system can run multiple tasks in parallel, or even split the same pattern across multiple interfaces.

betterquesting.name: Recipe Patterns
betterquesting.desc: A blank pattern, once encoded as an encoded pattern, is used to control crafting by inserting them into molecular assemblers and ME interfaces.

betterquesting.name: Pattern Terminal
betterquesting.desc:
A specialized version of the ME crafting terminal designed to encode blank patterns into encoded patterns.

Lets you browse the contents of your network like other terminals, but also contains an area for designing patterns. There are two modes for pattern encoding. Crafting patterns, and processing patterns. Processing patterns are designed for use with machines that do not use standard crafting recipes - such as furnaces, or other machines. To select between modes, click the button to the right of the interface: when it shows a standard crafting table, it will create crafting patterns, and when it shows a furnace, it will create processing patterns.

For crafting patterns ("Crafts..."), you specify the input crafting materials on a standard 3x3 crafting grid, and the output materials are determined automatically.

For processing patterns ("Creates..."), you specify the input materials and output materials, including quantity, by placing stacks of items in the interface. If a processing operation is not guaranteed to succeed (such as secondary products from some machines), it will not work correctly as a processing pattern.

When designing crafting patterns you can click the output to extract a crafted item as long as you have the materials required to craft the item.
Don't forget to enable oredict substitution where needed.

betterquesting.name: ME in your Cleanroom
betterquesting.desc:
Wireless connector is a close range quantum bridge alternative.
Connections are point-to-point - you can't connect more than 2 blocks together. Each block will use 10 + distance^2 AE/t. Does not work across dimensions. Power needs to be provided on only one side. Up to 32 channels can be transferred through the connection. Can connect directly to dense cables.

betterquesting.name: Ore Dictionary Output
betterquesting.desc: The ME ore dictionary export bus will attempt to push the configured item/fluid [From the same ore dictionary] from the ME network into a machine or other input inventory. To configure an item/liquid, type in the item's name [e.g. if you want to export all ores put "ore*"]. The rate of export is very fast.

betterquesting.name: To Link P2P Busses
betterquesting.desc: A small item, that can be used to store, copy, and paste settings. Shift + right click on a configurable object to save the settings onto the memory card, then right click on any other block of the same type to paste the settings. They are also used to link the input P2P tunnel to the corresponding output P2P tunnels.

betterquesting.name: Compressed Solar LV
betterquesting.desc: The power of the sun x10. This solar panel works like 10 regular ones, but costs only 9. How is this possible? Magic! NOTE: They give out GT EU. NO TRANSFORMER NEEDED!

betterquesting.name: Essentia Generator: Potentia
betterquesting.desc:
Aren't you tired of voiding all that useless potentia essentia? Well here's the solution:
A generator that consumes potentia and outputs GT EU NO TRANSFORMER NEEDED!

betterquesting.name: Essentia Generator: Auram
betterquesting.desc: This Generator is quite tricky. It requires Auram Essentia, that isn't that common, but its output is nice.

betterquesting.name: Infused Solars
betterquesting.desc: Compressed Solar Panels can be infused with Aspects for certain additional features. Check them out and choose one of them.

betterquesting.name: Double Compressed Solar
betterquesting.desc: 100EU/t for 72x1EU/t Solars? Sounds like a good deal. Get one of these. They can be Infused as well.

betterquesting.name: Even more Infused
betterquesting.desc: You can infuse double or triple compressed solars as well.

betterquesting.name: Full power
betterquesting.desc: Triple Compressed Solars. Yes, that's right. They are a bit more expensive than their lower counterparts, 576 Solars in total. But they give out 1,000 GT EU per tick and have no need to be cleaned.  How so? Magic.

betterquesting.name: Essentia Generator: Ignis
betterquesting.desc: So, you got rid of the Potentia, maybe you don't want Ignis, but Potentia? Get this one to be able to burn Ignis.

betterquesting.name: Essentia Generator: Arbor
betterquesting.desc: When using magical plants to get Praecantatio Essentia, you'll end up with a couple dozen of Arbor Essentia jars.  But no worries! This generator runs on Arbor! Awesome!

betterquesting.name: Essentia Generator: Aer
betterquesting.desc: Sugarcanes to power...? This generator runs on Aer Essentia, it might not be as powerful as it's counterparts, but it's fuel is cheap.

betterquesting.name: Essentia Generator: Lucrum
betterquesting.desc: This highly-warped, high-power Essentia generator is a lifesaver, when you run out of energy. Just toss some gold into your Arcane Furnace and burn the Lucrum you get.

betterquesting.name: Works like in anime!
betterquesting.desc: You want to fly. Badly. So go and ductape wings!

betterquesting.name: Angel Wings
betterquesting.desc: Since you have access to better materials than cardboard now, you wanted to make wings. Angel wings.

betterquesting.name: Secret-Angel-Assasin
betterquesting.desc: Infusing your Wings with Nano-Technologies seems to be the next step, to further improve them and combine magic and technology.

betterquesting.name: Dropped in Asgard, fallen to earth
betterquesting.desc: You've heared rumors of a mighty weapon, dropped in Asgard and fallen to earth. Could this be the mystical Item?

betterquesting.name: Repaired it!
betterquesting.desc: Sadly enough, the hammer was broken. But you have the skills and the knowledge to repair it, don't you?

betterquesting.name: Super-Mjollnir
betterquesting.desc: Addidional tweaks to your Mjollnir have changed it. Now you can summon Guardian Snowman to help you out!

betterquesting.name: Electrogoggles
betterquesting.desc: As you wander with your Goggles of Revealing you noticed that they tend to break easy. So craft yourself some electric ones that just need to be charged again!

betterquesting.name: Nano Goggles
betterquesting.desc: The #1 product for spies and wanna-be-spies. Nano-Goggles. Don't you want one of these too? But they are sold out? Craft some!

betterquesting.name: Quantum Goggles
betterquesting.desc: As you continue to progress, you notice that your black goggles don't match your nice white and shiny armor. You decide to get a pair of white ones.

betterquesting.name: Goggles > 9000
betterquesting.desc: This special pair of goggles recharges itself while you wander in sunlight. How convinient.

betterquesting.name: Sparking Nitor...?
betterquesting.desc: YELLOW! What an ugly color! I want PURPLE Nitor! Get me some and you'll receive something nice in exchange.

betterquesting.name: Rechargeable Scribing Tools
betterquesting.desc: Are you tired of getting all the Ink for your scribing and you don't want to use your blood either? Get this Hi-Tech Scribing Device which will make your life much easier! Treat it like an LV machine - charge in any LV machine's battery slot, or in an LV battery buffer.

betterquesting.name: Angel Wings - Ultra Force!
betterquesting.desc: From ore to ingot, from nano to quantum, as you progress, your technology level increases, so should your wings as well.

betterquesting.name: Angel Wings - Combine!
betterquesting.desc: The last step is to combine the quantum armor with your quantum wings.

betterquesting.name: Electric Hoe-ing
betterquesting.desc: While the Hoe of Growth breaks easily, we have a fix for you! Get this one and simply recharge it, when it's empty.

betterquesting.name: EU->VIS
betterquesting.desc: This device allows you to charge your wands using EU, but it costs 10kEU per Vis restored.

betterquesting.name: Press and hold the B button to block!
betterquesting.desc: This Focus allows you to block any incoming damage. Sneak away if you're fighting an enemy too strong for you!

betterquesting.name: Reactor Shielding 2.0
betterquesting.desc: Shield Blocks - explosion proof - single use. Get a couple of these to shield your reactor!

betterquesting.name: What the Heck...?
betterquesting.desc: You found a yellow-ish glowing ball. It might be useful later on.

betterquesting.name: The One Ring.
betterquesting.desc: So you found it. The One Ring, forged by a mighty Dark Wizard. A strange feeling tells you to put it on. The Ring seems to whisper to you as well...

betterquesting.name: Trigger:Ring
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Trigger:Mjolnir
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Trigger:Ballthingy
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Ocean Bees
betterquesting.desc: Want some Ocean Bees? Since some servers don't provide ocean biomes, buy some!

betterquesting.name: Upgrade your Forestry Backpack
betterquesting.desc:
With your woven silk you can upgrade your Forestry backpacks. Each Pack has 45 slots.
You need a carpenter, your old backpack and a bit of seed oil.

If the recipe is not working, put the bag in a crafting grid to reset additional nbt data.

betterquesting.name: Lost in the Twilight Forest
betterquesting.desc: If you stay in the Twilight Forest and your portal gets broken, you are stuck. Every 24h you are able to exchange some materials to get a new portal crystal to escape.

betterquesting.name: Time to find some Amber
betterquesting.desc: Every Thaumcraft Infused Stone vein has a bit of amber ore in it. Go and find some amber ore.

betterquesting.name: Light it up!
betterquesting.desc:
The arcane lamp creates additional light sources which acts like a Torch in a sphere with a radius of 16 blocks centered on it. This will include caves or other areas behind walls.  That might be useful... One downside, it might put a light where one isn't wanted, like inside an EBF. 

When attached to the base of an arcane bore, the arcane lamp gains an additional ability: It will light up the tunnel that the bore digs.

betterquesting.name: LOX and Bagels
betterquesting.desc:
The LOX canister is an alternate solution to refilling your oxygen tanks.
To make liquid oxygen you need 1 oxygen cells.
Put this in the HV powered vacuum freeezer to get 1 cell of liquid oxygen.
Transfer this liquid oxygen into a tank, and then into a LOX canister.
To refill your oxygen tanks just put the tank and the LOX canister in the crafting grid to transfer oxygen.
Each LOX canister can fill 4 Heavy Oxygen Tanks, 6 Medium Oxygen Tanks, or 12 Light Oxygen Tanks. With a full stack you won't need to bring oxygen equipment with you.

So much Greggy!

betterquesting.name: Wand Focus Fire
betterquesting.desc:
The Wand Focus: Fire is a basic wand focus. When equipped to a wand, it will be able to spew a short-range cone of fire by holding down the right mouse button. Its base vis cost is 0.1 ignis per second.

This focus can be upgraded at the Focal Manipulator.

betterquesting.name: Wand Focus Excavation
betterquesting.desc:
The Wand Focus: Excavation when equipped to a wand, will emit a green beam of light that will mine blocks of any hardness (except for blocks like Bedrock) from a distance.
Its base vis cost is 0.15  terra per tick that it mines a block. It is also used in operating the Arcane Bore.

This focus can be upgraded at the Focal Manipulator.

betterquesting.name: Wand Focus Shock
betterquesting.desc:
The Wand Focus: Shock when equipped to a wand will shoot a bolt of lightning when the right mouse button is pressed. It homes in slightly to the nearest mob/player from where it is aimed. Its base vis cost is 0.25 air per cast.

This focus can be upgraded at the Focal Manipulator.

betterquesting.name: Wand Focus Equal Trade
betterquesting.desc:
Wand Focus: Equal Trade is a wand focus added by Thaumcraft 4. It is used to switch out blocks in the world with blocks in the player's inventory. Shift right-clicking on a block with it equipped will attune the focus to the block, making it the substitute block. Left-clicking on another block will replace it with the substitute block. Right-clicking will transform a 3x3 area of blocks that the player can see (the focus will not affect blocks behind those). This range can be extended by using a Focal Manipulator. Each use costs 0.05 ordo 0.05 perditio and 0.05 terra.

This focus can be upgraded at the Focal Manipulator.

betterquesting.name: Wand Focus Frost
betterquesting.desc:
The Wand Focus: Frost when equipped to a wand will launch a ball of ice that can bounce off of blocks and mobs if their hardness is high enough.  It will inflict Slowness on mobs, freeze water and solidify lava.  Its base vis cost is 0.05 aqua 0.02 ignis and 0.02 perditio per cast.

This focus can be upgraded at the Focal Manipulator.

betterquesting.name: Wand Focus Warding
betterquesting.desc:
The Wand Focus: Warding can be used to make blocks invincible. To ward a block, right click on it with a wand or staff with this focus on it. This will make the block invincible until it is unwarded by right clicking it again with the wand. Take note that only the player who warded the block can unward it. 

Warded Blocks are completely indestructible and will produce particle effects similiar to runic shielding when the owner or another player tries to break it. Also, blocks that are affected by gravity(such as sand and gravel) will not fall when warded. Warded blocks cannot be affected by any outside influence such as redstone and pistons. If you attempt to ward glass, it will break the glass instead. There is a block known as warded glass available within the warded arcana research. The only way to break the warded block is via the owner right clicking with a wand in hand. Warding a block costs 0.1 aqua, 0.25 ordo and 0.25 terra.

Special Note: Warded blocks emit light.

This focus can be upgraded at the Focal Manipulator.

betterquesting.name: Wand Focus Portable Hole
betterquesting.desc:
The Wand Focus: Portable Hole when equipped to a wand will create a temporary 3x3 hole centered on the targeted block that will go 32 blocks. Some blocks cannot be passed through, such as Bedrock. Its base vis cost is air 0.1  and perditio 0.1  per cast.

This focus can be upgraded at the Focal Manipulator.

betterquesting.name: Cart with Chunkloader
betterquesting.desc: When transporting oil from long distances, a train is going to need a chunk loader. Craft one, and I'll give you a second one for free.

betterquesting.name: Wand Focus Pech's Curse
betterquesting.desc:
The Pech's Curse is a rare wand focus which cannot be crafted by the player. It can only be obtained from a Pech Thaumaturge -- either by trading, or by killing it for the drop. (If attacked, the Pech will use it against you!)  Its vis cost per shot is 0.1 Perditio, 0.1 Terra and 0.1 Aqua.

The focus fires a small ball of energy with a bright bluish-green trail. This missile is affected by gravity, so the shots need to be "arced" to hit distant targets. When the shot hits a mob, it does one heart of damage and randomly inflicts one of several effects on the target: Poison, Weakness, or Slowness. A 5th-level upgrade to the focus can make it give all the effects at once.

This focus can be upgraded at the Focal Manipulator.

betterquesting.name: Wand Focus Primal
betterquesting.desc:
The Wand Focus: Primal will hurl an orb of primal energy while holding right-click with it equipped. The orb explodes on impact, and has a small chance to cause other effects, such as creating taint, or a node at the impact site. Its base vis cost changes every tick.

This focus can be upgraded at the Focal Manipulator.

betterquesting.name: Pimp your Wand Focus
betterquesting.desc: The Manipulator requires both XP levels and centi-vis in order to upgrade foci. Each Focus can be upgraded a total of five times, with the level and vis cost increasing by 8 for each upgrade. Some upgrades can be applied only at certain levels (often only at level 3), and others have prerequisite upgrades. Some upgrades like Frugal and Potency can be applied multiple times. All upgrades are permanent, and there is currently no way to remove them.

betterquesting.name: Advanced Node Stabilizer
betterquesting.desc: The advanced node stabilizer acts like a normal node stabilizer but with key differences. It will still stop the node it affects from being drained but the node can now drain from other lesser nodes. It also has a higher chance to improve fading and unstable nodes. The downside is that any nodes it affects will have their recharge rates effectively reduced to nothing. They will recharge at an extremely reduced rate.

betterquesting.name: Wand Focus Efreet's Flame
betterquesting.desc:
The Wand Focus: Efreet's Flame is a Wand Focus that smelts blocks like a Furnace would when pointed and fired at them. It shoots a beam similar to the Wand Focus: Excavation. Each usage consumes 0.45 Ignis and 0.12 Perditio

This focus can be upgraded at the Focal Manipulator.

betterquesting.name: Wand Focus Dislocation
betterquesting.desc:
Wand Focus: Dislocation allows the user to take and place any blocks, even Tile Entities and things usually unobtainable, like Aura Nodes and their energized counterparts.
It uses:
5 Ordo + 5 Perditio + 1 Terra to take any solid block. 
25 Ordo + 25 Perditio + 5 Terra to take any block with tile entities (such as Chest). 
100 Ordo + 100 Perditio + 20 Terra to take Mob Spawner.

This focus can be upgraded at the Focal Manipulator.

betterquesting.name: Wand Focus Mending
betterquesting.desc:
The Wand Focus: Mending is a wand focus that will slowly mend the Caster's wounds by expending Vis. The Focus consumes 0.45 Aqua and 0.45 Terra per cast, healing half a heart (1 health).

This focus can be upgraded at the Focal Manipulator.

betterquesting.name: Wand Focus Uprising
betterquesting.desc:
The Wand Focus: Uprising is a wand focus that propels the player in the direction they're facing. When used, the focus consumes 0.15 Aer per cast.

This focus can be upgraded at the Focal Manipulator.

betterquesting.name: Wand Focus Disorientation
betterquesting.desc:
The Wand Focus: Distortion can be equipped on any wand.  It protects the caster from "ordinary" projectiles such as arrows, snowballs, and potions. The focus can be enabled by cycling through the foci currently in the player's inventory, which is done with the F-key. The focus consumes 0.04 Aer and 0.08 Ordo per tick from the Vis stored in the wand while in use.

This focus can be upgraded at the Focal Manipulator.

betterquesting.name: Wand Focus Ender Rift
betterquesting.desc:
The Wand Focus: Ender Rift is a Wand Focus that opens the vanilla Ender Chest remotely when the player right-clicks with it. When used, the focus consumes 0.9 Ordo + 0.9 Perditio

This focus can be upgraded at the Focal Manipulator.

betterquesting.name: Wand Focus Telekinesis
betterquesting.desc:
Wand Focus: Telekinesis is a wand focus that can move nearby objects such as dropped items, arrows etc. where you are pointing with the wand or towards you, if you hold Shift key while using it. Consumes 0.05 Aer + 0.05 Perditio per tick used.

This focus can be upgraded at the Focal Manipulator.

betterquesting.name: Wand Focus Experience Drain
betterquesting.desc:
Wand Focus: Experience Drain will drain the player's experience at a rate of 15 xp per tick, restoring vis at a rather fast rate.

This focus can be upgraded at the Focal Manipulator.

betterquesting.name: Wand Focus Shadow Beam
betterquesting.desc:
Wand Focus: Shadowbeam shoots a beam of energy that is reflected by any block and damages everything it passes through. The beam travels a rather short distance though. Consumes 0.15 Aer + 0.25 Ordo + 0.25 Perditio per cast.

This focus can be upgraded at the Focal Manipulator.

betterquesting.name: Wand Focus Tainted Storm
betterquesting.desc:
Wand Focus: Tainted Storm can be equipped on any wand and will emit a stream of tainted particles which will damage anything in a short distance and inflict Taint Poison for 5 seconds. The focus will also debuff the caster with Flux Flu III for 10 seconds unless enchanted with Antibody. The foci can be enchanted with Frugal, Potency, Enlarge, Antibody and Corrosive. Each cast costs 0.1 Aqua + 0.1 Perditio

This focus can be upgraded at the Focal Manipulator.

betterquesting.name: Wand Focus Tainted Shockwave
betterquesting.desc:
Wand Focus: Tainted Shockwave will release a powerful shockwave around the caster which travels 15-20 blocks and will damage all mobs in the radius and push them back the same as a Knockback II enchantment. After using this foci the caster will be unable to use any other magic for 15 seconds. The foci can be enchanted with Frugal and Enlarge, each level of Enlarge will add 1 block to the shockwave radius. Each cast costs 10 Aqua + 5 Ordo + 10 Terra + 10 Perditio.

This focus can be upgraded at the Focal Manipulator.

betterquesting.name: Wand Focus Vis Shard
betterquesting.desc:
Wand Focus: Vis Shard can be equipped on any wand. While equipped, it can be right-clicked to cast a homing projectile which deals 2-5 damage points. This projectile can bounce off of solid blocks.
