betterquesting.desc: Do you like pies? I sure do!  There are many varieties of pies available for you.  The chicken pot pie is one of the easiest to make. Just a chicken, potato, carrot, and some dough. The fruit pies are a little simpler, so don't quite restore as much saturation, but are great for filling tummies while you wait for the best foods to wear off.

betterquesting.name: §9§lMagnetic personality
betterquesting.desc: If you haven't received one in a lootbag already, you can craft a nice magnet with a vibrant crystal.  It doesn't work great on servers if you are moving around too fast, but it makes harvesting crops a lot easier.

betterquesting.name: Need some leather?
betterquesting.desc: Buy some leather with coins.

betterquesting.name: Need some wool?
betterquesting.desc: Buy some wool with coins.

betterquesting.name: Buy some eggs
betterquesting.desc: Buy some eggs with coins.

betterquesting.name: Robotic crop pickers
betterquesting.desc: The Crop Harvester will pick your crops for you, which is great.

betterquesting.name: §5§lThrowing out the trash
betterquesting.desc:
Already have barrels full of cobblestone? The voiding drop filter can be setup to automatically void any item on pickup.  Cobble, dirt, arrows, saplings,etc. It's handy for when you don't have much room for junk.

To use, rightclick the RT item filter in-hand.  Put the things you want voided in the item filter list. Rightclick the voiding drop filter, and put the item filter inside.

betterquesting.name: §2§lNo self-healing tools here...yet
betterquesting.desc:
Experienced players might be confused by finding the Tinker's Construct Ball of Moss in NEI without a recipe. 

It is possible to craft it, but on this world you have to first gain expertise in Thaumcraft. Go and become a dangerous wizard and you'll gain the power needed to craft the Ball of Moss and make your tools indestructible.

The Ball of Moss is in the GTNH tab of the Thauminomicon.

In general, if an item does not have a recipe, it might be gated by Thaumcraft. NEI will not show the recipe until you have unlocked it.

Have a beer to prepare for your long journey.

betterquesting.name: §5§lEnderman Smelterman
betterquesting.desc:
Need enderpearls? Getting them by killing endermen can be dangerous. Instead of doing that, put an enderman into a smeltery with hot fluids and use a gem cast to get guaranteed pearls. 

Higher the hit points, the more pearls you get.  If you can find a regenerating enderman, or an enderman spawner, you'll have all the pearls you would ever want. Later on with EnderIO you can even create your own powered spawner to make endermen on-demand.

Use a nametag on a regenerating enderman to make sure he doesn't despawn.  You'll want to keep him from seeing the sky or else he'll teleport away.

If you haven't found a regen enderman yet, you can buy enderman spawn eggs to put into your smeltery with coins.  Maybe you'll get lucky and get a regenerating one.

betterquesting.name: §2§lOptions for finding aluminium at this age
betterquesting.desc:
It can be hard to find aluminium gravel ores on old servers, or unlucky world seeds. Alternative to aluminium gravel ores are

- Planting the Aluminium  ore berries from the Smeltery quest
- Searching for Aluminium bars in chests
- XP buckets

Once you reach LV, you can electrolyze Sapphires and get tiny dusts from processing various ores. 
At MV you can use clay dust or red granite dust.
Check NEI.

betterquesting.name: §6§lMV Motor
betterquesting.desc: Most machines in MV need a motor as well. If you have not built a polarizer already, go back to Tier 2 Quests and craft one. Motors need magnetic steel rods and alu rods, 2x cupronickel wires and copper cables.

betterquesting.name: §6§lUltra Low Power IC
betterquesting.desc: MV Energy hatches need ultra low power ICs. Go and craft some.

betterquesting.name: §6§lHydrogen, methane or some farts... (Natural gas) MV
betterquesting.desc:
Some centrifugal processes leave gases behind like hydrogen or methane. Centrifuge some brown and yellow limonite to get hydrogen or dump your unused food in a centrifuge to get methane gas. Wood will even give 60 mb per log. Maybe it's time to build a forestry tree farm. You can also setup a Benzene based operation (see quest to the right). Or you can start refining oil into refinery gas or naphtha to burn.

§4Gas turbines produce half the pollution of combusion generators, but their fuels are generally not as efficient. Choice is up to you which power source you use.

MV Gas Turbines have a 90 percent fuel efficiency.

betterquesting.name: §6§lDiesel, oil or maybe creosote? MV
betterquesting.desc:
You probably collected a ton of creosote and maybe even have built your first Electric Blast Furnace. Creosote will be a good fuel for the moment. So try to build a few of the combustion generators and use them besides steam as a secondary power source. Small generators will only use fuel if there is EU demand.

§4Advanced Combustion Gnerators have a 90 percent fuel efficiency.

This will also unlock new quests in the Armors and Jetpacks tab.

betterquesting.name: §9§lField Generator I
betterquesting.desc: Field Generators are powerful devices. It will be used in high tier Tanks, Chests, in UU Matter Production or in Teleporters.

betterquesting.name: §6§lVinyl Chloride
betterquesting.desc: Vinyl Chloride is the base product for making PVC for advanced pipes. These Pipes are needed in LuV machines or the Hermetic Casings for Super Tank II's.

betterquesting.name: §6§lPoly Vinyl Chloride
betterquesting.desc:
Polyvinyl Chloride is PVC which can be used for the PVC Pipes.
You need Vinyl Chloride and Oxygen to make it.
You'll also want it for SMD capacitors later.
Do the recipe twice if you want to clean out your reactor.
Cells carrying molten polyvinyl chloride carry 144L, perfect for 1 ingot or plate.

betterquesting.name: §6§lPVC Sheets
betterquesting.desc: PVC Sheets make good item pipes, and can also be used for circuit boards.

betterquesting.name: A soul-ution for warp
betterquesting.desc:
The Soul Brazier from Thaumic Exploration will store your permanent warp. 

As long as it has Ignis centi-vis and Mortuus essentia fed from underneath it will stay active, even while you are in other dimensions. Turning it off or running out of power will dump all that warp back into your body, so watch out.

Containing warp does have a bit of a downside - taint.  You'll need to figure out a way to stop that.

betterquesting.name: §a§9§lAdvanced Amplifabricator
betterquesting.desc: To get UU Amplifier out of you scrap you need an Amplifabricator. You can't make UU Matter before HV so its a good time to start with it now.

betterquesting.name: §9§lUU Matter
betterquesting.desc:
Next you will need a Mass Fabricator to make UU matter. This matter can be used make more things.

The downside is you can't build an HV one right now. Build an LV one and power it with 8 amps of LV to get your first UU matter. Watch your voltage levels and currents!

If you do not have a field generator, go do the tetrafluoroethylene quest and build some.  

For now, just stockpile the UU matter.

betterquesting.name: §a§lData Orbs
betterquesting.desc: Data Orbs are high tier data sticks to replicate materials or used as data storages.

betterquesting.name: §a§lCreate new material out of pure energy
betterquesting.desc: Replicate material out of pure energy. Scan your elements first, like Hydrogen, Iron, Gold etc, and save them on a Data Orb. Later on you can use your replicator to copy this item.

betterquesting.name: §a§lField Generator II
betterquesting.desc:
Field Generators are powerful devices. It will be used in high tier Tanks, Chests, in the Matter Production or in Teleporters.
The replicator needs it also. If you have not unlocked Tungstensteel go and do that now.

betterquesting.name: Clay for pennies
betterquesting.desc: Hard to find that clay? Have a stack for some coins.

betterquesting.name: Tired of grinding reeds?
betterquesting.desc: I can trade you some chads for coins.

betterquesting.name: Glassy eyed
betterquesting.desc: ...from all the mortars you have to use to make glass dust? Have some for trade.

betterquesting.name: Shhh, don't tell 0lafe...
betterquesting.desc: But here is a nice quest to get cheap fish catchers!

betterquesting.name: Wood for sheep?
betterquesting.desc: No thanks! But how about some crop sticks for coins and logs?

betterquesting.name: Manure for fertilizer
betterquesting.desc: I mean, what else are you going to do with this junk?

betterquesting.name: §5§lElectric Furnace
betterquesting.desc: This quest was suggested by Shawnbyday. If you have a lv machine hull, two circuits and a few cables spare just craft it.

betterquesting.name: §4§3§lRepairing your Hazmat Suit
betterquesting.desc:
Be careful to wearing you hazmat suit all the time. The duarbility is not high. Even just falling a few blocks will damage the boots quickly. 
You can repair your suit before you can craft a new one in late LV Age using some rubber sheets and a glue bucket.

betterquesting.name: Healing Axe 2.0
betterquesting.desc:
After party loot was limited to one loot per party not everyone can have a healing axe for free.
Go and buy some.

betterquesting.name: §b§lIV Assembler
betterquesting.desc: An IV asembler is required to make enriched Sunnarium for HV Solar Pannels . Other recipes are twice faster than with an EV assembler.

betterquesting.name: §a§lDesh, Scheelite, Tungstate
betterquesting.desc: Tungstensteel is the material you need but first go find some desh scheelite and tungstate mix on Mars. Look at Y 5-40.

betterquesting.name: Fluorine
betterquesting.desc: Want some fluorine? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: §6§lFluid Regulator
betterquesting.desc:
Turbines require precise amounts of fluids or else they will explode.  Use the fluid regulator on the pipe attached to the input bus to control the rate of fluids into the turbine. To raise the fluid limit, look at the right side of the regulator and:

1L - Right click with an empty hand
16L - Right click with a screwdriver
256L - Right click with a screwdriver while sneaking

To lower the fluid limit, do the same while looking at the left side.

betterquesting.name: §6§lGas Turbine
betterquesting.desc:
A Large Gas Turbine is more fuel-efficient than singleblock turbines and can have lower pollution with upgraded mufflers.

You will also need a muffler, maintenance hatch, input hatch, and dynamo hatch.  Don't forget a fluid regulator. It can be a low tier fluid regulator since the fluid/tick necessary is much less than steam.

Selecting a rotor is pretty easy. Take the EU/t of your dynamo hatch, and select a rotor that has (optimal gas flow * efficiency) that is close. Now, setting up the fluid regulator is hard. The easiest way is to let in 1 L/t and use the hand-scanner to tell you the optimal flow rate. Otherwise divide the optimal gas flow by the EU/L of your gas and round down. 

For example, if we are using a normal vibrant alloy turbine with 1800 EU/t optimal gas flow and 115 percent efficiency with benzene. 
1800/288 = 6.25
Rounded down that is 6L/t.  6 * 288 * 1.15 = 1987, perfect for an EV dynamo.
Other gases may output slightly higher or lower EU depending on how close to optimal they can reach. For example refinery gas
1800/160 = 11.25
11 * 160 * 1.15 = 2024, still OK for an EV dynamo
However hydrogen at 20 EU/L is dangerous because
1800/20 = 90
90 * 20 * 1.15 = 2070, above 2048, so BOOOOM.  You'll have to use a multi-amp dynamo hatch to prevent an explosion.

Other useful turbine options at EV are normal ardite and galgadorian.

For additional choices, see the Large Turbine Calculator in Discord.

betterquesting.name: Manganese Ore
betterquesting.desc: Can't find Manganese ore because its not generated early game and you need to grow your Pyrolusium crop? Buy some Ores.

betterquesting.name: §b§lNaquadah Fuel Rods
betterquesting.desc: Time to upgrade the Nuclear Reactor with Naquadah Fuel Rods.

betterquesting.name: §b§lNaquadria Fuel Rods
betterquesting.desc: Want MOX like behavior from Naquadah?  You have to upgrade it to Naquadria!

betterquesting.name: §a§lDouble the fun
betterquesting.desc: Need even more power? Why not combine rods? Produces twice the amount of power (and heat, obviously) but only uses up one slot.

betterquesting.name: §a§lDouble the fun
betterquesting.desc: Need even more power? Why not combine rods? Produces twice the amount of power (and heat, obviously) but only uses up one slot.

betterquesting.name: 4 x the power and heat
betterquesting.desc: Need even more power? Why not combine dual rods? Produces twice the amount of power (and heat, obviously) but only uses up one slot.

betterquesting.name: §9§a§l4 x the power and heat
betterquesting.desc: Need even more power? Why not combine dual rods? Produces twice the amount of power (and heat, obviously) but only uses up one slot.

betterquesting.name: §a§lNo Boom Tomorrow
betterquesting.desc:
With a nuke, you can cause some real catastrophic damage to your base. You can either place it 20 chunks away, or surround it with blast proof materials. Fused quartz is relatively cheap, and can be converted into a variant that glows, or a variant that blocks light. Make some fused quartz and I'll give you some enlightened fused quartz.

§4Alternatives include Warded Glass from Thaumcraft.

betterquesting.name: §9§e§9§lHV Energy Hatch
betterquesting.desc: The HV energy hatch is crucial to a fast EBF that can do high tier recipes. You will need to make He coolant cells or NaK coolant cells. Follow NEI to figure out how.

betterquesting.name: §6§lHelium is not just for balloons
betterquesting.desc: Higher tier superconducting wires and energy hatches will require helium. Compressing air and liquifying it requires 1802 compressed air cells to get 1 He cell. It is better to make it from Endstone  dust or Monazite from the Moon.

betterquesting.name: §6§lLarge Heat Exchanger - Fermat's Last
betterquesting.desc:
I have discovered truly remarkable instructions for this machine which this margin is too small to contain.




Instead, goto https://tinyurl.com/GTNH-LHE and read it there.

betterquesting.name: §9§lRecycle for the Environment
betterquesting.desc:
If you have too much wood, saplings, netherrack or other garbage recycle it and get scrap. You can use it for uu amplifier to make uu matter cheaper.

Certain items such as cobblestone, stone, and tiny/small dusts are too easy to make and don't give any scrap. But otherwise any excess dusts or garbage you can throw in here to get scrap.

betterquesting.name: §6§lOne in a million
betterquesting.desc:
Or 4? Need to store ludicrous amounts of cobble? Stone dust? Saplings? Super chests are the thing to use. A simple Tier 1 Super Chest can store 4 million items, worry free. You will need to take items out manually 64 at a time, or use conveyors etc to extract them. 

Sticking so many items in such a small space does come with a price - no more portability. You better be really sure this is where you want those millions of logs.

betterquesting.name: §3§lLucifer's little helper
betterquesting.desc:
With an alloy smelter and some netherrack dust you can make Nether furnaces, which are extremely efficient cooking machines. Very handy for someone needing a lot stuff furnaced in a jiffy.

The only downside is that iron furnaces can be used in the EBF later on. Nether furnaces cannot.  Then again, Nether dust is practically free, so what's the loss? You can always use them to bake stacks of bread!

betterquesting.name: §9§lHow much is too much cobblestone?
betterquesting.desc: A super chest III is just ridiculous. Who would possibly need to store 16 million items?  You, that's who.

betterquesting.name: §6§lBetter tools
betterquesting.desc: Now that you have an MV extruder you can make the next level of Tinker Tools - based on Vanadiumsteel parts with Damascus steel rods.

betterquesting.name: §6§lCraftsman used to mean quality
betterquesting.desc: Now that you have an EBF you can make vanadiumsteel GT tools. With 192k durability they'll last you a long time.

betterquesting.name: 3 plus 4, carry the 2...
betterquesting.desc: When doing infusions, it's always good to know how close you are in stability.  Once you get to HV you can make an Arcane Abacus to track your infusions. This makes infusions 100 percent safe, right??

betterquesting.name: §6§lGut-enough for you? Bet you thought Newspapers were dead!
betterquesting.desc:
The Typesetting Table and Printing Press will allow you to duplicate books, including enchanted books.  The process is kinda complicated, so check out the Bibliocraft mod wiki page. You'll need to use XP to duplicate enchanted books, so now would be a good time to figure out how to collect large amounts...

§4You'll need some Thaumium ingots.  You can go Thaumcraft, find some in a chest, or try breeding Magical Metal Berries in IC2 crops.

betterquesting.name: §6§lDo you feel unlucky?
betterquesting.desc:
Well not any more!  With some emeralds and a blank book, I'll give you a Fortune 1 you can use in your printing press. Once you have duplicated it a few times, you can combine the Fortune 1 books in an anvil to get a Fortune 2. Duplicate the Fortune 2 books to get a Fortune 3! 

With a Fortune 3 book and a tier-specific item you can remove the trash item rewards from your loot bags. More good stuff!

Soul Bound is another good enchantment, it will keep an enchanted item in your inventory in case of death.

betterquesting.name: §3§lMud, can also be used for facials
betterquesting.desc: You may have found plenty of mud piles around the wetlands and thought of them as mere annoyances when jumping in the water or for that armor. Waste not! With your new extractor, you can pull out the clay hidden in the mud!

betterquesting.name: §6§lWhere is that handyman when you need him?
betterquesting.desc:
A Needs Maintenance cover will send out a redstone signal when the controller it is attached to requires maintenance.  This is handy for the cleanroom you will need to build, since maintenance reduces cleanliness level and will cause voided recipes.

For the cleanroom you can place this on the top or bottom. For other machines you might want to place it on the side so you can have access to the front face. In that case, you can use a soldering iron and fine solder to have it emit a strong redstone signal that will penetrate through a block next to the cover.

betterquesting.name: §6§lBEEEP BEEEP BEEEP
betterquesting.desc:
Knowing that your cleanroom needs maintenance is pretty important.  Instead of just turning on a light, why not use a howler alarm?  It will notify you up to 128 blocks away. 

§4§d§cWarning: May cause uncontrollable urine leakage when activated.

betterquesting.name: §5§lToo much fluid??
betterquesting.desc: Impossible!  If you really think you have so much fluid that you want to just get rid of it, make a fluid trashcan. You can route as much excess creosote or whatever into it you want.

betterquesting.name: §3§lToo much junk??
betterquesting.desc: Impossible!  But if you really want to get rid of excess items, make yourself a trashcan. If you want to be really fancy, you can use a hopper with a lever next to it to make sure you only throw away items you really want. I mean, *I've* never thrown away a tool accidentally, nope, never me.

betterquesting.name: Can't tell them apart either?
betterquesting.desc: Many plants look the same. Someday we'll update their DNA so they are each unique, but for now you can make a simple Plant Lens to at least identify species.

betterquesting.name: §9§lSeparating molecules
betterquesting.desc: An HV centrifuge is required to separate out Tungstate from Lava.  You'll need to start thinking about dedicating a setup just for lava centrifuging. Plus it's a good source of silver, tin, copper, and tantalum.

betterquesting.name: §9§lTransformers, roll out!
betterquesting.desc: When you get to HV you will start wanting to think about centralizing power generation and delivering power over longer distances. An HV to EV transformer will let you send power across your base without too much penalty.

betterquesting.name: §9§lNot enough amps?
betterquesting.desc: How about 4x more?  A Hi-Amp transformer will transform 4 A to 16A. Great for setting up a large power grid and locating polluting power generators further from your base.

betterquesting.name: §9§lMore than 4 amps? Crazy!
betterquesting.desc: For the truly insane, there is a 16 to 64 A power amp transformer. Just ludicrous!

betterquesting.name: §a§lWhat's in the box?
betterquesting.desc: Tired of waiting around 7 hours with radium in your inventory waiting for it to decay? With a lead-lined box you can safely leave your radium and other materials and they will decay while you do real work.

betterquesting.name: §2§lA quicker way to get around
betterquesting.desc: If you are playing single player or a local server, horses make a great way to get around. On nonlocal servers they can cause problems and desync if you have poor internet.

betterquesting.name: Coal...from withereed?
betterquesting.desc:
Withereed is a source for coal, and more importantly, a good breeding stock for higher tiers.

You'll need coal blocks underneath it to fully mature.

betterquesting.name: Son of Odin One-Eye
betterquesting.desc: God of Thunder plant lets you increase your Thorium ore from the Nether by 4x. It also will give you Uranium you can use for Reactoria crops.

betterquesting.name: Just cover your privates when you walk by
betterquesting.desc: Reactoria crops will drop Reactoria leaves which will 4x your Pitchblende ore.

betterquesting.name: Ironwood is better than normal wood
betterquesting.desc:
A necessary step for steeleafranks? Maybe not. But ironwood does make some great rollers for cooking, and a decent Sense blade.

Creeperweed has a decent chance of giving liveroots seeds.

betterquesting.name: Vegan leather?
betterquesting.desc: If you want to save your cows and horses for milk and ...glue... you can use Corium to make leather instead.

betterquesting.name: Gunpowder? More like dirtpowder!
betterquesting.desc:
Creeperweed can supply your gunpowder needs without dealing with bothersome explosions.  It also has quite a few attributes, making it a good source of random crops.

Corium can breed into creeperweed.

betterquesting.name: Milk of the earth-mother
betterquesting.desc: Milkwart means you can get rid of all your cows. Isn't that nice?

betterquesting.name: Cotton and string
betterquesting.desc: With some Farmer coins I'll trade you cotton and string. Perfect for making tanned leather!

betterquesting.name: A better chisel
betterquesting.desc: If you want to decorate your base, you're going to need a better chisel.  The Obsidian chisel lasts twice as long as the iron chisel. A diamond chisel would last 10x as long, but needs an LV cutting machine.

betterquesting.name: Right tool for the job
betterquesting.desc: Tinker's Construct has their own chisel tool variant, for converting Tinker blocks into different types.  Not a lot of uses, but if you check NEI you can see what you can do.

betterquesting.name: Tinker's blocks
betterquesting.desc: Tinker's Construct offers a couple of useful blocks from the smeltery. Rough Brownstone takes Tin and Gravel and makes a block that lets you move a little faster. Cobblestone can be turned into Seared Stone, usable in the smeltery walls to make it larger without having to use clay.

betterquesting.name: Some handy uses
betterquesting.desc:
The TiCon chisel doesn't have a lot of uses, but here a couple of interesting ones. Use NEI to see other options for more decorations. You can also slab these blocks if you want something monsters cannot spawn on.

Brownstone roads are slightly faster than rough brownstone.

betterquesting.name: Chisel all the things
betterquesting.desc: If, for some reason, you need to chisel a large number of items, the autochisel is what you want.

betterquesting.name: Chisel as fast as you can
betterquesting.desc: The autochisel speed is pretty slow. Craft some upgrades to make it faster.

betterquesting.name: My ancient enemy
betterquesting.desc:
The one place Chisel is weak is in stairs. Would be nice to have more variety, but later I'll show you how to make any block into a custom stair.

You can also search NEI for "stairs" to find stairs from other mods.

betterquesting.name: Basic Blocks
betterquesting.desc: Chisel offers a wide variety of blocks. Searching NEI for "chisel" can gives pages and pages.  Here is a small sample.

betterquesting.name: Fun party blocks
betterquesting.desc: There are even some really fun blocks available.

betterquesting.name: Concrete and GT stones
betterquesting.desc: Chisel can also transform Concrete and GT stones into new interesting blocks. Some of the GT stone blocks will even prevent mobs from spawning on top. GT Concrete will let you run faster.

betterquesting.name: Basic Builder's Wand
betterquesting.desc: The only thing going for the stone builder's wand is that it's cheap. It doesn't offer much in special modes, and doesn't last long either. But you can make a lot!

betterquesting.name: Low tier wand
betterquesting.desc: The Iron wand will last longer than the stone wand, and has a few modes.

betterquesting.name: Mid tier wand
betterquesting.desc:
The next tier up wand is the Diamond wand. Has all kinds of fun modes. Just be careful using it, would hate to place a bunch of blocks accidentally!

The ultimate builder's wand you can get from the tab Grind, or not to Grind.

betterquesting.name: No ASMR from your machines?
betterquesting.desc:
If the sounds of your machines are driving you crazy, you can add a muffler upgrade to block them out. 

NOTE: This also means you won't hear when the machine is out of energy.  Also, once applied the upgrade cannot be removed.

betterquesting.name: Better put on that rubber suit
betterquesting.desc: Troll plant!  What does it do?  Troll you!

betterquesting.name: Who the hell is Bob?
betterquesting.desc: Want emeralds for trading or other uses? These are the source.

betterquesting.name: And I dub thee Sir Knight
betterquesting.desc: Need an infinite source of knightmetal? It will be a hard plant to grow.  Make sure you provide plenty of nutrients, clean air, fertilizer and water. Don't cry to me if it dies. Any oreberry is a good source crop, with Cobalt and Ardite best, then iron and the rest.

betterquesting.name: Botany
betterquesting.desc:
The Botany mod offers more colors for blocks and glass, and simple tile patterns or more complex patterns using a Tileworker.  For now, we'll make an iron trowel.

This mod will make lots of butterflies, so make sure to do your gardening underground or under glass. The butterflies will spread and infect leaves around your area, making more butterflies.

betterquesting.name: Finding Flowers
betterquesting.desc: To start, you'll need to find some flowers. Then take your trowel and use it on some dirt blocks to turn it into soil. Next place your flowers on the soil to turn them into Botany flowers.  If you have reached MV tier, check out the Slice and Splice tab for info on Genetics.

betterquesting.name: Analyser
betterquesting.desc:
The Analyzer is a machine that acts in an identical way to the Forestry Analyzer, in that it reveals the genome of bees, trees, butterflies and flowers. It can also be used to reveal the gene present on the DNA Sequence. Unlike the Analyzer, the Analyzer uses power (RF or EU) and DNA Dye to stain chromosomes and determine the genome directly. The analyzer takes 15 seconds to analyse a single individual.

Information from these quests was taken from Binnie's wiki at https://binnie.mods.wiki/wiki/Tutorial/Genetics

betterquesting.name: Powder Power
betterquesting.desc:
Botany uses various powders to enhance soil properties.

Raise Ph - Ash Powder, Pulp Powder
Lower Ph - Mulch Powder, Sulphur Powder
Increase Nutrients - Fertiliser Powder, Compost Powder

betterquesting.name: Killing weeds and growing flowers
betterquesting.desc:
Nobody likes weeds.  Weedkiller will keep the weeds of your soil. 

Bonemeal can be applied to germling flowers to make the mature faster.

betterquesting.name: Like having a County Extension Office in your hand
betterquesting.desc: The soil meter will tell you the soil stats - how dry, how much nutrients, etc. You can amend the soil with the various powders so that it matches the requirements for your flower.

betterquesting.name: 80 new colors to play with
betterquesting.desc:
When you plant a vanilla flower, it is already mature.  Cut it with a shears to get a germling you can replant to make more. Break the flower to get a mature flower. Turn the flower into pigment using a crafting table.
To get crosses, plant flowers next to empty soil blocks. Keep an eye out for weeds. Eventually a small germling will start growing.
Remember, do this underground or in an enclosure or your TPS will regret it.

betterquesting.name: Glass of many colors
betterquesting.desc: The pigments color an amazing variety of glass. Just one warning - unlike normal glass, this glass isn't fireproof.

betterquesting.name: Ceramics
betterquesting.desc: With some clay and pigments, you can make pigmented clay. Put the pigmented clay in a furnace to get basic ceramic blocks. These blocks are great if you want an area of nice even colors.

betterquesting.name: Mortar and tiles
betterquesting.desc: To make ceramic tile patterns, you need to convert your blocks into tiles. First make mortar, and then use the mortar with your blocks in a 3 block + 1 mortar pattern in the crafting table to get ceramic tiles.

betterquesting.name: Tile patterns
betterquesting.desc: Now that you have tiles, you can make simple tile patterns.  A 2x2 of red/yellow and yellow/red makes a simple checkerboard. Using the checkerboard again in a 2x2 makes a checkerboard with smaller tiles. Use Binnie's Botany wiki page to find more patterns you can make with just tiles.

betterquesting.name: Tileworker
betterquesting.desc:
The tileworker can take the single-color ceramic blocks and turn them into pretty patterned blocks.

And contrary to the name, you use ceramic blocks here, not tiles.

betterquesting.name: Does this shit even work?
betterquesting.desc: Who the hell knows? There's nothing in the wiki about these, except that they are to make "gardens."  Maybe make a few and stick them on a Forestry circuit board for a multi-farm? Who cares. Good luck.

betterquesting.name: Glassworker
betterquesting.desc: Want some custom glass shapes and configurations? A glassworker can provide some unique patterns to put in your windows. You'll need to make some glass fittings to hold the glass together.

betterquesting.name: Mo' Hammers Mo' Problems
betterquesting.desc:
Yes indeed, time for another type of hammer.  The master carpentry hammer will allow you to rotate the blocks from the various workers.
Sneak to rotate the blocks vertically.
Why is the lower tier hammer the master hammer?  Who knows??

betterquesting.name: Panels to cover your...everything
betterquesting.desc: The panelworker will create wood flooring pieces for you to use.

betterquesting.name: Fancy woods
betterquesting.desc: With the woodworker, you can create fancy looking types of wood blocks. You can use wood planks from Vanilla, Forestry, and Extra Trees.

betterquesting.name: Look Mom, no torches!
betterquesting.desc:
Tired of a base using nothing but torches? This set of quests will go through the various options avaiable to light up your beautiful base.

First up, Railcraft lanterns.  These come in stone and metallic varieties. The stone varieties don't need much to craft. One plus/minus for these lanterns is that they are solid blocks - while you cannot walk through them, they also do not fall if the blocks around them are removed. Search "lantern" in NEI for more varieties. They are a bit annoying to craft now, but if you check NEI you can make them pretty easy with assemblers later.

betterquesting.name: Second Saw
betterquesting.desc: Forge Microblocks can be really handy to make custom pieces. There are many saw tiers available. If you make me an iron one, I'll give you a diamond one.

betterquesting.name: Fancy lanterns
betterquesting.desc: Bibliocraft offers fancy looking lanterns. Make the candles from candleberries or beeswax.

betterquesting.name: Glowstone
betterquesting.desc:
Now that you've been to the nether and gathered Glowstone, you can use that for light as well. You can color it to make the block color change (unfortunately 1.7.10 does not support colored lights) or you can use the Forge Microblocks saw to cut it up into tiny nooks to light up areas without taking up much space.
There are also various glowing plants you can find or breed, such as glowflowers.

betterquesting.name: Basic ProjectRed Illumination
betterquesting.desc: The basic ProjectRed Illumination lamps only need an LV mixer to make.  The normal version needs a redstone signal to turn on. The inverted version is on unless a redstone signal is applied.

betterquesting.name: Fancier ProjectRed Illumination
betterquesting.desc: The fancier ProjectRed Illumination lamps, lanterns, and fixtures require the Forming Press and Assembler to create.

betterquesting.name: ProjectRed lights with a purpose
betterquesting.desc: ProjectRed offers a couple of special lights that can be used as buttons. The normal buttons are always lit up.  The Feedback buttons are lit up when powered by any redstone signal.

betterquesting.name: Flat lamps
betterquesting.desc: These simple lamps from Ztones are a nice, subdued looking lamp style. I like using them on ceilings for the "office" look.

betterquesting.name: Glowstone & Chisel torches, space rated
betterquesting.desc: When travelling off-world, you want the best in torches. Torches that will work in no-oxygen environments like the Moon.  For that, you need glowstone torches. You can chisel these torches into a variety of torch types, also proven to work in deep space.

betterquesting.name: Lighting up a large area, without electricity
betterquesting.desc: If you have a relatively large area you need to light up without using electricity, you can use these floodlights. They can take normal furnace fuels, including blocks and compressed blocks. They do require some electronic components to make, but can send out a beam a long ways, or a various cone shapes a shorter distance.

betterquesting.name: Lighting up a large area, with electricity
betterquesting.desc: Now that you have a vacuum freezer, you can liquify compressed air cells and centrifuge them for rare gases. You'll need those to make the incandescent bulb for these lights. As long as they have EU, these lights can shoot a beam or do narrow or wide cones.

betterquesting.name: Enderio Lights
betterquesting.desc: Enderio also has its own lights. These lights have a radius of 8 blocks vs the normal 7.

betterquesting.name: BetterIO?
betterquesting.desc: The Powered and Wireless Powered lights from Enderio provide light up to 10 blocks away vs the normal 7 for a torch. They will require centrifuging liquid air to get the bulbs.

betterquesting.name: What's behind door 3?
betterquesting.desc:
The Malisis door factory lets you go crazy with all kinds of ideas for custom doors.

A player sensor is a nicer way of opening a door, instead of pushing a button or stepping on a plate...bit unforunate about the ingredients though. 

Maybe you can find a use for this block mixer, it is kinda weird and doesn't work right. I was going to throw it out anyways.

There are some craftable Malisis items as well, check them out in NEI.

betterquesting.name: Build it bigger
betterquesting.desc: You can build it! The Build Guide helps show you an outline of simple geometric shapes.  Provide it with a redstone signal to activate.

betterquesting.name: Faster better buildi-er
betterquesting.desc: The Enhanced building guide offers more features than the standard model. Most importantly, you can right click on any white part of the block with the item you want placed and the block will place in the world. It will need a redstone signal to activate.

betterquesting.name: So much nicer than ladders
betterquesting.desc:
Elevators are great for fast transportation vertically in your base. Leaving a tinted elevator will stop at the same color elevator. Use some Malisis doors for a nice "real" elevator effect.
The rotating elevator will turn the player as they go up or down to face a specific direction. Handy if your elevator shaft is on one side at a floor and a different side at another floor.

betterquesting.name: More like ouch-i-tect
betterquesting.desc:
The sawbench can turn most full cube blocks into amazing shapes of various kinds.

Right-click with the hammer to rotate 90 degrees. Shift-right-click with the hammer to change the orientation of the "bottom" face.

The Chisel is used to alter the structure of blocks in various ways.
Some blocks automatically form connections with adjacent blocks. These connections can be disabled and re-enabled by right-clicking with a chisel near the side that you want to change.
Some blocks can have a secondary material applied to them. The secondary material can be removed by right-clicking on the centre of the block with a chisel.
You can also right-click on a vanilla Glass, Glass Pane, Glowstone or Ice block with a chisel to harvest the block without breaking it.

betterquesting.name: §3§lUpgrading Drawers
betterquesting.desc: Drawer upgrades are different than barrel upgrades. First you need to make the ugprade template.

betterquesting.name: §3§lYour mom says to upgrade your drawers
betterquesting.desc:
There are many tiers of upgrades for storage drawers. Make some iron, gold and obsidian tier upgrades and I'll give you some of the special purpose upgrades to experiment with in your base. Check NEI for more options and Emerald and Diamond upgrades.

§4To remove upgrades, shift-right-click with an empty hand.

betterquesting.name: Machine Inventory Manager
betterquesting.desc:
The core block of Stacy's...er Steve's Factory Manager. SFM is a high tier automation system. While AE2 can handle simple crafting up to 9 components at a time and even nesting ingredients, SFM can handle the complex crafting required for the assline.

Inventory Cables connect the MIM to inventories or tanks.

Right now until some Moron figures it out, your best bet is to experiment, ask for help on Discord, and search Google. The interface resembles most GUI based automation systems like LabView.

There have been TPS problems caused by poorly designed SFM setups.  Make sure your outputs are properly emptied, and don't get filled.

Inventory cables are the "basic" cable of SFM. They allow the MIM to interact with an inventory, and act as a connector cable to other cables.

mehdi2344 thinks my jokes suck, but he's an idiot, so there. 

Thanks to Nori Silverrage for writing up these quests!

betterquesting.name: Moving the Manager
betterquesting.desc: Ever finished a wonderful program and then realised your Manager needs to move and you have to rewrite the whole thing? Ever need to copy and paste a section of code a bunch of times and been frustrated that you can't? Well we've got you covered with the Manager Duplicator!

betterquesting.name: Naming Names
betterquesting.desc:
The Factory Labeler allows you to assign unique names to anything that can be connected to a Manager - making it easy to identify when you are setting up commands.

Type in the text box to set a label or to searched stored labels - click any stored entry to select it, double click to edit it. Closing the GUI will set the Labeler to whatever was in the text box at that time.

Left click to set labels, right click to open the gui. Setting a blank label will remove any existing labels.

May or may not be buggy.  Have fun!

betterquesting.name: Wand Enhancements
betterquesting.desc: Thaumic Machina offers Wand Augmentations. These useful modifications to your wand can boost their capacity, lower their vis usage, or do other interesting effects.

betterquesting.name: Charge Buffer
betterquesting.desc: A Charge Buffer augmentation to your wand allows it to hold 25 percent more vis.

betterquesting.name: Vis Channels
betterquesting.desc: This wand augment will lower the vis cost when using your wand by 10 percent. I am not sure it works, but give it a try and report back, ok?

betterquesting.name: What are you, a seamstress?
betterquesting.desc: Enchanted Fabric is the key material to fancy robes and wizard's clothing.

betterquesting.name: K-Mart Special
betterquesting.desc: Every point of vis is critical, so make yourself some magical robes to help conserve how much you use. Later you can make even better robes. They don't offer much in protection, so remember to change before going to hunt!

betterquesting.name: Boots are made for walking
betterquesting.desc: And swimming. These boots of the traveller will make you a blur as you go around the world.  You'll need to research infusion before you can make these.

betterquesting.name: I can see everything
betterquesting.desc:
With your new wand, you can make Goggles of Revealing. With Thaumcraft Node Tracker, it makes finding nodes trivial. The default key is I. You can select from the list of nodes you have scanned, and an in-world arrow will show you the way. You can also sort the list.
Best, the goggles give you a 5 percent vis discount. 

Simple lens upgrades will grant you various seeing abilities as well.

Later you can make more advanced goggles and even integrate the goggles into advanced armors.

betterquesting.name: Redstone Emitter
betterquesting.desc: The Redstone Emitter sends redstone signals on each of its 6 faces. The redstone signal strength can be set to any value, add, subtract, and more.

betterquesting.name: Cable Camouflage
betterquesting.desc:
Camouflage blocks allow the faces of cable blocks to be made to imitate any other block. This works in the full workflow and thus can be updated on the fly. 
Please note that this block is placed the same as all of SFM cables. It does not act as an inventory cable and thus will need to be in an advanced cable cluster in many situations.

betterquesting.name: Inventory Relay
betterquesting.desc: The inventory relay can access the inventory of non-stationary entities, such as minecarts.

betterquesting.name: Double Sided Cable Camouflage
betterquesting.desc: Double sided cable camouflage blocks allows setting the inside face of the cable block, allowing you to imitate glass.

betterquesting.name: Transforming Cable Camouflage
betterquesting.desc: Transforming Cable Camouflage allows you to change the collision box of the cable, so you can turn it into a door or whatever.

betterquesting.name: Advanced Inventory Relay
betterquesting.desc: An Advanced Inventory Relay can add/remove items from a player's inventory.

betterquesting.name: Learning curve? Where we're going there are no curves
betterquesting.desc:
Only dangerous cliffs to fly off. TecTech can be the source of adventures, scary and satisfying. 

Thanks to Piky/Scripted for giving you some guardrails to stay on the road. Scripted/Piky shed blood over these quests for you. Now it's your turn!

For additional details on TecTech, check out the wiki at https://github.com/Technus/TecTech/wiki

betterquesting.name: The Beginning of the End Game
betterquesting.desc:
Welcome to TecTech! The pinnacle of absolute high-tier machinery for all your end-tier needs. However, learning TecTech is incredibly confusing, so listen very carefully. 

First, you'll need to gather various casings for your machines that you'll need. High Power Casings, Computer Casings, and Computer Vents will do, though you'll require a large amount of them before proceeding onward.

betterquesting.name: Quantum Computer
betterquesting.desc:
One of the more incredibly complicated machines, this will serve as the main structure for your "Computation" generation for the giant Research Station. First, you'll need a few things, the Quantum Computer itself, a huge energy hatch several amps of UV or above, this is because as Computer Racks, that'll be explained later on down here, will continuously increase the demand of energy input for every new Computer Rack that you add on. The Multiblock also consumes a large amount of energy by itself. Another important factor is ONLY turn on the Quantum Computer once you have the desired recipes for the Research Station ready to avoid excess energy loss. In order for you to build this absolute monster, you'll need to place down the Quantum Computer at least 1 block above the surface/ground and use the Multiblock Machine Blueprint, this will give you a hefty amount of information and various ghost-like blocks that'll show where casings and or hatches should go.

Computation:
Computation is generated every second and is based on the tier of your circuit. There are, however, differences in between how much computation is generated, even with the same exact tier. For instance, you could use a Master Quantum Computer (Quantum Circuit Series / LuV) or a Wetwareprocessor (Wetware Circuit Series / LuV) which will give you more Computation even though they are of the same tier. If you wish to find out exactly how much Computation a circuit gives; place down a Computer Rack, put a circuit inside and scan it. It will include the following information
Base computation: 
After overclocking: <numbers, same as above unless you specially overclock it>
Heat Accumulated: <numbers, based on circuits and heat vents, keep a watchful eye on this part as it's extremely important>

Computer Racks:
The main component within the multiblock to generate Computation. In order to achieve this, you will need to input some circuits and heat vents; Advanced Heat Vents work best. It is critical that you use Heat Vents to prevent the heat from reaching a catastrophic point, 55 percent or above should be avoided for safety reasons. Technically, you could achieve "55 percent" in your Computer Racks, but in reality, they could explode around 4000-4999 heat. In order to precisely find out how much heat, you'll need a Parametrizer, which will be explained later. Now that you've understood one of the more basic concepts and safety of handling within the Computer Racks (scan the Racks before you run the Quantum Computer!), what are the more optimal setups for your Quantum Computer? Do keep in mind that even a 128 min Computation / Sec setup can complete practically 3/4th's of the recipes within the Research Station. In this case, a 4 Computer Rack setup with 1 Advanced Heat Vent and 3 Wetwareprocessors (LuV) will generate 72 Computation every second; leading up to a maximum of 288 Computation every second at just 5 amps of UV (524,288 EU/t) with only 4 Computer Racks required. This is a rather minimal setup compared to some of the more complicated setups.

And most importantly: DO NOT WRENCH THE COMPUTER RACKS IF THEY HAVE HEAT IN THEM. Scan them before anything else! Otherwise, you're going to get an explosion.

Uncertainty Resolver
Much like a puzzle-solving simulation, it is rather complicated to explain how to solve it, but it's often best just to retrace or undo certain actions and hope for the best. Sometimes, the Schr�dinger Status will require some puzzle solving again after a period of time. This is random and incredibly frustrating especially during operations being done between the Research Station and Quantum Computer(s), so it is important to constantly check the Uncertainty Resolver before you start operations on your Computer.

Now that you understand some of this, it is time to build the Computer! You'll need to gather quite a lot of resources at first.

betterquesting.name: Research Station
betterquesting.desc:
Now that you've started building up your precious Quantum Computer, how about the giant Research Station? Once again, using the Multiblock Machine Blueprint will tell you how to build this Multiblock. Once it is nearly assembled, place down an Energy Hatch, an Optical Slave Connector, and a Maintenance Hatch all on the back side. Once fully assembled, you can now begin operating recipes at any given time, so long as the Quantum Computer is also active. This Research Station requires you to put the desired item within the Object Holder, then a data stick in the Multiblock interface itself. Once the Computation is fully completed, the data stick that houses all the data of the completed item will be inside the Multiblock Interface. Still confused? Good, that's the spirit of learning! Always make sure to test these things in Single Player if you wish to find exact measurements and such. 

Don't forget to ALWAYS COLOR THE OPTICAL HATCHES AND FIBERS!

betterquesting.name: Sign Updater
betterquesting.desc: The Sign Updater allows your MIM to update an external display of information.

betterquesting.name: Item Valve
betterquesting.desc: The Item Valve allows your factory manager to suck in dropped items from around them in a 3x3x3 cube.  Or you can use them to push items out into the world in the direction they are pointing.

betterquesting.name: Rapid Item Valve
betterquesting.desc: Rapid Item Valves can pick up items in the world without any delays.

betterquesting.name: Cable Cluster
betterquesting.desc:
The cable cluster allows you to combine as many of the other cables together into one block. You could have a redstone receiver and emitter and a inventory relay all in one block.
This cable is a "terminal" cable. It does not extend the MIM beyond it.

betterquesting.name: Advanced Cable Cluster
betterquesting.desc: The Advanced Cable Cluster will also act as an Inventory cable, extended the range of your MIM.

betterquesting.name: §6§lAll those chunks, all in a row
betterquesting.desc:
Sometimes you don't want a 3x3 area chunkloaded, but a long straight line instead.  This can be handy for rail lines or power lines coming from long distances.  An anchor sentinel can perform this function.  Right-click on a chunk loader with a crowbar, and it will activate. Go in any straight line from the chunkloader and place the anchor and hit it with the crowbar. Those chunks, up to 25x1, will now remain loaded.

This will draw an amount of chunkloader time relative to the 9 chunk area normally loaded. If for some reason you wanted only a 1 chunk area loaded, this will extend the time. Stock up on those pearls or server coins!

betterquesting.name: Redstone Receiver
betterquesting.desc: The Redstone Receiver reads redstone signals on each of its 6 faces.

betterquesting.name: Block Gate
betterquesting.desc: The Block Gate can break pickup, or place blocks.

betterquesting.name: Block Detector
betterquesting.desc: The Block Detector allows your MIM to detect when a Block update has occured.

betterquesting.name: §9§a§lCutting up stuff at EV
betterquesting.desc: Now that you are EV you are going to need a more advanced cutting machine. Better get one built.

betterquesting.name: The Basics of SFM
betterquesting.desc:
Variables - Declaration vs Standard
Declaration is simply creating a variable with eligible blocks in it. This allows easy updating of workflows. For instance you could have a variable that contains 2 chests. You use it in a nifty for each loop and later add another chest. Simply update the variable and the for each loop will start using it.

Standard variables are able to be inserted into the middle of a workflow (it has input/output) and thus can be modified on the run.

Please note that for each loops will require a empty variable to work with. This is listed as "Element" in the loop.

Global vs Local
Global will keep changes to a variable that are done in the workflow, whereas local keeps anything done local to that part of the workflow.

betterquesting.name: A magical box
betterquesting.desc: This magical box is amazing. No matter how many are created, they all seem to connect to the same dimension.  I can store items in one location, and pull them out somewhere else! I can use dyes on the top of the box to assign its location, and any box with the same colors will share the same space. Using a diamond on the box locks it my mind, and a private network.  Shift-rightclicking will remove the diamond and join the chest back to the public network.

betterquesting.name: A magical tank
betterquesting.desc: This tank always seems to connect to the same dimensional space.  No matter how many I create.  I can push fluids into the tank in one dimension, and retrieve them in a totally different dimension! I have discovered a way to assign a location to each tank using dyes applied to the top.  Using a diamond makes the tank private, attuned to the caster's mind, and will not share fluids with any other player's tanks. Shift-rightclicking recovers the diamond and makes the tank part of the public tank network. The dial on front controls the input/output of the tank. When blue is up, the tank accepts fluids.  When orange is up, the tank will eject fluids.

betterquesting.name: That chest is too big to carry around
betterquesting.desc: Instead of chest you have to keep placing and breaking, how about a nice convenient pouch you can use? You'll have to synchronize it with the chest you want to link with.  To set it to a new chest, sneak-click with the pouch on a new chest.

betterquesting.name: §b§a§lMore power needed, sir!
betterquesting.desc: EBF and LCR recipes are going to need even more power.  You'll need to craft EV energy hatches to supply them and keep them running.

betterquesting.name: §c§lAssline quest updates
betterquesting.desc: When the pack updates, and changes an assembly line recipe, your old data sticks become useless. However it's more than that, you can't simply rescan an old UV motor for the new UHV data, you need a new UV motor. It's best to start with component parts in the lowest changed tier, then work your way up until you've rescanned up to your current tier. Yes, this sucks, we also wish there was another way. You can tell if your data stick is out of date by seeing if the nei recipe matches the one in the data viewer. Nei will always be right.

betterquesting.name: GT++ knowledge
betterquesting.desc: To become a master at GT++ you will need to craft manuals for certain machines.

betterquesting.name: §3§lBetter way to find items
betterquesting.desc:
NEI has a built in search feature for finding an item stored in an inventory nearby.  A Stockroom Catalog can give you a list of everything stored in your inventories.
 
Sneak right-click a block with an inventory (a chest, bookcase, barrel, anything with an inventory) to add that inventory to the list of inventories for the catalog to keep track of. Sneak right-click the same block again to remove that block from the list.
A small particle effect will render on any block that has been selected with the catalog when holding the Stockroom Catalog to let you know that block is being tracked.

Right click to open the GUI and see the list.
You can sort the list in ascending or descending order by quantity (Count) or alphabetical order.

You can also see a list of all the inventories that have a particular item and easily add the location of one of those inventories to a stockroom catalog so you can easily find your stuff.

The Stockroom Catalog can also be copied with the typesetting table and printing press.

Click on the title to change it to anything so you can custom label your stockroom catalog.

Click on the small chest icons on the right hand side of each listing to open the inventory list view. 

If you want, you can craft a waypoint compass and use that to point you towards the chest. Since we have Journeymaps and NEI, it's not really necessary.

betterquesting.name: §6§lThermal Boiler - Lava you long time
betterquesting.desc:
If you want energy from lava and the byproducts, the Thermal Boiler is the perfect solution. It processes lava super fast for steam, and with a lava filter will provide centrifuged lava byproducts as well. A great source of copper, silver, gold, tin, tantalum, and tungstate.
You can get even better efficiency pairing it with a Large Heat Exchanger.  The LHE will turn normal vanilla lava into pahoehoe, which will provide steam and byproducts in the Thermal Boiler. Win/Win/Win!

betterquesting.name: I think I'm going to be sick
betterquesting.desc: The Industrial Centrifuge is the solution to those thousands of ore you are getting with the multiblock ore drill.

betterquesting.name: Bask in the currents
betterquesting.desc:
The best source for hundreds of thousands of glass for...something?  I dunno, think of something interesting and impress me!

The "effective" voltage for the High Current Arc furnace is one tier lower than the energy hatch. For example, with an MV tier energy hatch, it will do LV tier arc furnace recipes.

This machine also does plasma arc furnace recipes.

betterquesting.name: Bate Bate Chocolate
betterquesting.desc:
Abuela, will you teach us the chocolate song?
Con mucho gusto
Will you sing the chocolate song with us?
Great, sing along with Abuela!

Bate bate chocolate
Bate bate chocolate
Bate bate chocolate
Bate bate chocolate

Mix your chocolate, chocolate
Mix your chocolate, chocolate
Bate bate chocolate
Bate bate chocolate

betterquesting.name: Play doh for big girls and boys
betterquesting.desc:
I never wanna grow up, I wanna play with my mega extrusion machine.
And in case you didn't read the description in NEI: You can use multiple input busses with a different extruder shape in each and then throw the items to extrude into the bus with the appropriate shape.

betterquesting.name: Best thing since sliced bread
betterquesting.desc:
When all you have is a machine full of knives, everything starts looking like bread.  

Bluebine 2019!

betterquesting.name: A 9 in 1 machine, what a steal!
betterquesting.desc:
This machine has 3 modes, capable of emulating 9 of the less common machines.
The 3 general modes are cycled by using a screwdriver on the controller. Each of the modes can support 2 or 3 different machine selected by putting a circuit into the same input bus as the items you want to process. If you have a look at the description of the controller in NEI, you will see a list of the supported machines for each mode. These are in order and can be used with circuit numbers 20, 21 and 22. This also means that you can use multiple input busses with different circuits to use the full potential of the machine. You can also use more busses to use different non-consumable items in the recipes.

betterquesting.name: ZzzZZZzzzZtt
betterquesting.desc: Need lots of oxygen or hydrogen, or just want to rip apart materials for tons of aluminium?

betterquesting.name: Frozen Stiff
betterquesting.desc: I'm so cold...

betterquesting.name: Forge of the Gods
betterquesting.desc: The Volcanus Advanced EBF will process items faster than you can believe.

betterquesting.name: Spools and spools
betterquesting.desc: Need enough wire to go around the world? Here you go.

betterquesting.name: Bender more bending
betterquesting.desc: When you need plates by the thousands.

betterquesting.name: Bezos would be proud
betterquesting.desc: The Amazon Warehousing Depot is the ultimate for all your packing needs. Got tiny and small dusts coming out of your ears? This is the machine for you.

betterquesting.name: Industrial Coke Oven
betterquesting.desc: Swimming in logs? Turn those logs into clean burning charcoal!

betterquesting.name: §c§lChickens my boy, the future is in chickens
betterquesting.desc: Future wetware processors are going to need stemcells....lots of them.  Luckily there is way to infuse a normal, harmless chicken embryo with genetic mutagen to make it a perfect source for these stemcells. Once the egg has matured it has a small chance of turning into a giant chicken spawn egg. This giant chicken will now lay eggs that can be disassembled for stemcells or allowed to mature to make more giant chickens. Killing the giant chicken may also give you eggs.

betterquesting.name: So thirsty
betterquesting.desc: Just listening to this tank gulp water makes me thirsty. If placed next to a water source block, it is a decent water source. It also supports several upgrades to speed and capacity. Try out this glyph near your cows, and get a tank full of milk for all your cheese and butter needs.

betterquesting.name: §6§lBorax Electrolyzing
betterquesting.desc: Now that you have an MV Electrolyzer, you can extract Boron from Borax. This element is used later on for Borosilicate Glass and fiber, but for now you can use it to make some volumetric flasks to hold precise amounts. This is handy for recipes that may only need a tiny amount of a substance, like 1L.

betterquesting.name: §6§lMega is Betta
betterquesting.desc:
For someone who needs to blast a truly *ridiculous* amount of stuff, this is the machine for you.  This monster machine can handle up to 256 parallel recipes at a time.
The glass tier (search NEI for Glass-Tier: HV for an example) sets the maximum energy hatch tier for this machine.

betterquesting.name: §6§lFrostbite!
betterquesting.desc: This mega vac freezer can handle up to 256 items.

betterquesting.name: A better fluid pie
betterquesting.desc: Now that you have lead you can convert your bronze pipes to potin pipes with higher capacties.

betterquesting.name: §6§lBulk Programming
betterquesting.desc: Tired of having to use NEI to figure out how to program your circuits? This block will allow you to simply choose the circuit number. It can be automated.

betterquesting.name: Moss
betterquesting.desc: Given up on looking for moss in the Twilight Forest? You can easily grow a crop that will give you the various mosses, perfect for your Tinker's tools. Start with a lilypad.

betterquesting.name: Energy Buffers
betterquesting.desc: Your research into energy has lead you to energy buffers - a single block that can store enormous amounts, and is also portable. Better than a battery, these devices can be configured to output 1-16A. Using a high-amp transformer, that means you can up tier 2 tiers with these devices. This HV energy buffer can power an HV machine for several hours, or an EV machine for almost an hour. Perfect for mining operations in far off dimensions.

betterquesting.name: Greedy Chest
betterquesting.desc: The Greedy Chest from Automagy looks to have some interesting uses. It also gates a pretty important device for a magician...

betterquesting.name: Another way to Ethanol
betterquesting.desc: Using a fermenter with excess saplings or other garbage will give you Forestry biomass. Higher Sappiness trait on your trees will get you better results.

betterquesting.name: Why no, this is not fit for human consumption
betterquesting.desc: Taking the biomass from the Fermenter and using it in a still will give you Ethanol. Not really worth it for power, but useful if you want to turn it into ethylene.  You could set it up on an old steam setup with nothing better to do to get a more useful power source out of it, or use the Ethanol to power the setup and the forestry farm.

betterquesting.name: Empty the oceans
betterquesting.desc: If you stuck with fish for biodiesel this long, you can now make the Zhuhai Fishing Port to get cartloads of fish and other byproducts.

betterquesting.name: Putting all those workers out of jobs
betterquesting.desc: The large scale auto-assembler will put things together for you, in volume. It is an Assembler, Disassembler, and Autocrafter all in one.

betterquesting.name: Better fermenter outputs
betterquesting.desc: With a Squeezer you can boost the output from your fermenter, saving on Fertilzer or Mulch and getting more per sapling. There's a variety of crops you can use to make fruit juice, so have fun breeding.

betterquesting.name: §3§lJacques Cousteau
betterquesting.desc:
Now that you have a Scuba Helmet you can safely explore underwater for long periods of time. You just need some compressed air cells.  I'll trade you some Tin ingots for a few compressed air cells.

As your air drops, the helmet will take a compressed air cell and give back an empty cell. Throw these cells into your compressor and you can easily gather clay from beneath rivers. You'll be able to make more cells later once you get an extruder or a plate bender.

betterquesting.name: "Oh magic" armor II
betterquesting.desc: Steeleaf armor is the next level in Twilight Forest armor. It can be handy as a defense in the Nether.

betterquesting.name: "Oh magic" armor III
betterquesting.desc: Knightmetal is the top tier Twilight Forest armor. It doesn't come with any free enchants but it has high durability and high armor rating

betterquesting.name: Knightmetal
betterquesting.desc: Knightmetal ingots are loot taken from Goblin Knight Strongholds. They can be made into Diamond-tier armor. You can take Armor Shards and turn them into Knightmetal ingots.

betterquesting.name: Flying like....Mary Poppins?
betterquesting.desc: The Thaumostatic Harness grants you flight, using up Potentia from a jar. The speed isn't great though, so perhaps further research will yield some results.

betterquesting.name: Flying with the greatest of ease
betterquesting.desc: Ahh that's better.  With this girdle you can really fly around like a true wizard. It does take a little extra potentia to use though, so keep an eye on your flying time.

betterquesting.name: Working while flying?
betterquesting.desc: With these devices you can now fly and work at the same time without penalty.  They can be found in the Witching Gadgets tab of the book. You will need a Swiftness potion for this device.

betterquesting.name: Long distance power delivery
betterquesting.desc:
No mage wants to be restricted to short flying times. With this spire from the Automagy discipline you can transmit magical energy directy to your flying harness. To get the correct Thaumium block, compress 9 ingots to get the GT Thaumium block and then chisel that block to get the correct type.

This multiblock requires centi-vis to operate. You can use 2-6 Thaumostatic Pylons, with additional pylons extending the range. Provide the construct Aer centi-vis to operate, and will accept Potentia essentia to transfer to flyers. The construct will also accept Aer and Volatus essentia to increase the range and rate of transfer, respectively. Right-click the sides of the controller to control which type of essentia each side will accept.

betterquesting.name: Healing your nodes
betterquesting.desc: Many of the nodes of the wild have damage, and unjarring a captured node can also cause damage. The Node Manipulator can help you recover the nodes to full strength, and increase their recharge speed.

betterquesting.name: Clothes makes the magical woman or man
betterquesting.desc: The Witching Gadgets Spinning Wheel will unlock plenty of useful materials and items. Hopefully without that creep Rumpelstiltskin! Make sure you get the WG Spinning Wheel and not the Witchery version.

betterquesting.name: Flying like a eagl - I mean raven
betterquesting.desc: This cloak will be a nice substitute for the Glider. There are plenty of other magical items worth a look in the Witching Gadgets tab.

betterquesting.name: Everything fuzzy? Try some lenses
betterquesting.desc: Now that you have Goggles of Revealing, Thaumic Horizons offers various lenses with handy uses. This one will grant night vision. Try out some of the others.

betterquesting.name: Disenchanted
betterquesting.desc: If you found an item or book with a good enchantment - but also a bunch of garbage, you can strip the enchantments into separate books using a Disenchanter. Surround it with bookcases to reduce damage done to the item.

betterquesting.name: §9§lHot hot hot!
betterquesting.desc: Once you build your vacuum freezer, you are going to have to carry around hot ingots all the time.  Your old gloves are falling apart, and take up both hands. I think there's a way you can glue them together so you can carry hot items with just one hand. Give these a try.

betterquesting.name: So you want to go slower...wait, what?
betterquesting.desc: Sometimes you need to go slow so you don't fall off the top of your spire. Or you don't want to accidentally sprint in your fields and trample your crops.  Maybe you don't want to have to hold sneak all the time. This bauble will weigh you down - keeping you from accidentally sprinting, and can be activated to enable/disable sneaking.

betterquesting.name: §c§lPanning for gold is for chumps
betterquesting.desc: Now that you have reached LuV you can make the god-tier prospector - The Electric Prospector.  This handheld machine can provide detailed information on ores in the area, and return maps of how much fluid and what type is in each chunk.

betterquesting.name: Planetary Tears
betterquesting.desc:
Indeed you will be crying over all the tiers you have to do for planets. Here is a handy reference.

Tier 1 - Needs Oxygen Gear
Moon

Tier 2 - Requires Thermal Padding
Mars
Phobos
Deimos

Tier 3 - Requires Tier 2 Thermal Padding
Ceres
Asteroids
Europa
Ganymeade
Callisto
Ross128b - Habitable Planet (need no Oxygen Gear/thermal padding)

Tier 4 - Need tier 2 thermal padding
Io
Mercury
Venus - Needs SpaceSuit

Tier 5 -Need tier 2 thermal padding
Enceladus
Titan
Miranda
Oberon

Tier 6 -Need tier 2 thermal padding
Proteus
Triton

Tier 7 -Need tier 2 thermal padding
Pluto
Haumea
Makemake
Kuiper Belt

Tier 8 -Need tier 2 thermal padding
Alpha Centauri Bb - Requires SpaceSuit
Tau Ceti E - Habitable Planet (need no Oxygen Gear/thermal padding)
Vega B
Barnarda C - Habitable Planet (need no Oxygen Gear/thermal padding)
Barnarda E
Barnarda F

betterquesting.name: Time to kill (Bat)
betterquesting.desc: ...Did you expect a raid boss of some kind? If you count the number of bats you'll encounter and kill, then probably yes.

betterquesting.name: Time to kill (Dire Wolf)
betterquesting.desc: These kinds of wolves do not take kindly to you marching close to them or offering them bones! Neutral at first, but extremely hostile upon approaching close to them and dangerous. They'll rip the bones right off ya! Found within snowy forest biomes.

betterquesting.name: Time to kill (Hellhound)
betterquesting.desc: Aggressive and can apply fire, although not a fast enemy either. Recommendation, avoid melee combat and offerings of bones.

betterquesting.name: Time to kill (Magma Cube)
betterquesting.desc: Now a Hell version of your slime! Always appears with Infernal status.

betterquesting.name: Time to kill (Slime)
betterquesting.desc: Sticky and bouncy! Now in many variations. Say hello to my little friend, Lemon Slice!

betterquesting.name: Time to kill (Silverfish)
betterquesting.desc: Be wary, they like to disguise and clone themselves in stone-related blocks! (Applies to Vanilla blocks only) Can be found within dungeons. Can also be found in Drowning Creeper spawned cobblestone blocks.

betterquesting.name: Hey is that a friendly bumblebee?
betterquesting.desc: Aieee, no it's not, it's a nether wasp, kill it kill it kill it!

betterquesting.name: Chocolate is bad for you...
betterquesting.desc: ...but sure is great for production! Chocolate frames in apiaries and alvearies will boost output, but cause shortened life. This can be useful for the devious beekeeper...

betterquesting.name: Welcome to Biology Class!
betterquesting.desc:
Binnie's Genetics mod will allow you to pick and chose traits for bees, trees and Botany flowers. But not for free! Doing this comes at a price.

It is better to provide power to an Enderio capacitor and then power these machines with RF, instead of powering directly with GT EU.

betterquesting.name: Making bees more comfortable
betterquesting.desc:
The acclimatiser is a key machine for breeding your bees.  With lots of energy and the appropriate ingredients you can toughen your bees to thrive anywhere. However, even with climate hardiness your bees still won't produce special items unless they are in their favorite climate. Along with the bee, put in these items to adjust the bee's traits:

snowball - More temp tolerance
sand - More dry tolerance
water - More wet tolerance

For water, it is best to use wax capsules made from beeswax, the acclimatiser doesn't return cells.

betterquesting.name: Such pretty leaves...
betterquesting.desc:
Now that you have entered MV you can begin breeding Forestry trees the smart way. Start by getting a Treealyzer, and scanning some common vanilla trees like oak, dark oak, spruce, birch, acacia, and jungle saplings. You will need to gather honey or honeydew drops from bee combs to power the Treealyzer. 

If you want to bulk scan saplings, you can feed them through a GT scanner filled with honey.

If you have reached MV, you can try the Slice and Splice tab for information on Genetics.

betterquesting.name: Collecting the hybrids
betterquesting.desc:
If you got lucky and found some bees in a village, put them in their housings next to some trees. Over time the bees will slowly pollinate the leaves of the trees. Using a grafter you can break the leaf blocks to retrieve the sapling. You can trade with villagers to get proven grafters that have a longer lifetime. Also investigate magic, you have heard rumors of long lasting grafters available to magicians. 

GregTech also offers a really nice tool, the Branch Cutter.

betterquesting.name: Seeing the fruits of your labors
betterquesting.desc: It can be difficult to see which leafy blocks are pollinated. Craft a pair of spectacles to get a better view.

betterquesting.name: §6§lGrinding heads are better than none
betterquesting.desc: While the SAG mill will work with no grinding heads, flint heads only save a little power.  If you want to exploit the true capability of the SAG mill, you want to use Diamond or Tungsten grinding heads.  Craft me a Diamond and I'll give you a Tungsten as a reward.

betterquesting.name: §3§lKey to your heart
betterquesting.desc: Barrels by default allow locking the barrel to a specific item, even when empty.  For drawers however you will need to make the Drawer Key to lock its content types.

betterquesting.name: Incubator
betterquesting.desc:
This is a crafting machine that heats items and liquids to a temperature that encourages bacterial growth. 

The first step of incubation is the creation of Liquid Growth Medium, which is made from incubating Water and Growth Medium. This is subsequently incubated with Wheat to give Bacteria. This solution of bacteria can then be incubated a third time with Sugar to give Enzyme. This is an important compound used in other machines.

The best way to create enzyme is therefore to chain three incubators together, for each step of the process.

betterquesting.name: Bees by the millions
betterquesting.desc: If you need endgame high speed bee production, industrial apiaries are the path to follow. Industrial Apiaries take upgrade frames that never break. Production frames can be stacked up to 8 high. It also has many options for emulation, more pollen retrieval, and others.

betterquesting.name: Fastest way to get there
betterquesting.desc: A GT++ Mutagenic frame will get your bees to their final destination faster than you can blink. Just remember to wear your rubber suit while making it!

betterquesting.name: Upgrading the Alveary (tier 1)
betterquesting.desc:
These basic upgrades to the Alveary make it more powerful. 

Frame housing - Automation-enabled frames for the Alveary
Swarmer - Creates additional Ignoble queens in hives around the Alveary
Hygroregulator - Controls for humidity, and to a lesser extent temperature. Will require lava or water.
Stabilizer - Prevents the princess or queen from changing species. Ideal for breeding traits into a line.
Sieve - Instead of the pollen from a bee fertilizing a nearby tree, it is stored here and can be manually applied. Requires manually placing woven silk in the inventory.
Rain shield - Keeps bees that are not rain tolerant dry and working.
Hatchery - Hatches larval bees for use in Genetics or to create additional drones.

betterquesting.name: Busy Bees Buzzing Boldly
betterquesting.desc:
These upgrades can significantly increase your production rate by keeping your bees from stopping production.
Transmission - Provides power to frame blocks that need it throughout the alveary.
Alveary Fan - Cools your temperature a large amount.
Alveary Heater - Warms your temperature a large amount.
Lighting - Provides light for bees that do not work at night.

betterquesting.name: A stim a day keeps the doctor awake
betterquesting.desc:
Supporting circuit boards that can hold 4 electron tubes, the Electrical Stimulator provides a variety of functions. All numbers are in percent

LV - Prod: 150 (Max 500) - Iron ET
HV - Prod: 250 (Max 1000) - Diamantine ET
Biotic - Poll: 150 (Max 500) - Apatine ET
Charged - Life: 80 (Min 20) - Obsidian ET
Gentle - Life: 150 (Max 500) - Lapis ET
Molten - Simulates the Nether - Blazing ET
Mutagenic - Muta: 150 (Max 500) - Golden ET
Inhibiting - Terr: 40 (Min 10) Prod: 90 (Min 50) - Tin ET
Agitating - Terr: 150 (Max 500) - Bronze ET

betterquesting.name: X-Men, or should I say X-Bee?
betterquesting.desc:
The Mutator can vastly accelerate genetic mutations, even allowing those ultra rare bees to be bred. Items inserted into the Mutator control how much mutation it causes.

Soul Sand - 50 percent increase
Ender Pearl - 100 percent increase
Eye of Ender - 300 percent increase
Nether star - 1000 percent increase

betterquesting.name: Genepool
betterquesting.desc: Another important resource is Raw DNA. This can be obtained from any breedable organism such as bees, trees or flowers, and is created in the Genepool. The Genepool requires both Ethanol and Enzyme to digest the DNA, and will destroy the organism. Note this gives raw DNA, and does not preserve any genes or alleles present.

betterquesting.name: Isolator
betterquesting.desc: The Isolator acts in a similar way to the Genepool, but does not completely destroy genes. It instead allows the isolation of a single gene from an organism, without destroying it. The exact gene is random, and is written into an Blank Sequence. Until the sequence is analysed in an Analyser, it will be unknown what the gene is. It doesn't however need to be analysed before being sent to the Sequencer.

betterquesting.name: Sequencer
betterquesting.desc:
After obtaining a DNA Sequence with the gene that you wish, it must be placed in the Sequencer. This uses Fluorescent Dye to determine the correct sequence, and when completed logs the discovery. The important thing here is that the discovery goes to the person who placed the machine.

Genes are sequenced faster if the sequence has been placed in a Polymeriser first to increase the strength.

betterquesting.name: Polymeriser
betterquesting.desc: Serums and sequences can be placed in a Polymeriser to increase their strength and amount of DNA held within. Serums need to be polymerised at least once before being used in the inoculator. To polymerise, both Raw DNA and Polymerising Bacteria are required. Raw DNA is obtained from the Genepool, and Polymerising Bacteria is made from incubating bacteria with bonemeal. Gold nuggets can be used as a catalyst to speed up the process.

betterquesting.name: Gene Database
betterquesting.desc: Discovered genes are logged into the Gene Database. This handheld device lists all genes by the type of organism they apply to.
